yKk39yvKs2hrq9HJjvCy1A.text: ****Short version: Went Fri for lunch around 12:30. By the time we came out at 1:45 we were still hungry and were exhausted from dealing with slow and unbelievably rude waitress. She did not check on us, my husband's drink stayed empty, had to physically go flag her down. When we mentioned the slowness of our order, she came up with every nonsense excuse she could and was downright rude to us saying she could bring us the check even though we only received 1/2 of our order.  ****With Details: We were seated at one of the booths tucked in the back. The waitress came by a little later to get our drink order and our first round of sushi order. The rule of the All-you-can-eat lunch, as stated on the menu, is that you can order 10 items at a time per person and if you don't finish your food, you will be charged extra - which is all fair considering no one wants to waste food. We waited for a bit and another waiter brought our first round of order. Now, during previous visits, we learned that the wait can be awhile for the order to come out so we always went ahead and placed a second round of order while we're eating the first order. But today by the time we were finished eating the first order and my husband's drink had been empty for awhile, the waitress never showed so my husband had to go find her to come to our table. We were fine with this. So we finally place a second round of order and waited for approx 30 minutes. When we realized that another party near us received their order awhile ago even though we placed an order before them, we flagged our waitress down and asked about our order. She said the other table got their sushi order first because they also ordered hibachi. Oooookay so if we order hibachi too somehow our sushi will be ready faster?? How does this make sense? We also ordered spring rolls and that hadn't come out either. She kept saying they are REALLY busy and they are working on our order. So we waited longer and still, no sushi. Once again the waitress kept saying they are REALLY REALLY busy and so I commented that we shouldn't have to wait this long just because they are understaffed, and she rudely said "we are NOT understaffed, we are just really busy." Funny because the restaurant had less people there by that time compared to when we got our first order. She made it sound like she didn't do anything wrong at all and blamed everything else but herself. We did not appreciate her attitude so we told her if she had just checked up on us even once after the first round of order, we would have placed our second order sooner. Instead of acknowledging the fact that she never came by, she downright ACCUSED us of trying to break the "rules" and said we still had food left from the first order when we flagged her down to place the second order and by rule as it states on the menu she cannot take a second orders until we are finished eating the first order. First of all, I had ONE piece of nigiri on my plate when she was taking the second order and that was because we hadn't placed the second order yet and were eating intentionally slowly since we knew it might take a bit until the second order comes out, and we didn't want to be too long without any food. Second of all, nowhere on the menu does it state that we cannot place a second order when we are not done with the first order. And after eating there a few times before, we know the amount of food we can handle and we've always placed our second order right when we received the first order, and no one had a problem with this before. By the third time she came by again without our order, out of nowhere she actually asked us if we just wanted our check. Excuse me?? We told her we haven't finished eating and she said "you had your first order and it was a big enough order." Did she seriously just say that?? It was uttering shocking. So finally she came by for the fourth time without our sushi, she said her manager okay'ed for us to pay 1/2 price. By this time we were tired of waiting and also tired of "arguing" with her, so we said fine. As she was leaving to get our check, another server finally brought our second order but we refused it since we had decided to leave. I guess that server was confused and told the owner that we wouldn't accept the order and the owner (Brian?) came by our table and asked what was going on. We ended up talking to him for about 5 minutes about what happened. He was trying in his own ways to make things better but it sounded more like he was making excuses for their slow service even saying one of his sushi chefs is really slow and that might explain why we didn't get our order for a long time when other tables did. He went ahead and took care of the bill even though we said we will pay.  We appreciated his attempt to fix the situation, but after such a frustrating and insulting experience with the waitress, it isn't enough for us to return to this restaurant.

feQCcruJhMMtrJqfhRxLQg.text: Bad sushi, cheap manager. All you can eat sushi is a joke.  Tuna looked black, eal looked ill, rice 80%, fish 20%. Menu for all you can eat is poor. Only few selections for nigiri. It does say on the menu that you will be charged for wasted food, so i decided not to waste any and only left 50% of rice from 8 pieces of nigiri that i ordered, because rice tasted old and chewy.  I went to the chef and asked to put less rise in my next order. To my surprise sushi came with visibly more rise. In my bill i found a charge of 8 dollars for wasted rice. Rude manager said it was her who advised the waiter to add the charge and that we were warned and if  i wanted to eat less rice i needed to order from a regular menu and refused to wave the extra fee, saying that she is sorry  , but has to protect the restaurant. I have had sushi a la card and all you can eat  in many different cities, i know what i m talking about. Take your business somewhere else.

NvOzStJJqzba_xMFaxsODA.text: One of my favorite spots in Charlotte for sushi! Their sushi lunch buffet is delicious and garlic noodles are a must. Try out their mixed drinks as they always have something new and fresh! The sushi is very fresh and the atmosphere is unique in Charlotte. Their new lounge and jellyfish tank are must-see while enjoying Pisces' food.

f1GM59jUZe-P3kHLHOOGiw.text: Sorry to see so many poor reviews based on the service. I've never had a problem with service at Pisces. In fact, they've always alerted me ahead of time when I've ordered something that takes a while to cook. Having just moved from CA a year ago, this is easily the best sushi I've had in Charlotte. I hope the strangely poor reviews do not dissuade anybody from stopping by.

KdgqW_TNs1glkfy7iHPy2g.text: My favorite Sushi place in Charlotte - the sushi is always super fresh, creative, and delicious. The Screaming O roll is awesome.  Love the option of sitting in the Japanese style booths.

ynWrUU4nVvaiObmlVyOn-A.text: I had dinner there with a friend. Love the decor and the service was realy good. The fillet appetizer was absolutly amazing definitly want that again! We both got the hibachi chicken it was considerably over done and dry but I could tell that the flavors would have been spot on if it wan't so over cooked. The sake was served hot the way it's supposed to be. Overall I will be back!

2vyatbY-a-LgEUB91PuGCw.text: Was here recently and loved it!  Not too expensive (same prices as Enso etc).  Go on a Monday when they have 1/2 price bottles of wine!  I love the chic atmosphere, in the back there are these honeycomb type booths that are private and make you feel like you are on a spaceship.  The staff is super sweet and gave us free shots of something fuity and delicious when we were there.   Love it!!!

CY1-MNT8ueWeHtZzmoNxWA.text: Just ate here for the last day of restaurant week, good thing it was the last day or i would have had to go back.  First of all the restaurant week menu was generous (which honestly was a tie breaker about where to go when some places are getting stingy with the offerings, i.e. steak places where you need to pay extra for a steak).  The atmosphere was cool without being pretentious.  The service was very good and the food was excellent all around.  We enjoyed dumplings, filet stacker, tuna w/ seaweed salad, scallop hibachi and two specialty rolls.  While everything was very good, the sushi was definitely the star of the meal and as good as anything we have had in Charlotte.  We will definitely be coming back.    The only thing that could have taken away from the experience was the prospect of parking in the Met parking garage, but we went late on a Sunday and got lucky.  That parking garage is definitely the worst in Charlotte.

e_cm0QfqaVuwdyjCzamBHA.text: I again found myself getting outta work at a totally unreasonable hour.  I was hungry and in need of a much deserved cocktail.  It was around 9:30PM or 10PM and a bit late for anything heavy.  So, we kind of stumbled onto this place.  It is small and cute and a quite place to unload the days drama and enjoy eachother's company.   We sat at the sushi bar but they do have really cute little booths that are very private.  It was Wednesday night and the waiter tells us about the $4 Martini special.  Are you kidding.... yes please!  So, I drink my Orange Something Martini that was yummy yummy yummy and ordered the Miso soup and the Veggie Roll in the non-seaweed roll.  It was excellent.  Our waiter was quick to bring the refills and I left there in a much better mood then when I arrived.  Much love for Pisces....

KstwuNhcgdaY-cAxG8ck5A.text: What a great lil place in Metropolitan Place.  We went on Sunday night, and there is ample space and no wait for seating.  Oh, did I mention half off wine... Word UP!  The Sushi menu is about Par, and has all the regular rolls ya plan on at a sushi place.  They also had some interesting veggie rolls that I've never seen before and were very tasty!  One thing, the wait to get our ordered food was a tad long considering the amount of people that were in the restaurant.  I'll definitely go back though, great atmosphere with an interesting decor!  Check it out if your looking for some fish n' rice!

BGyqceqDmFoM0TZc5P3QNw.text: Went with a LivingSocial coupon. Glad we had the coupon. The vibe is young & hip. (Good) The service was friendly & attentive (also good) but all the fish we had was lacking in flavor. The fatty salmon had an amazing mouth feel but had almost no taste. (Very odd). The rolls were VERY small and do you THINK they could make some rolls that DON'T have crab & avocado in them??? All in all, we won't be back.

SIjPI7YpJgoNQmyWxWEu3w.text: I had a chance to check out Pisces recently and was very happy with it. With the all you can eat deal, I had a chance to sample a lot of sushi. I like the fact that the rolls were small in this instance. The all you can eat is now 11.95, hate I didn't get there when it was 9.  From Nigiri we had the sake (salmon) and maguro (tuna) and from the rolls we had the asparagus roll, tempura maki roll, bagel roll, crab salad roll, california roll, spicy crab salad roll, unagi roll, we also had the garlic noodles and an order of fried rice. All were delicious and fresh. My favorite was the bagel roll and spicy crab salad. I heard a rumor from two Charlotte natives that this was their favorite sushi place because it is the only one they know of in Charlotte that gets daily seafood deliveries, don't know about that, but it sure is good and tastes fresh! Good, all you can eat sushi...I'm down!

_uYxVuVuJidNmWbBn4f1Yw.text: Really enjoyed our lunch yesterday! Edward was an awesome server, and my boyfriend suggested Edward choose sushi for the two of us. We were both thrilled with his choices, my boyfriend eating sushi weekly and the very first time for me! Loved the environment, indoor/outdoor seating available, great price for all you can eat made-to-order sushi.

x5JMFZ4Vq5cTWLc24-GXww.text: In general, Charlotte is not a sushi town. You can get OKish sushi but nothing great. Pisces is stepping up.  I'm surprised by the moderate reviews so far - maybe we went on a good day - but my husband and I thought it was great for lunch.   We started with the vegetarian spring rolls followed by a crystal veg roll, crunchy tuna, mango roll and another house special. Everything was perfect- presentation, freshness and portion. The service was not bad. Looking forward to going back and hopefully having a good dinner experience.

IEwzb_VkWvqHItyIYkcA7w.text: Pisces is the best sushi in Charlotte, hands down! Amazing, delicious, and fresh- the sushi and hibachi menus are to die for. And you can customize your sushi with no problem. The atmosphere is wonderful- relaxing, and trendy. And the service is alway great. It's a little pricy but totally worth it in my opinion. By far my favorite restaurant in the city.

hkaZMv961TcJRO7fpqnAKQ.text: I've been here a few times, and always had a great experience. Customer Service is always good, there is never a wait when I go but then again I never went on a Friday or Saturday night. The I've only eaten tried their sushi but it's tasty, and reasonably priced. A great place to grab a bite!

aDevnQPMBZBoximoejPO6Q.text: Want to start out by saying the food is GREAT!  Its unique and among the best in Charlotte when it comes to Asian cuisine.  The only problem I have with this establishment is the price and the nickel and dime attitude management seems to take when it comes to their menu.  It's actually painful to be be so negative about this establishment because I like it so much but things like charging $5 for a kids orange juice makes me wonder where their priorities really are... In any case the service was good but I will consider other options like Nikko, Ishi and even Sushi 101 when it comes tosimilar food options.

WmiBoknT3CUHnAFD2FgRLA.text: This has always been one of my favorite places but recent experience was not good and overpriced. The menu had incorrect prices, the waitress was as little too pushy, and the ONE drink I had was $14.00! It was good but not that good. So sad I can't go back to this once great restaurant.  It's just not what it use to be.

RNm3W33myXOzT0qvy1f2yQ.text: This is my favorite sushi restaurant in Charlotte.  I've dined her many times and the sushi is incredibly fresh, artfully displayed and well priced.  If you're looking for an excellent dining experience, look no further.  This place is a True gem- and because it's new(er) to Charlotte the line isn't out the door.  I ate there last night and I'm already looking forward to going again.

M3CX3cCe90yFgMEB2CnbwQ.text: Very tasty sushi. I had the XOXO and it is one of the best sushi dishes I have had in Charlotte. The owner was nice and bought my group and I a round of shots, and the placed seemed trendy without being stuffy. Best part of the whole place other than the food is the Japanese style cubby hole tables they have in the back. PERFFFECT for a date. In a Charlotte sushi world I wasn't expecting much but this place hit the mark. BUT PLEASE CHARLOTTE FOR A PLACE WITH NO SEA WATER NEAR IT, NO MORE SUSHI RESTAURANTS

j03zUWM-2g9FPrq12f8Kvg.text: We were 45 minutes late for our reservation on Valentines Day (our GPS lead us astray to the wrong location) but thankfully they still seated us. Our waiter was very attentive to our needs w/o being overbearing. The Fried Calamari app was very good, not too much breading and we enjoyed the sauce. My wife really enjoyed her Sushi Combo plate and how it was presented. She was 'stuffed' after eating. I'm not a big sushi fan and had the Steak Tataki. Although it's flank steak it was perfectly seasoned and tender. We were in and out in under an hour which was perfect since we had another engagement to get to. My wife also had a Lemon Drop and raved about that too. Very reasonably priced, we got in and out, including a 20% tip, for under $100. After reading some of the negative comments on Yelp I was a bit apprehensive about dining there but overall we had a great experience and will be going back again.

photos.caption: Photo of Pisces Sushi Bar & Lounge - Charlotte, NC, United States. Sushi Combo Plate

cbqqKywe7hvA6AKvNu2RBA.text: I recently went my first time. It's in a nice area with great restaurants nearby. I had high expectations but was a little disappointed.   -the sushi roll was great.  -cocktails good -sashimi seemed less than fresh so not good  -moco loco is over priced and was basically chicken fingers on rice stuck together by cheese. I liked the concept but less so the result   I'd go back. But exclusively for sushi roll and cocktails.

UUPDEq0XkNXXYkIJ4DrlRw.text: Nigiri fresh and great selection of rolls. Definitely have a nice selection of spicy rolls if that's your preference.  Staff very friendly.

photos.caption: Photo of Pisces Sushi Bar & Lounge - Charlotte, NC, United States. Nigiri and screaming O
Photo of Pisces Sushi Bar & Lounge - Charlotte, NC, United States

dUok-6k2OxCFWtNk_sOy5Q.text: Like a fine wine... this place just keeps getting better with age.  Now three plus years old, Pisces has expanded into the space next door to create a trendy bar and lounge area.  Cocktail genius Bob Peters continues to pull more tricks out of his bag. If you go to this place and order a Bud Light- you're doing it wrong. This is what real bartending is all about. Whether he's using a carbonator, playing with new liquor infusions or adding smoke to a cocktail... put your drink decisions in this man's hands. Intimidated? Tell him what you like. He'll come up with the perfect concoction for you.  Hungry? The best bang for your buck happens at lunch with the all you can eat sushi deal for $14.  My biggest problem at Pisces is narrowing down my order. I have to issue self-imposed restrictions or I will easily convince myself that I need five rolls. They're all delish but here are my current three favs (yes they change every few months):  Leo (tuna, mango, avocado and chili oil). I love the chili oil kick of this one.  Kissy (mango, crab, cream cheese in soy paper, re-wrapped with basil and rice paper) There is just something so clean and delicious about this roll.  XoXo (crab, avocado, topped with baked scallop and a honey mayo eel sauce) The topping just takes this roll to a new level.  I'm also a big of the Tuna Bruschetta for starters and Tempura Oreo with green tea ice cream for the grand finale.   For the late night crowd, Pisces also serves food til 2AM on weekends.  Need some entertainment for your food coma? Stare at the jellyfish tank. It'll hypnotize you for hours.

photos.caption: Photo of Pisces Sushi Bar & Lounge - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fried Oreos and green tea ice cream
Photo of Pisces Sushi Bar & Lounge - Charlotte, NC, United States. Hibachi shrimp with garlic noodles
Photo of Pisces Sushi Bar & Lounge - Charlotte, NC, United States. Jellyfish tank

Cii7IEiWKu-3oXiCa68Yag.text: Fantastic food and drinks. The waitress provided excellent suggestions and off-menu selections to hit our favorite fish cut flavors. The salmon sashimi is amazingly fresh and buttery, and the dragon roll very flavorful.

d-1BGepohyahxA6fJ2w0oQ.text: Had a reservation, although we were seated a little over 45 minutes later, the booth was worth the wait. They are shaped liked coves. Interesting. The only thing I didn't like was the cocktails. I had a Bittersweet Symphony-- it just tasted like puree and ice. I was surprised there were no special martini's, like Lychee.  The food though-- soooo good. The bacon wrapped scallops. amazing!! we got 2 rolls and 4 sushi pieces. you can taste the fresh fish. We chose the Karyu and the Aries Rolls and 4 salmon nigiri pieces.  The place is not THAT big. My second drink was my standard Dirty Martini Straight up.  But Definitely going back to try more items.  It was very busy, so they are doing something right! I was surprised they had nothing with Smoked Salmon though. Oh well.

bMmt7AzusPYOB77rp6Uv1A.text: I came here for lunch a couple of weeks ago based on the awesome reviews. I think I had bigger expectations for this place. I got the unlimited sushi. They had a pretty good selection for only $10 a person, about 10-12 rolls to choose from. I got the spicy tuna, California, crab and shrimp tempura rolls. The rolls come out at 4 pieces. The sushi was OK. The rolls were kinda falling apart and difficult to keep together. It was made fresh, so that was a plus.   Also with the lunch special you can get garlic noodles, fries rice or a spring roll. I got the spring roll. It was good. I also took a sneak peak at there other rolls, which you can order for lunch and/or dinner.   Overall, if you're looking for some sushi for a great price come here. It's nothing to go crazy for, but I don't think any other Sushi places offer all you can eat for only $10 (plus they make it fresh and its not a buffet).   Ps. They offer the lunch specials on the weekend!

rpMgh9Kb6QWuZEHn-nedPQ.text: I was invited back to the restaurant by the owner to give it another try.   Alexandria our server was awesome. She gets 5 stars just for being so lovely.  I tried the A2, Frying Tuna, and Screaming O... They were good, all offering something a little different.  The BEST was the Tempura Oreos. Sounds bonkers, right? No! Eat them.. Be willing to get too full off of them... They are heaven.

photos.caption: Photo of Pisces Sushi Bar & Lounge - Charlotte, NC, United States. Screaming O, Frying Tuna
Photo of Pisces Sushi Bar & Lounge - Charlotte, NC, United States. Tempura Oreo heaven

K7LOoJXWT1yKDMaLtd8NMA.text: Rarely do you have a place with great service and mediocre food, but that is what you get here.  The waitress was friendly and attentive but not too attentive if you know what I mean.  The interior is dark, but doesn't hide the fact that it is in serious need of a paint job.   Booths are tight and secluded.   They didn't have any of my favorite sake selections but they did offer several types.   The rolls are mall quality, slightly above grocery store, but below what other sushi places in the area have to offer.  The chopsticks are slick and awkward.

EeFQLpF985zSk9k-pRAwzw.text: I thought it was time for an update for Pisces. Last time I came here I understood why I loved this place so much. And since the beginning of their sushi bar, they have grown to the space next door! My place to be...the lounge.  So these are the reasons why I love Pisces:  1. If you're like me and have a hard time thinking of a drink you want, you can definitely leave it up to the bartender here. They can make something random and it will be awesome!  2. Awesome service. I've never had a bad experience in this department. 3. Want to eat in the lounge? You sure can!  4. They have a jelly fish tank. Yeah, A jelly fish tank. 5. Live music on Saturday nights in the lounge.  6. TV's are always on the sports channels. (Even when Bobcats are playing against the Heats) 7. Good beers on draft. 8. (But honestly in the end it always comes back to alcohol/mixed drinks.) 9. And this place well, is the place to go for a mixed drinks with friends. That's probably the only reason I come out to bars is to try their creation and specialty drinks. Or else, I would be home drinking scotch.  So, yes. Check this place out. Anthony Hamilton did the other night, so be like a celeb (or just have fun) and watch the jellyfish go round and around the tank and get yo drink on!

09AR6PlGAMmvdbA7L-tZxg.text: Maybe it's because I come from O'ahu, but I was not too impressed by this sushi joint. Granted, it was a pretty good deal for $10 all-you-can-eat -sushi but the rice to fish ratio was really off (more rice than fish). The fish also wasnt as fresh as one would hope bit perhaps decent for the South.

photos.caption: Photo of Pisces Sushi Bar & Lounge - Charlotte, NC, United States. All you can eat menu
Photo of Pisces Sushi Bar & Lounge - Charlotte, NC, United States. Spicy tuna, tuna avocado

936wIudB2a3TN0k-tiAmLw.text: Service is good, area is great and sushi is good as well. They have an all you can eat special just make sure you know the rules. Eat all the sushi or they charge you extra. Hence the charging of the take out boxes as well. Make sure you get one of the non sushi things as well if you are getting the special like the garlic noodles! My fav.

XW29YHPZ8cUjP-oJlb83hg.text: My fiance and I ventured to Pisces for the first during this year's restaurant week. We made reservations for Friday night at 730pm. When we arrived we had to wait at the bar for our table (which was a bit odd due to our aforementioned reservation). After 10 minutes or so, we were seated close to the sushi bar. I would have preferred dining in the more cozy alcoves, being out in the open (and in the middle of the restaurant) was a bit loud and quite cold (turn off the AC, it's not that warm out!)   We decided to go with the restaurant week menu and added a couple of other items as well. We both had a glass of chardonnay and shared a bottle of nigori sake. Both were very good and complimented our sushi. We also liked the fact that the wine was included in our $30 meal. We ordered the crab dumplings and nawaii rolls for appetizers, both were incredibly flavorful. We also boldly ordered the little miniature crabs (I can't remember their name) and both found them surprisingly good (with the perfect amount of salt). For our entrees, we decided to order two sushi rolls each and a couple of pieces of nigiri. The fish was fresh and I appreciated that none of the rolls were drenched in sauce (as so many of them seem to be, particularly from other establishments). We particularly enjoyed the Slammin' Salmon roll. It had the perfect amount of salmon and cream cheese.   In terms of service, it was fantastic. Our waitress was personable and checked in on us the perfect number of times. And even though the restaurant was pretty crowded, we didn't have to wait long for our food (always a plus!)  Overall we had a great experience and a fun date night. We will definitely be returning to Pisces in the future!

Hm7YflGatmSJ-5xIx8OTWg.text: The sushi is good but you only get 5-6 rolls. The hibachi isn't flavored but the mayo sauce is good. The music is great. Friendly servers.

AY0qK5Re5WAY-u-x81vFJw.text: I'm a sushi lover so I could probably eat sushi every single day and be happy. With that being said, I've tried a lot of sushi restaurants. Pieces was great, but it wasn't astonishing. Our appetizer was okay... I feel indifferent about it. The rolls very fresh and very tasty. Although I don't have any True complaints, there was nothing about Pieces that truly stood out to me. Nothing that screamed, "I'm a five star sushi restaurant!!" Don't get me wrong, the sushi is very good. But I'm a sushi snob, and I've had better.

VFkWsnEp-D83qsaJdlTANg.text: Met up with a few friends for early dinner and then off to the theater.  The Sushi here at Pisces is fresh. So hard to find a good Sushi bar.  Went for the Dragon Roll which was fresh and crunchy. Got to admit. The there is the crunch factor when ordering rolls.  Spider Roll- Delicious soft shell crab.  Karu Roll- Spicy Tuna  Enjoyed with a glass of red wine and sake.  Happy Hour Monday- Friday from 4-6 PM. Get to try all their delicacies for a fraction of the price.   Will be back for lunch the next time around.

M0rAUu8Nxxg_nJsOd9a_9w.text: My boyfriend and I tried out this place because I had heard good things from several people. We went on a Friday night around 7pm or so, and while there were plenty of people there it was by no means packed. Though the hostess did scare me for a second when she asked if we had reservations after I asked for a table for two.   The main dining area is very modern and clean, you probably don't want to show up here in gym shorts and I even felt a little out of place wearing a pair of jeans. But we ended up being seated in the back room, which was very cool. Each table is tucked into it's own little compartment with a circle cut-out opening - a nice intimate setting for date night!  The wait staff was very friendly and attentive. We ended up getting "The Love Boat" - several different rolls and some nigiri. The nigiri was fantastic, the fish all tasted wonderful and fresh. The rolls for me weren't so great - two of the featured rolls are fried, the spicy tuna roll and the crispy California. I thought the spicy tuna had enough flavor to it that it actually tasted pretty nice fried. However, the crispy California was very bland and I think I would try to replace next time.   Overall, I would definitely go back. Between the service, atmosphere, and food I had a great time.

RMGEihVb1KlRF2WKUIC4vw.text: This is one of my favorite go to sushi spots.I love this place! They have two different sides to their restaurant one for day time dining and after a certain hour they open up the bar and lounge on the other side, ambiance and decor on both sides are great and go perfectly with the theme of each side. I do believe the menu is the same on both sides but don't quote me on that.  There is a bartender who works there, I'm not too good with names but, she makes a killer lemon drop martini, I am thrilled every time I go and she is working because I know it will be perfect every time.  The sushi menu here is fantastic and you cannot go wrong with any of the options. Raw or cooked you will find something that you love. They have a great lunch time all you can eat menu at a great price, you'll find some hibachi options as well as a few sushi rolls.  I was so caught up on the sushi I completely neglected the other items on the menu, that is until recently when I went in and was able to sit on the lounge side. The bartenders were great, they give you just enough attention and made sure you had everything you need without feeling over whelmed or bothered. I went with the sake instead of my usual martini, I love sake and they have great options to choose from even some flavored! I went with the calamari, which I always make a point to order because its sooo delicious, the spring rolls which are always good, I also had the dumplings, and the brussels sprouts, everything was awesome! awesome! awesome!. I might've went back on my word a tad and ordered one of my favorite rolls to top off the night, The Jumanji roll but what a perfect way to end my meal! I will make a point to try the spicy garlic edamame next time I heard it was phenomena!  The sushi chefs here are so very talented! EVERY TIME my sushi roll comes out I am floored at the literal piece of art that is presented to me! I'm always hesitant to eat it because it is so very beautiful! I appreciate the presentation every time!  This place never disappoints and the staff here is always friendly and service is untouchable. I will always be back!

pz8ipDiJm3BRD6uyONSXBA.text: Thanks to my fellow Yelpers for recommending this place.  I am still new to the world of sushi but the pictures from the website are what drew me here.  What made this a 4-star review was that my group's server, Lily, was willing to explain the menu options in detail to a newbie like myself.  She recommended the cucumber special which was absolutely amazing!   I also had the Spicy Tuna and Spicy Salmon hand rolls which were beautifully presented and also tasted wonderful.  The decor of the place is modern.  The tables are a little close together.    Prices are decent here except I thought the wine was a bit pricey.  And I was absolutely amazed by the jellyfish aquarium.  It was so relaxing to watch.    Definitely a place I need to come back to and explore sushi.

q86BzK1JUc7DFmUCo3fJbA.text: Nice chill spot.. wasn't busy so it was good I enjoyed my sushi. Nothing to crazy so good..

photos.caption: Photo of Pisces Sushi Bar & Lounge - Charlotte, NC, United States. Panthers and the knight was awesome... I really liked the location of the restaurant perfect for date night.

TxGPzYjCssoggYSAx4sQng.text: I have been here for lunch and dinner and I can definitely say I like it a lot!!  For my entree I had hibachi shrimp both times.  Lots of plump shrimp, a good amount of veggies and I chose the fried rice, also with a cup of shrimp sauce, yum!  I have also tried the Kawaii roll, which was crab, avacado, asparagus and cream cheese in a spring roll, served open faced I think.  It was very tasty.  I also tried a sushi roll that had crab and some other stuff but tuna and tomato on top.  Tomato wasn't needed but without it the roll was delicious.  Prices are decent, service is good.  We had received some cold veggies last time and the server/manager who dropped the dishes off ran right back to the kitchen and got us some new warm ones immediately.  We would have been happy to have them reheat what was on our plate, so I thought that was a nice touch. Only thing I dislike is the parking garage, its always sooo crowded!

XYs0aeOPoPxgM_zd9THIww.text: While I agree with most reviews - not the best sushi, a bit pricey - I loved the hibachi, drinks, and service. Their infused vodkas are very good, and the atmosphere plus the presentation of the food made for a very enjoyable evening. Our server was very friendly, offering suggestions and answering all our questions. Our drinks were refilled and the bar-tenders and manager were very nice.

FOXAuTU-KSxRAM-H3qg2MA.text: Currently eating here as I type the food is great! The spicy handroll is to die for! Highly recommend

HB7kwkJSGQ1bUjABurjcag.text: This dude likes everything about Pisces. I mean, it's my sign for god sake. The people are sexy, the food is decent and the ambiance is live. The bartenders pour a good beer and on Fridays the dude, Bob (I think?) makes a plethora of amazing mixed concoctions. This Bob feller (I think?) is also the bartender at Soul on Saturdays. Ask for him Bob (I think?) and he'll whip you up something nice.   With the expansion, the dinner area is separated very functionally from the lounge. Go in for Sushi and stop by in the adjacent room for a saki bomb.

eG5YID1a81TQunZ4CgFoUA.text: Great sushi!  Love to go during lunch for their Specials, made to order sushi menu.  Can't go wrong with the spicy tuna roll and the spring rolls are to die for!!!

PWc2AUi9k3hrmju5Lv4ikg.text: I love everything about Pisces...the service, the location, the food quality. We've been many times and always have a really nice experience. The owner is very attentive & always stops by our table.   If you haven't yet, try the Kawaii rolls...amazing, and the Crazy roll is surprisingly crazy good. They have a nice wine list with plenty of options and a fun selection of martinis! Go!

tMIsWli0jO9AaT3Mh33fvA.text: The all you can eat lunch is gone!  But the quality of the lunch experience isn't diminished 1 bit.

GfJrnB-LYUbREDeeCHmKQg.text: Good sushi! Food came pretty quickly as we were the only ones there. We used the parking lot that is across the road... In half an hour we were out of there. We did enjoy it.

wdDC4Xe8yPelk25HHr7-zw.text: I have heard great things about this place so I was really looking forward to trying it out. The atmosphere is perfect! I love the set up, not too bright a good intimate feel but not very dark either. I have to give the drinks a 5 star rating they have amazing cocktails ...I however wasn't too impressed with my meal. The waiter was great but I don't like how the shrimp came out. I like my shrimp meaty texture (i.e Enso style) but theirs were like that squishy not cooked all the way type and I really don't like that. I actually ended up not eating my meal :-/. However, my friends chicken was really good so I didn't want to give them less than 4 stars just for the shrimp. I will go back for another dish and see how it goes.

J-9a9ofcgriTuh1SuiMCEg.text: Came in for lunch today and it was a good experience. I had the crab salad roll and spicy tuna roll lunch combo with the miso soup and salad. The sushi was tasty. Some of the best miso soup I've had in the Charlotte area. Did not like the ginger dressing on the salad. Seemed more sweet than I'm used to. Sat at the bar and service was excellent.

eaewokFISj09yF3FXAZm8w.text: This place was so overpriced and for not good quality either so I'm not really sure why the rave reviews?  I ordered just a spicy tuna roll & a miso soup because the prices were so crazy....even these two items cost $14...  I guess it would have been fine if the sushi roll was amazing, but it was one of the worst ones I have eaten.  It was messy and not held together well and the tuna was like smushed in.  I was happy I didn't decide to order a more expense roll - they have ones that are on the menu at $20!  Our waitress was ok...not the friendlist or anything.  This place is a rip and there are plenty of other sushi places in Charlotte where you can get the same quality or much better quality sushi for way less.

Xm6iTXLpfG_num6eqSjbpQ.text: Disclaimer: I go here a lot.  This was the place I "learned to like sushi", so I am probably biased.  I have been here for regular dinner, the lunch buffet, and restaurant week dinner.  I always have a service experience ranging from "good" to "spectacular", leaning towards the spectacular end of the spectrum.  The decor is also great, especially if you can talk them into seating you in one of the cave-like booths during lunch.  It's like eating at home, but with someone to wait on you!  As far as the food goes.... I have never, ever, not been "wowed" at Pisces.  The lunch deal features a very limited menu, but all of the rolls and ngiri offered are fresh and flavorful, and the garlic noodles are absolutely off the charts.  I've never been to RuSans for dinner, but their lunch buffet is soggy and flavorless compared to the made to order goodness that is Pisces.  As far as dinner-I always use restaurant week to sample 2-3 restaurants in charlotte that I wouldnt normally go to and Pisces provided one of the best restaurant week experiences.  The menu was extensive, the portions generous, and the rolls I had were amazing.    I realize the outflow of positive adjectives is reaching absurd levels here but this place is just great.  I've had sushi 4-5 places in Charlotte and this tops them all.  Go eat!

qNmcBJniCOg1M2ZHjdWpZA.text: Like many other sushi places in Charlotte, Pisces is good.  The atmosphere was fun and trendy, the service was solid.   The sushi was okay and reasonably priced, many of the roles had way too much rice for my taste. Just kind of smacks like cheap sushi.    One other issue is that it is in the Met, which means parking is a giant pain, not their fault.   Overall, I will add it too my list of sushi places, but not close to my favorite.

dujkEjvnE6g2ool12XYglA.text: I love, love, love this place. The atmosphere is trendy but not pretentious. And the sushi is always on point.  Ever since my boyfriend practically forced a california roll down my throat 3 years ago, I've been in love. We've been all over Charlotte- from Akahana (gross and overpriced), Rusans (decent, tho small speciality selection), Sushi 101 (okay), and none of them ever come close to the quality experience we get each time at Pisces. I wouldn't care if this place was located in an east side strip mall I'd still be there every weekend. Thankfully, it's right around the corner from me at the Met. And while parking can be horrendous, it still can't affect my mood once I cross their threshold.  To start we always get a Kawaii roll. Which is just a fried spring roll with asparagus, crab stick, and cream cheese with an orange/vinegar dipping sauce. The simplicity gets me everytime. What my mouth experiences once I take that first bite is outta this world. The flavor combo is just awesome. We've ordered other apps that were all uniquely awesome in their own way but this one is a staple for each visit.  Next is the reason we keep coming back. The speciality rolls. Like I said, I started out slow, ya know, beginner rolls, nothing too exciting. Pisces is the only place I will eat flat out-laid out raw fish on my sushi. Other places I may get the spicy tuna or something with crab and shrimp. Oh no, not here. The fish is so fresh it can't be beat by anywhere else in Charlotte. They were the first place I ever tried spicy tuna, and it is seriously the best spicy tuna, THE BEST.   You can't go wrong with any of the speciality rolls, or any rolls for that matter. But we like to experience the creative flavor pairings they've created. For example, the Kissy roll. It's wrapped in soy paper with a bit of mango, crab, cream cheese, then rewrapped with basil and rice paper. Yes, basil. And it adds something unexplainable. Something..almost magical? Get it, you won't regret it. We also like to get some additional orange/vinegar sauce from the Kawaii roll to dip our other rolls in to. But that may just be an us thing. We've tried pretty much every speciality roll on the menu and have never been disappointed.   Now the service. While we may run in to a junior waiter here and there, when we get the OG servers it always makes up for any previous semi-lack luster server experience. We have a few that immediately recognize us and we get that star treament that can only come when you've stuffed hundreds of dollars of rolls in your mouth. Service is quick, casual, and on point.   Drinks. While the mixed drinks can add on quite a bit to your total if you stop paying attention, we've learned to just stick with a bottle of sake. We prefer something a little delicate to pair with the standout flavors of our rolls. We stick with the Hana brand sake in fuji apple or white peach. Either one you can't go wrong.  After hearing so many of my friends preaching religiously about Rusans, my suggestion is to just go try Pisces. I know there are some die-hards out there for Rusans but seriously, this place has never disappointed me. AND you can make online reservations, ask for a booth in the back corner. It's a nice little back alley with covered booths for an intimate dining experience. And yes, this place is an experience. Enjoy!

u1FXfiC9rsxKkJ2F2gEZ-Q.text: Stopped by to finally use my Groupon....based on the mixed reviews I decided to steer clear of the sushi and try an entree. I started off with fried gyoza(potstickers) and crab dumplings which were both pretty good....one served with chili sauce the other served with ponzu. The hibachi salmon was served with rice, mixed veggies(broccoli, mushrooms, onions, and zucchini) which were a little greasy due to being drowned in butter and oil. The salmon was borderline dry but had a good flavor, the rice was average as was the veggies....server Edward is the type of server every restaurant should have...very helpful, knowledgeable and patient as I am the most indecisive foodie ever, he was very honest about the menu items and didn't hesitate to give you his opinion...the other servers congregated at the bar clueless and hugging on each other(not a good look).....thank goodness they have Edward, gotta love that type of server. 3 stars for the food plus an additional star for great service from Edward..

photos.caption: Photo of Pisces Sushi Bar & Lounge - Charlotte, NC, United States. Crab rangoons and potstickers
Photo of Pisces Sushi Bar & Lounge - Charlotte, NC, United States. Salmon Hibachi

uOqsIJM30bkN3E0mj0BTIw.text: Highly recommend the tempura fried oreo's...delicious.  Love the atmosphere and sushi!    My friends and I prefer Pisces over their loud competitor (Nikko)...who wants to feel like they are eating in a club with a woman dancing around with a tamborine? Ridiculous.

nHirz5k2aWBuAPu25k5ibw.text: Really good sushi!  We have become sushi snobs if you will.  We are on a mission to try all sushi restaurants in Charlotte.  They have such cool booths to eat in in Pisces.  They are a bit above average in price but I think that is due to location most likely.  Cosmo roll was our favorite, such unique presentation.  Really yummy cocktails too!

59ufKrQw-B6bUxRsQcIoaA.text: This was our third time eating at Pisces, 2nd lunch time all you can eat 'limited sushi'  First 2 experiences were amazing.. quick, friendly and DELICIOUS!!   Thought this one was going to be different because we got there at 1230 (lunch time rush)  hostes said it would be a 25 min wait, so we asked if we could sit at the bar, since we only get an hour for lunch.  She said yes but it all depends how busy the servers are when they will get to us.  That was weird. But we sat patiently and a very helpful young lady helped us with ease.  Got our order under way and was very quick about it.    Our visit was pretty great as usual and we shouldn't have doubted it even one second.    The best Sushi place I have eaten at in Charlotte.  Fish is super fresh, the flavors are amazing. And it looks like they may be expanding, which they should because they are so good!!

OhGWb9M1yuBqPlWNLn0aDQ.text: Sushi roll choices for lunch very limited.  If you like cream cheese, you are in luck.  Buffet sushi rolls are better than what I got.  Asparagus roll with an oversteamed asparagus, rice and nothing else.  Spicy tuna, just nasty.  Great location.  Need to hire an actual sushi chef.  Sam P.

64ynHq0CF9rU5YTY3TceRg.text: Sushi is ok, a little pricey. Service is awful however. I called in a pick up order on Tuesday and the person who ordered was very rude. I'm new at eating sushi and I asked what shrimp tempura was, and she responded saying "uuhhh it's just shrimp tempura." So I asked again, I'm sorry I really don't know what that means. And they replied with a huge attitude so I said forget it. I ended up settling with what I usually get because I dare not ask her anything else. When I went to go pick up my order, I stood at the bar for 5 min until I was greeted. I will not be returning.

PcCxEiWwxSGNmUc2ZJVqnQ.text: This place is beyond sub par. The restaurant is VERY sensitive to change and adjust on their sushi. Makes it seem like it's all made prior to the day before. Not fresh. Save a trip and go to Room 112 or somewhere else.

gfSzoWm3eTwsTYV7IbLt9Q.text: I am a regular at Pisces for their $10 all you can eat lunch special. Everything is made-to-order and usually really fresh. I always add the salad for an extra $2 because they serve high quality greens in their salad and I think they have awesome ginger dressing.  The only reason I rate Pisces 4 Stars is because of the service. It's usually pretty slow when I'm in there for lunch. Now, I understand it's busy. BUT sometimes it is hard to get in an out in an hour during my lunch break. I think Pisces could attract more business lunch-goers if they were a little quicker. Regardless, I'll be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Pisces Sushi Bar & Lounge - Charlotte, NC, United States

RgSWRHR7s4jLpdm-gJdWLw.text: I wish I could've given more stars because the food quality is always on point at this place and very fresh. However, because of the level of customer service I would've liked to have given 0 stars. Customer service can make or break an establishment. Recently I popped in for lunch with a few of my co-workers and we selected the "all-you-can-eat", food was excellent! My friends and I are until we were nearly stuffed and ready to pop. There were three remaining pieces of sushi (avocado and cucumber), and neither of us could eat another piece seriously. The young lady comes to our table and we asked for the check, and she stated "I'm going to have to charge you'll extra for the three pieces that you didn't eat", and I asked why and she stated "we reserve the right to charge for what you waste and don't eat because sushi is expensive". I explained to her that I was familiar with their policy and that I understood how expensive sushi can be, however the policy doesn't stipulate what's considered waste and that taken into account the type of roll we had leftover in comparison to all that we had consumed, was it really waste? The waitress was adamant about the policy and so was I on my stance of how waste is determined in their establishment. Also the policy says that they reserve the right to, but I wonder if they always do, or was my waitress just being a jerk. We ate the three little rolls, but it left a very bitter taste in my mouth for this establishment. Let's be clear, one cucumber makes nearly 100 rolls in this place considering how tiny they cut it up. Either way, if I ever eat here again, I'm going to be adamant about my food coming out individually because the "waste" wasn't even mine, however everything was on one tab that day so I ultimately was going to have to pay for it, but never again. To avoid "waste" I want my own plate! Thank you FYI... the cucumber and avocado roll sounds tasty but lacks in flavor, nothing special about it! It tastes just as plain as it sounds!

bxeZ_diU-HDS7hi7_uPtNg.text: Pretty tasty and filling, plus you cannot beat the price. Service at the bar was okay and will probably try dining room for better service.

LCOUbIjpEJxwv_bfZUrB-A.text: Whether it's an after work quick bite, a romantic evening, or even a business party Pisces hits the spot. I wasn't always a fan of sushi but I've been expanding recently and decided to give this place a try. It's hard to find good sushi deals where the sushi is actually legitimate. After doing some hardcore Yelp research Pisces was the place.   Located in the Metropolitan area surrounded by other great restaurants and places to shop you are sure to find something to spend your evening doing... other then enjoying great sushi!   Happy hour has the best prices so don't miss out on that! It really allows you to try a lot of different rolls. Each one is superbly crafted and not just thrown together half heartedly. I'll definitely be going back when I'm in the sushi mood.

dOCGtDlX2roT--ASehynJQ.text: I went twice because I enjoyed the $11 sushi special. It was very enjoyable going with a friend, and the waiter Jeremy suggested the best tasting mango sake. Sake was half priced on a Tuesday, so overall it was wonderful.

photos.caption: Photo of Pisces Sushi Bar & Lounge - Charlotte, NC, United States. All you can eat/lunch menu

3wCJRGdQ6smIJY3QpHJROA.text: My nieces first time having Sushi!!!!!   This was my second time visiting Pisces. I brought my niece along to try sushi for the first time. She's new to the Queen City. From my understanding, Indiana has limited options when it comes to food.   We arrived around 11:30AM before the lunch crowd. My niece browsed the menu. She asked a few questions then proceeded to order. The waitress and I were stunned when she ordered the Tuna Roll...Tuna??? What??? Yes!! Go for it!!   Here's another first!!! My niece also used chopsticks. She struggled a few times, but never gave up! I was so proud of her!! The sushi was WONDERFUL!!! She definitely enjoyed every bite!!   Our waitress was patient and kind.... thank goodness. I look forward to building even more precious memories as a new Aunt/mentor. So thank you Pisces for taking care of us today! This has been a unforgettable experience!!!

euzQYPlRFQQqvW3ByM1lhA.text: The atmosphere at Pisces just can't be beat. My date and I walked in, expecting to sit at one if the tables easily viewed from the front door. Then the hostess takes us around the corner to the booths, each one behind a circular entrance. I love the design, giving the appearance of some privacy, making dinner feel a bit more intimate.  We shared fried calamari, two sushi rolls and some shrimp hibachi. I also had a cocktail, but I can't remember the name. All of the food and drink was delicious. I felt that the calamari appetizer could have been a bigger portion. My date ended up ordering another. It's possible we are spoiled by Rusan's mega portions. That did not change the fact that we enjoyed the food, and the environment. I'm looking forward to visiting Pisces again.

ZzQBe5Lj3zpzDRQ2dHqiBg.text: I know yelp wants me to write more, but:   Go for the all you can eat lunch buffet. The value is the same as buying a house for the cost of a car.   Go, now...

T93EdhpvFTo5EVsqynaMpw.text: I came with a friend to catch up after work. Blaine was my server, she was so fun! Very personable and relatable and made great recommendations

fLJS4u7zaThYAvOPAwLtGg.text: Maybe it was just where we were seated, but this place just feels more like a "wannabe" upscale sushi joint than an actual upscale sushi joint. We did the all you can eat lunch special, which is an awesome deal, but the sushi itself was just "meh." Service was kind of slow. There was no soy sauce on our table and our dishes were pretty greasy and gross. I felt too grossed out to use the reuse-able chopsticks they gave us. The atmosphere was okay, we were sat in a booth which had a lot of privacy, which was nice, but the seats were worn down and it smelled kind of like cleaning supplies. Won't be my first choice again unless I'm really craving some cheap sushi.

L-1mj8j_WxME-Oikx-68OA.text: This restaurant will get you sick. I had such severe food poisoning after eating here that put me in the hospital. The quality of fish used should have been a red flag in the first place but because it was a cheap lunch buffet, I ignored it. Will never visit this place again and I highly recommend finding somewhere else to go for a sushi buffet. There are too many options in Charlotte to subject yourself to low-quality fish.  To elaborate and provide guidance to those reading:  The hostess/servers are rude and slow. Expect to be ignored.   I started with the gyoza which was pretty good. From there I chose to upgrade the buffet $5 with the Nigiri option - probably where everything went wrong.   I ordered the tuna and salmon nigiri which both came out off-colored. Sushi grade fish is known for its vibrant colors, this looked like it had been sitting for a month. It tasted that way as well so I moved on to the rolls.   When they brought out the rolls, I chuckled because it looks like a toddler was in the back smashing rice around the fish and then throwing it on the plate. It was 9/10 rice with a smidge of fish. (Ordered Philly, jalapeno, & shrimp tempura).So we ordered more because we were hungry after the first rolls. The second round came out just as bad (ordered crab salad & spicy tuna). Sushi can be better made at home.   It was a late lunch so we didn't eat for the rest of the day. The symptoms began immediately on Sunday morning and by Tuesday, I was in the ER.   Overall, terrible experience during and after.

k79B6igRBYUsgDPuAj7r2g.text: We had read such good reviews about Pisces that we couldn't wait to try it. Our entire experience was less than superb. We were seated in the back booths (actually really cool booths with rounded ceilings made to feel like small rooms), and it took 5-10 minutes for our server to even come to our table. After she took our drink orders, she disappeared for another 10 mins and then came back apologizing for the WRONG wine not being ready. I corrected her and we put in our food orders. We ordered the garlic edamame (amazing!), pineapple chicken and the fineapple express roll. It took longer than acceptable for the food to come out again. My fiance's chicken dish was really tasty and a large serving size. My roll however was probably one of the smallest rolls I have ever had. The flavor was great and fresh but unfortunately the roll itself was tiny. Our server returned and asked if I wanted a refill of another type yet of the WRONG wine. Of course when we asked for the bill she was attentive in bringing it and returning us the card, much quicker than she had been all night. Not sure if we will be back

-rFteu6mYBOZwuiEh8UHnQ.text: Review for AYCE lunch!   You cannot use the yelp discount on the lunch promotion. This is totally fair, since it's so inexpensive, but I just wanted to put it out there.  If you want rolls and rolls of sushi, do the ACYE option! I do feel like the menu is quite limited - lots of "plain" rolls. You can upgrade to fancier rolls, but we didn't. When you go for all you can eat, I don't want to upgrade, I just want what they have to offer.   Like I mentioned, the rolls are very plain. They're all in a standard California roll set up - just with different meat/fish/veg inside. No fish on top, not really too much sauce on top. But, if that's what you're looking for, then this is great! I do think the fish quality was very nice, especially for the price.  The other items on the ACYE menu were different types of noodles, fried rice, egg rolls, gyoza, etc. The standard Asian appetizers.   I enjoyed the lunch, I think it's a freakin' steal for the amount of food you can order... but I do wish they would expand their AYCE menu into something with more pizazz. Some other appetizers, a fancier type of roll or two...

1bjBVgltaXYAxI2UjMKv3Q.text: Food tasted okay. Service was slow, and the restaurant itself smelled like a dirty bathroom my entire visit.

eEcpYCntj9uX6TOZiJjn7w.text: Great all you can eat lunch special for $12.00 which includes a great selection of rolls and a decent selection of starters (pork gyoza,  spring rolls, etc.), very clean, with good staff. Good location in Midtown with lots to do in the area.   While the selection is wide the rolls are still relatively basic but quality is great! Definitely a go to spot for myself and friends.

MW6v4FqrgOyCbcqpCu8FTw.text: Prices were nowhere close to the quality or experience. It's just another "Lounge" with no thought into the quality, and insane prices bc of location. This place has the space but not the quality of food or service. It's sad...

nG-XaFjPT3WzG4jT6Hs2CA.text: Pieces is a very middle of the road kind of sushi restaurant. It's biggest redeeming quality is the upscale feel with a nice ambiance. The alcohol selection was decent, plenty of wine and sake to choose from and a few craft beer options. The food was ok. Good selection of sezchuan options but a fairly small sushi menu. No menu of traditional sushi or simple rolls but a couple dozen special rolls. Most seemed to feature spicy tuna and deep frying and several had mango. As someone who really likes well made raw rolls, I wasn't super impressed. I enjoyed trying some new things but didnt get too excited about anything.

5Tq9dI7Ea7JNzOu6H218KA.text: An all-you-can-eat sushi lunch for just $11? It sounded too good to be True, until I dropped in at Pisces on a recent weekday to see for myself. What I discovered is one of the best lunch values in Charlotte, served up at an unassuming sushi restaurant in the Metropolitan.   Yes, for just ELEVEN DOLLARS, you can enjoy as many sushi rolls, Nigiri, or Tuna pieces as you can handle, along with fried rice, garlic noodles and spring rolls. And if that's not enough, you can add a Miso Soup and Ginger Salad for just $2 more. We enjoyed a delicious order of California, Yellowtail and Tempura Shrimp rolls, then mixed in a Spicy Salmon roll on round two. Service was prompt and friendly, and there are a fair number of local craft brews on tap, along with saki and wine.   A recent expansion has nearly doubled the restaurant's seating capacity, but their amazing lunch offer ensures the place fills up quickly by 12:15. So get there early, grab a table, and enjoy what may the best sushi deal in the Queen City!

1gWDnXYf0fef44N94xkrSA.text: Go on Thursday!!! Monday through Friday they have half price sushi from 4-6pm! However, if you go on Thursday they also have half price cocktails all night! Taking advantage of both is the way to go! It was so nice to order multiple rolls and drinks and not be worried about the price!   I liked my tequila and bourbon cocktails the best! The dessert cocktail with chocolate was also very good. We ordered multiple rolls, with the Screaming O being the best! We also had one with scallops on it that was excellent. The servers were very nice, and it was nice to sit at the bar and chat with them.   I hear they have a lunch buffet as well, but I have yet to go.   I will come back, but I will likely only come during the discounted hours.

photos.caption: Photo of Pisces Sushi Bar & Lounge - Charlotte, NC, United States. Half price sushi!

NRNhlWZriIruCmxT5WH43A.text: Nice atmosphere. Drinks were subpar. Sushi mediocre. Would go back for happy hour, half off sushi rolls

DnF_-uCzDhX44yb3hGARMA.text: i have never been the type to write a yelp review. in fact i never have. this is my first and hopefully the only one i will ever write of this nature. i recently moved to charlotte and have been searching for a good sushi spot since i relocated. so after doing some research this was the spot my boyfriend decided we should go. well $350 between 2 people i was not impressed. yes we ordered a lot of food and i understand how long it takes to prepare said food. considering there were 2 other tables sitting in the restaurant it took wwwaayyy to long but i was willing to over look it. honestly if it were for that night alone this review would not exist. roughly a week or so later i ordered a togo order to be picked up in hopes i would have a better experience. this was not the case. i placed an order consisting of 8 pieces of nigiri totaling $32. that's fine. the nigiri was alright. nothing special but nothing to really complain about. the $28 i paid for an order of steak hibachi is the problem. yes i opted for filet instead of whatever steak they normally offer. yes i understand hibachi is not often cooked properly to the temperature requested. yes i understand by picking it up there was a good chance my steak would over cook by steaming in the box do to carryover cooking. but when you order steak, especially filet, rare and turns out to be so tough and over cooked it hurts your jaw to chew is when it becomes completely unacceptable. i have literally had filet mignon jerky that was more tender. on top of that i'm not sure what they did to the rice or vegetables but the broccoli was crunchy and the dish overall was the WORST hibachi i have ever had. i had high hopes. i tried twice. i spent over $400 on two meals. i wouldn't give them another dime

6rU6X4ZlEFnzajmp83GqTQ.text: My husband and I have eaten here a ton of times! Seems to get better every time we go! The calamari is delicious as well as everything else on their menu! Bryan has done such a great job with this place that he's expanded and opened another location up towards the Huntersville/Cornelius area.   If you love sushi, great drinks, and a great staff, this place is for you!

Dy81rxG_W52dRMtryWmMTg.text: Pisces's decor is pretty unique. The booths are circular, different from anything I've seen. The setting is casual with a touch of trendy. Also, they just added a jelly fish tank! =D  I came to Pisces for lunch to try their sushi buffet. Contrary to most buffets, Pisces provides you with a menu to order. Once you've made your choices, the servers bring the dishes to your table. Be sure not to order more than you can eat because they will charge you extra! The sushi is very fresh, especially for a buffet. Our food came out fairly quickly every time we ordered something new, especially since everything is made to order. I recommend the garlic noodles. They come with the buffet and are delicious!  Overall, I think Pisces is a good place to go to when you just want a variety of sushi. It isn't amazing, but it's pretty decent for a buffet. Plus, you can always come to just check out the jelly fish! :)

If0CWiBeq57Twe5NPJ-pYQ.text: Was very unhappy with the sushi. Either I'm spoiled because I'm used to sushi form CA or this place just does not do amazing sushi. I had to return my food right away, and left.

BkJW-gT0C0h8i8oxf9_S3A.text: Took the family of 5 for dinner. Place was empty @6 on a Tuesday which was nice. Seated promptly and server was attentive early in the process. She was very knowledgeable and offers several recommendations which is always appreciated. She lost some momentum getting drinks to the table and getting an answer to a "nuts allergy" question we had for on of the appetizers at the table. Overall, I thought she was good. A little slow at times but good overall. We ordered several sushi rolls , soup, and a couple of restaurant week dishes. Everyone loved the sushi and the crab filling appetizers. Spicy garlic edamame were good but I think I prefer plain old edamame. Chicken habachi was good and also very good portions. The sushi girl at the table liked it but didn't love it. Thinks there's a better sushi place in the area which I won't name. Overall, I thought it was good and would return. If you haven't been it's worth a visit.

K5z6ZujLcGrdZuJYAMmRPg.text: My husband took me here for my bday dinner. I wasn't really impressed with this place. I thought the atmosphere was rather poor. The tables were way too close to each other. They only had two veggie roll options. I went with "the vegan". It was actually good but I don't feel it was worth 13.50 (correction $10) for the little amount of anything in - on the roll. I pay that for a roll smothered in fish and that is justified but a veggie roll with more rice than any goodies isn't worth my money. I personally wouldn't go back to this place, not even take out. They do have a cool sushi boat for 50 bucks that looks cool. Other than that nothing was worth the money.

Nl8U7uWsc8OcdjF5hBNHhQ.text: I went here last week with my boyfriend. It was our first time here.  Their menu has quite a few options - even for those who don't like sushi.  They have hibachi and some other stuff, but we only ordered one thing not sushi.  The maple duck that our server recommended was amazing - cooked perfectly (to my liking anyway). The rest we ordered was sushi. We ordered just a plain maki roll and one of the specialty rolls. We had the screaming O roll which was delicious, especially if you're a tuna fan.  We also ordered a drink each, we both tried a different kind of their infused vodkas. They were really good and were easy drinking. I had strawberry and my boyfriend had blueberry.  The service was really friendly and made me feel relaxed. I might be biased because our servers name was Amanda,  but she was really witty and made us laugh the whole time.   They also have a lounge side which is a bit louder for those who like more of a social atmosphere, good place to hang with friends.  Overall I would come back again, there are more choices I'm dying to try!

-LrG29xDNo_VlKr6zSrN1Q.text: I went here with two friends of mine. The sushi was a little pricey for Charlotte, but tasted amazing. The menu was classy and had lots of options and they were happy to modify the food per our requests.   There are two things people should know for going to this place. First off, it has an urban chic style with a dark and misty feel, which can be fun and exciting for some people but not everyone's cup of tea. The other is that the Booths are awkwardly shaped to be artsy, but for people 6 feet tall and above, you will hit your head coming in or out...

-g0orLOE74BMTa_U-hFAtQ.text: Great vibe and good sushi! The crab dumplings would be worth a visit on their own but the sushi is tasty as well! Like most sushi joints it doesn't take long to get food and the staff is on top of things. They have awesome weekday deals and all you can eat sushi weekdays from 11:30am to 2:00pm (or somewhere in that time frame) so even big eaters can enjoy this spot!

0xaSE_f5WMr7isnDS9zVgg.text: Love the nine to five sushi and appetizers. Nice chill environment. The service is pretty fast but they are always busy.

fCTxufraZauCGFero41eVA.text: We tried Pisces again, and I hate to drop my rating, but the service was pretty terrible AGAIN.  Oddly enough, the hostess was great, the waitress was great at first, and the manager even came by the check on us.  However, the minute we got our food, the fella ordered a glass of wine, and waited.... and waited... and waited.  We were sitting about 15 feet from the bar, so we saw the glass sitting there, but our waitress - and all the other waitresses - seemed to disappear.  We could see a few people gathered around it at the bar, but no one was delivering it.  This whole time, I was also out of water.  After 20 minutes, the fella finally got up and actually got it himself (after confirming with the bartender that it was his).  Sadly, the good food just doesn't make up for such consistently inconsistent service.

5sY7Nu6OJHbJ-0Zl_I_kZQ.text: It's not often that a martini alone drives me to write a review, but let me tell you, the Far East Manhattan I DEVOURED last night (beverages can totally be devoured), was phenomenal.  Take your traditional Manhattan (whiskey or bourbon, bitters, sweet vermouth and don't forget that cherry) and put it on a flight to Hong Kong and this is what you'll get: A delicious concoction of rye bourbon, ginger liqueur, sparking sake and bitters. Sweet, smooth, spicy.  I am a sucker for anything ginger, so I had high hopes for this cocktail and it did not disappoint.   I am not going to try to guess the alcohol content of this beverage, but let's just say that I was in no position to order a second. Next time I will bet trying the Shiso martini: orange vodka, ginger liqueur (yeah!), barley liqueur and fresh shiso. I'm counting down the minutes...  The food was good too! You can't go wrong with their seaweed salad and simple but fresh sushi menu.  I respect the lack of bells and whistles. Definitely ask for one of the intimate booths in the back if you're feeling romantic like that.

TAtTYqrrMdsmuxk7SQxQ7A.text: Tonight was my first time at Pisces, and I have nothing to bad to say about the food. The sushi options were very creative and the rolls my boyfriend and I ordered (Crunchy Spicy Tuna, Leo, Eel Special, Spicy Tuna) were delicious. However, the service was not as satisfying.  I watched as our sushi sat at the bar, waiting for pick up, for about ten minutes. Meanwhile, our server milled about the restaurant doing nothing in particular. When our food was finally delivered, she had requested that tobiko be put on the wrong roll. Not a problem, I just requested some extra on the side for the naked roll. Our server agreed to the request then disappeared. She didn't come near our table again until the meal was over, and then offered me the side of tobiko with a smug, "well I guess it's a little late".  I got her name off the receipt, and if I return, I will not be sitting in her section. The food at a restaurant can be incredible, but bad service can make or break a meal. I hope that this is something the management recognizes and works on.

dpQ144kWJ2hDCw_tzabUQw.text: Went for lunch for the all you can eat sushi. They make a huge deal about if you order too much food. Newsflash, if you don't want waste, then don't make it all you can eat. The sushi was poorly made and room temperature. The place was not crowded at all yet it took our food forever to come out and our waitress was not very attentive. Overall poor experience and won't be going back.

pyo5MmoP6YCV4wyRWx4CJQ.text: This place was good,  not the best sushi I've ever had but I would come back. Cocktails were delicious. Reasonably priced.

V_Li25oHiCTm11eauVRP6w.text: Great management.  Waited 10 minutes for the server to come to our table and manager bought a round of drinks and dessert for us

M9GwevV1ztpa4jqM3eJTZQ.text: All you can eat sushi lunch is just okay.  The options are pretty uninspired, just fish in rice that's about it.  Also guys, be careful bringing a date.  This is one of those restaurants where the waitresses, likely under the compulsion of management, wear very tight, revealing clothing.  Took my wife on a date and it was uncomfortable for both of us.  We were also seated at a coffee table in some lounge chairs.  This made eating really difficult.

FONvongYRk0N43T0eXUBRg.text: I rarely write reviews but was so inspired by the quality and freshness of the fish last night that I wanted to let you know.     The blue fin otoro, toro, chutoro sashimi platter melted in your mouth. The salmon was fresh and delicious. The baby yellow tail on point. . I'm not aware of anywhere in the area where you can get this array of blue fin tuna cuts.  Pisces latest choice of fish purveyors is spot on.  Please keep buying from this source...it makes all the difference.   The crunchy fresh water crabs were unique,  creative,  and tasty. The garlic chili edamame get high marks for texture and flavor.  Servers were knowledgeable, responsive, and helpful. Cocktail menu creative and well made drinks.   I am a foodie and a sushi officianado and I give Pisces the highest rating for an all around job well done!

EpWXvG4eOqz_zXR6SZ1eEw.text: unique menu, fresh sushi, and atmosphere, perfect romantic date spot or relax with friends on a Friday

p-JS8G0IgBiP8poei3nTDA.text: $10 all you can eat lunch is back for a limited time. $4 up-charge for sashimi but I highly recommend as they have beautiful fish. $10 includes all you can eat brought to your table- sushi rolls, garlic noodles (get them), fried rice AND spring rolls.

WGSvuPiSQ56JAGp34wzvCQ.text: Great fresh sushi, best spicy garlic edamame I've ever had, must get! Really good service!

jTy7bB6mQt5GgB3ZWteHBw.text: This place was really pricey and I've had better sushi then this. While the place was nice, I wasn't too thrilled about the sushi menu. There weren't a lot of options and I felt most of the options that were there were almost all the same. The lounge area where we were seated at had mosquitoes, which I thought weird. Aside from being dark and small it was kinda uncomfortable to get into.  Not going to say what I had was bad, but it wasn't worth +$15 and it was a bit messy and all over the place when I would try to eat it. If you want really great sushi then this probably isn't the place, all you will get here is a pricey messy roll.

gCiAWnzObmeihq0MJxS8DA.text: Great sushi, music, service and decor.  A bit of a strip mall feel so interior could be made more intimate and it would then be a five star experience.  Definitely will go back.

photos.caption: Photo of Pisces Sushi Bar & Lounge - Charlotte, NC, United States. So good!

H8UKZsWUEnFj105PcNHEUw.text: I really wanted to like this place much better. But in taking into account the price I can only give Pisces 3 stars. Was it good? Yes. Fresh? Again yes. Was it worth $20 a roll? NO.  To give a fair comparison to other Charlotte Sushi places, I ordered 2 of their signature rolls. One featured spicy jalapenos,  the other had filet mignon on top. Both were good and fresh. But both were also missing that Wow factor....that je ne sais quois.  Now the bartender was awesome, and his drinks rocked! But for 2 rolls and 2 drinks, that set me back $75 (including tip)!  To me, the best Sushi I have had in Charlotte so far still is Sushi Guru in Southpark. Their Sushi Guru Roll is TO DIE FOR! If anyone out there has other suggestions for great sushi place then pease let me know. I lived out West for 6 years so I know good Sushi.

73owAHa3GVHdYZAiS3U-tg.text: The all-you-can-eat Saturday special was awesome. Good stuff! Try the garlic noodles with the shrimp sauce too Definitely going back

EYTIov5M0zOMYC-2O9T1RQ.text: First of all, when I ask for a gluten free menu he says we don't have one, but can you eat soy...like soy has anything to do with gluten.  So I have to read the whole menu to make sure nothing had temporarily in it.  It took me awhile and what I ordered want even good, was bland.  My friend got the octopus which didn't even taste fresh to me.  We also didn't have s reservation and when we got there at 7 there wasn't even anyone in the place yet we had to sit at the bar with the bearded bar tenders.  I'm sad that one of my favorite places to eat had declined so much in customer service and price, (did I mention the drinks are 18dollars) yikes.  so let's just say I won't be coming back here anytime soon

BZeTuSig4LvPx5ZzEd2Bng.text: Sushi is delicious and fresh. Apparently we stopped in on wine night.. That deal cannot be beat ... ENDLESS wine GREAT service REASONABLE pricing

tj9ZwVpIGni9Lf8aGPpL6g.text: $10 all you can eat sushi lunch. 'nough said.   The rolls were simple but well made. Service was friendly and attentive.

I_C9es5vlvMy6TSQ95ZnIw.text: My favorite sushi place in the area! I don't make bold choices when it comes to sushi. I have tried, but just can't bring myself to like raw fish. However, Pisces offers really great options for vegetarians and people that like to go the cooked route with their sushi. One of my favorite rolls is the Yellow Submarine, a shrimp tempura and cream cheese roll topped with mango & eel sauce. I've also had the Taurus Veg, which is sweet potato, cucumber, avocado and mango wrapped in sesame soy paper. Added to my list of tries is the Kissy, Lil' Bastard, and Crystal Veg. All AMAZING. I love how many options I have here and how unique the flavor profiles are. The tempura fried Oreos with green tea ice cream is something I dream about still. So, so good. Although I don't order the raw fish options, I see them come out to the tables around me and they look extremely fresh and well made. You can see the chefs working at a bar right in the dining room. Great option for sushi night!

photos.caption: Photo of Pisces Sushi Bar & Lounge - Charlotte, NC, United States. Kissy, Lil&#39; Bastard, and Yellow Submarine
Photo of Pisces Sushi Bar & Lounge - Charlotte, NC, United States. Taurus Veg roll

Tt0d8ajKkKJzwUgJjZddcA.text: I wish I could rate this place 6 stars. The ambience as soon as you walk in had a upscale bar type feel to it. You somewhat get this feeling that you are going to have to sit out with everyone which was quite loud. The waitress took us around back to a secluded booth where my date and I could converse in piece and enjoy the delicous food. Everything was absolutely phenomenal from the get go. Our server Kevin was not only knowledgeable of items on the menu but very personable. My date and I enjoyed the atmosphere and food selection. If im not mistaken the manager came to check on us. This is not the "Oh hey are you ok...ok good". You can tell she genuinely cared about how are evening was going. I have literally tried sushi from here to Timbuktu and this is by far the best sushi. We also tried the Saki "Leechi" which was delicious. A bit pricey but well worth it. Again, my date and I thoroughly enjoyed our evening at Pisces and will be back very soon!

thq99WBRcwyt1L5ehrXeYg.text: I've wanted to eat here for so long and finally made it. It was so disappointing! All of our sushi rolls were very mediocre and they weren't even pretty - very sloppy. Charlotte must have some very low sushi standards.

M7vA3XpFEuwKxnipBmztxw.text: We came in to celebrate my birthday. Excellent sushi excellent service. We had Kellyanne tonight and she was phenomenal!  Ask for her if you go in! So far this is one of the better sushi joint in Charlotte, we will come back!

L5p41JE9xyadNCHMw-W1EQ.text: Pisces is one of my favorite spots in town for sushi for a variety of reasons. Some of them are:   - Bob the Bartender - The Screaming "O" Roll - Tuna bruschetta - Garlic noodles - Bob the Bartender

GR-B5upiqeposhpagzBJ3g.text: I took my wife here for her birthday based on recommendations from acquaintances. I was rather disapointed, the choices are limited and what we had while good was not great. The atmosphere was  lacking it had the feel of trying to impress me but missed all around. I felt on top of other guests. I don't expect to go back.

T6vdt6bkv57SefbFKJEX1A.text: Our 2nd stop on our passport tour of Charlotte restaurants. The drink, pick your poison was #1. The atmosphere was sexy and the guitar player was on point. We enjoyed the vibe at this stop. Plus, they had jellyfish in the wall.
