VbiWLOGNPR6qXzuBfy52CA.text: If you're going for some delicious sushi rolls and creative drinks, you can't go wrong here. Great environment and staff as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Pisces Sushi Bar & Lounge - Charlotte, NC, United States. Avocado martini
Photo of Pisces Sushi Bar & Lounge - Charlotte, NC, United States. Tempura Oreos w/ green tea ice cream

-Fr0-_VEYF-YXvH15JTVEA.text: I went to Pisces for the all you can eat lunch yesterday! The sushi was great quality for the nature of what you were expecting. The nigiri sushi was great. My favorite was the shrimp tempura role. The egg rolls and sauce were awesome and my favorite! All of us were satisfied and the price was very reasonable at $14. I will be back! The only downside was service was fairly slow

vZogqJnRnMpekOQz6h6Elg.text: We dined here last week.  I noticed upon entering that it smelled like air fresher had been recently used.  It was very strong.  As we sipped  our wine the fragrance diminished.  Then, I noticed the person at the bar adding some sort of fragrance to a diffuser at the end of the bar.    I don't believe restaurants should be putting strong scents into the air if they are serious about serving food.  I left wondering why they were doing that.  We aren't sure we will be back.

8NvLIsh_xpf6PLLrvZa0xg.text: I'm thrilled we chose Pisces for a girl's night meal. Their service was friendly, welcoming and not at all pushy. My friend and I ordered similarly; chilled cucumber salad with a sashimi pick and sides. We loved how the refreshing salad acted as a palate cleanser. My friend noted the dish reminded her of poke with less oil. We split the garlic edamame and roasted brussel sprouts. Both were deliciously satisfying and packing substantial flavor. Our tuna and salmon sashimi orders rounded out the pairings. Super fresh and light! This is by far my favorite sushi spot in Charlotte and can't wait to try more menu items.

00k6GNkZ7PMMQ7R7SdcC-w.text: Some fantastic specials everyday, is one reason why Pisces has easily become one of my favorites in Charlotte, and I haven't been here two weeks yet! My new friend took here in my first weekend in town, and now I'm kinda hooked on Pisces. Also, Pisces is my sign ha ;)   We went on a Saturday for a late lunch and it was packed. Thankfully, we were seated right away. I got the Chicken and Shrimp Hibachi entree, which was served with garlic noodles (extra $1) along with miso soup and ginger salad. Also, we had an order of Crab Dumplings to share, and Holy Moly, those were ridiculously delicious!   Pro-tip: Check out their made to order all-you-can-eat Sushi lunch for $11.00/person: with 26 Sushi rolls options (all rolls are 1/2 of a full roll: aka 4 pieces-which you can't get it to-go btw) and kitchen items like fried wonton strips, fried rice, garlic rice, veg. spring rolls and fried pork. However: - Keep in mind you might be fined for all-you-CAN'T-eat-Sushi if you wasted too much food, as they're trying to avoid food wastage.  - Nigiri cost $5 extra.  ... And for those who doesn't know about the specials and lazy to find out, here's the scope: Mondays: Half price wine glasses. Tuesday: Half price sake. Wednesday: Half price wine bottles. Thursday: Half price cocktails. And it gets better, - Daily: $4 Sapporo drafts. - Weekday Happy hour 4pm-6pm Sushi & apps  Sadly, Pisces Sushi Bar is closed on Sundays. Pisces, I'll be regular!  Four and Half Yelps

ffJYJ_5_quFPPP_0D2_z5A.text: This place is a whole mood. Ive always loved the vibe. Plus the food is usually on point. I recently discovered after not eating here for a while (no particular reason just hadnt been eating out) that they have a sushi lunch buffet for just $11. Its a great atmosphere for a date, ladies night, or night out with the fellas. The staff may look snarky but they are all hella friendly. Do yourself a favor and check this spot out.

95gsXy7PSZzWtFdC9vbg4Q.text: In Charlotte for a conference and needed a convenient spot to take a sponsor to lunch.   Food was top notch and princes very reasonable.

PePf-uqLelb5gLCDTRoL-w.text: I rarely give a 3 Star review may I add. I do love their sushi, even though it's slightly over priced. I came for the lunch special. The sushi was next to none with the fish but a ton of rice which I hate. It was good but they could use more fish. They are VERY serious about "order what you can eat". The waitress literally came off threatening about explaining how it worked and was so serious about it. It also took me a long time between sushi orders to get my sushi when the restaurant really wasn't busy. I will still come here but they need some improvements for sure to stay relevant towards all the other amazing sushi places I've been too. Sushi was too ugly to take and lost a pict

COrFh0NRRQF3IZskomDBYA.text: We went to Pisces for restaurant week and while the food was good, the service was rather slow.  My entire meal came out before my fiance's first course. Luckily I ordered hibachi and he ordered sushi and we were planning to share anyways, so he didn't go hungry. However, we did get our $30 worth.  They had a good variety of either hibachi or 2 sushi rolls for entrees, and the Restaurant Week menu included drinks.

pl9Cl61DAp-nwdz6gZBd0g.text: Great sushi rolls. The Hurricane was amazing! I came in at 9:30, they close at 10 and I was unimpressed with them cleaning around me. If you close at 10, close at 10, not 9:30. Gave 4 stars for the poor service.

-Fx-ikZ-Jq2_CjLIMz1sOg.text: Looking for apathetic attitudes, crowds(kinda more like a wait without a crowd), and subpar sushi? This is your place. After hearing rave reviews from colleagues and friends I decided to give Pisces a try for a quick lunch.   Walked in around 12:00 and was told there was a wait for at table despite half to the place being empty. Happily sat at the bar to avoid the seemingly unexplainable wait. Ordered the AYCE sushi because why not? Well I will tell you why not...the rolls are poorly constructed. I get serving in half orders to cut down on waste, but the rolls are really small and the rice to filling ratio is very clearly off to cut costs. Was kind of confused by their menu as there were a lot of options with Mango asked the waitress about it and she just shrugged and gave some sarcastic quip. I was genuinely interested about the mango and if the place was going for a fusion vibe, but clearly the bartender didn't seem interested in answering questions.   The service only went down hill from there, the bartender was surprisingly never behind the bar, thus making refills and a reorder basically impossible. Literally had to flag her down from across the restaurant. To make matters worse I could hear a male staff member making remarks about the appearance of a patron to another staff member, not the place or time.

hOwaqhNlJ6F1KecpM-2mRA.text: The is probably one of the best sushi restaurants that I have been to. The food was really wonderful and the atmosphere is nice. I love the music and our waitress was really nice, friendly and knowledgeable. I would recommend this restaurant if you are looking to have some delicious sushi. They have multiple options of food and give you large portions.

yrW8J7U3Bo2KhD2l87D3vw.text: Came to this sushi bar for the "happy hour special" that ended at 230pm - not sure when it starts. The atmosphere is nice and would be a great date place with Drake playing in the background ;) The happy hour including different speciality rolls and such for only $11! The menu also had different items to chose from like hibachi. I had a Moscow mule called CARDI B which was pretty good ! I don't even eat sushi much but this was definitely a great place to try different rolls. Remember to read the fine print because if you waste your food you will be charged full price !

v6N_Iga7zyDC-v-lPzzIRQ.text: Very clean environment. I love the quality of the fish and ingredients here too, nothing is of poor quality. Our waitress Chelsea was very helpful and attentive, not to mention clean and courteous. The menus seem a little small in variety, but the fact that they served Waygu was impressive to me.  Unfortunately, I have been spoiled by "complex" sushi and though some of it was a little bland, but everything tasted wonderful.  Definitely will visit again. A great place for meetings, dates, or by yourself.

photos.caption: Photo of Pisces Sushi Bar & Lounge - Charlotte, NC, United States

jGTDXvnRK1fA1lvOz7AMGA.text: Very good food enjoyed the lunch special and the atmosphere was very pleasant. I wish they offered military discounts but I guess not every place is military friendly. It gets very crowded at lunch.

photos.caption: Photo of Pisces Sushi Bar & Lounge - Charlotte, NC, United States. Lunch

gsxu7S-CFALD7HVmS9hZUQ.text: I've been here for the all you can eat lunch special that they have more times than I can count so here we go....  When I'm dining by myself (which is 98% of the time), I get the Pork Gyoza as my starter- they used to give 4 but they've reduced it to 2 which doesn't matter because you can always order more. The garlic noodles are good too and they give a pretty big portion so it's a great option for sharing.   I always order green tea with my meal and since I usually get the same server, she always hooks me up (I don't remember your name, but you're the best).  The choice of rolls on the AYCE lunch menu are pretty basic, but you want to make sure you know what to order and what to stay away from because they will charge you full price for whatever you don't finish...  I mainly stick to the yellowtail, salmon and tuna options because I honestly feel as though I'm getting more bang for my buck that way, but there are other options like crab salad and "vegan" options like avocado and sweet potato...   *SIDE NOTE* the sweet potato roll is literally a sweet potato fry rolled up in sushi rice. Literally.  Dassit.   The crab salad roll is made with imitation crab meat so I wasn't a big fan of it. The eel avocado roll is my favorite- I love the sauce they put on it. Sometimes I scrape off some of the sauce and put it on my other rolls. It's THAT bomb.  The rolls are about half the size of a regular sushi roll and you only get 4 pieces of each of the roll(s) you order which isn't a big deal IMO because you can always order more of something you really like.  *ANOTHER SIDE NOTE* I have noticed that when you get there after 2pm the sushi isn't cold like you'd expect it to be; it's actually pretty much room-temperature which bothered me a lil bit so I make it a point to come in earlier...  All in all, $12 for AYCE sushi hits the spot for me. The rolls are very basic (and small) but I mean, how much do you REALLY expect for $12...?

xhDKfiu-fFpIyKBsKXYwnQ.text: I had my birthday dinner here last night and everyone was very nice!! The food was awesome the staff was very friendly and accommodating! I highly recommended this place for a good time and good food! My moscato wine was sweet and delicious! The sushi roll and pineapple fried rice was a knockout!! Thank you so much for making my birthday dinner awesome!!

gbMJnT7A9L4idSFqCgbkaw.text: This five star review is based on happy hour (4-6) on Monday-Friday.  You can not beat the happy hour prices and drink specials.   I took a picture of the current happy hour menu.  The restaurant is also not crowded at this time so your service is impeccable and the food comes out promptly.  We ordered 2 screaming o's, 1 panther roll, 1 crunchy spicy tuna, and the pork gyoza appetizer.  My total bill was $34 before tip.  What a deal!  You can't get this quality and quantity of sushi anywhere else in charlotte for this price.  My husband says it's the best sushi in charlotte.   My favorite is the screaming o.  So amazing. :)

kSF14SKOfKmOH_2jkFU9nA.text: Good sushi but very slow. I wish half stars were an option because I would say it's 3.5. I'm not sure if it's intentional with the all you can eat but at 1:00pm on a Tuesday, with a half full restaurant, it took nearly an hour total for one main order then one reorder.   I sat at the bar and they have the person working the bar also handling multiple tables. At times, it was tough to get her attention because she was constantly having to run around to tables. I put my initial order in at 12:55 and it arrived at 1:25. Watching the three sushi chefs, it is clear they are not trying to get rolls out quick. Second order went in at 1:32 and did not come until 1:51, only after the server sensed the frustration of myself and another individual at the bar who ordered at the same time. She went over and within minutes our rolls were actually made.   But overall the sushi is good for all you can eat and has a wide selection. You can't beat the price so I guess you are getting what you pay for when it comes to waiting on the food/service. I would say it's realistically, the quality and selection warrants 4-5 stars but it really drags it down when you know you can't come in and get your monies worth within an hour lunch break. I am being generous to the business and rounding up rather than giving three stars.

QvArIqD-6U3NBMogKa-gDA.text: Again this is one of the places i have been to over 1,000 times now deciding to write a review on since going here yesterday to indulge in a drink until my friend arrived so we can go onto our next destination near. The drink the waitress highly recommended was ok, can't quite remember the name of it but i do remember it was some type of mango cocktail with Saki added. Past times coming here i had the hibachi shrimp and chicken which is good and the crunchy sushi rolls are to die for. My boyfriend and i  came here one night awhile ago and our bartender was bomb she made us some awesome drinks. Didn't get a chance to take pictures of the seating they have cool seating areas here that makes you feel like you are entering a space ship or something. The bar which i sat at the counter top is made of rocks which is cool! If you don't come here for anything else at least try their sushi!

dqCWJCvA27AvZgqSsOkFdg.text: Such a good lunch special. All you can eat rolls for $11! It's quick and really good. Nothing fancy but simple and fresh. They have the best garlic noodles I've ever had and people love the veggie spring rolls too! The owner is a young guy, who is super nice and friendly. We witnessed him handle a table of jerks next to us and he did it beautifully, with patience and professionalism. I am always up for supporting small businesses especially when the owner is great, More reason to come back!

photos.caption: Photo of Pisces Sushi Bar & Lounge - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fried Oreos with green tea ice cream

5JJjb3q_oXvK2bnFmfCSdQ.text: My colleagues and I often go here for their AYCE lunch special. Can't go wrong with a $12 AYCE lunch (including soup and salad), $10 only if you want sushi and app items. They have some good rolls, none are specialty, but above the basic. AYCE Sushi I recommend trying:  - Crunchy Roll - Spicy Tuna - Spicy Salmon - Eel Avocado - Eel Cucumber - Tuna Avocado  AYCE Kitchen items: - Pork Gyoza - Veg Spring Roll  You must eat all or it's $1 per left over roll!!  One of my colleagues swears by the hibachi plate. He always gets that when the rest of us pig-out on sushi. ha ha  Ambiance - trendy, dim lighting, would be good for dinner date or something "special". Have been going with the hubs for dinner and it gets crowded. Might spot a Panthers player, as some live within the condo complex!  Usually I would give this place a 4, but since my last visit (haven't been there since) I only give it a 2 and here is why:  We had our usual lunch pow-wow and were ready to pay. We all paid separate, which we never had a problem before. This time when our server (also the bartender) returned our cards / checks I've noticed one of my colleagues card missing. The check showed that she had ran it, so he did give it to her (checked on name on receipt too, in case she had ran a card twice or something). We brought it to her attention and at first swore that she had returned it. She even said "i ran it, so you can just sign it"...uhm hello? It's a bright red bank of america card, we noticed it was not on the black check booklet. She attempted to look around our table - as we lost it. Maybe, but before putting it to her attention, we (3 of us) had checked thoroughly. The server walked back and forth the bar / register, re-tracing her steps. looking on the ground, nothing. Probably 10 minutes go by. I even went to other tables which had received checks and were left on the table to see if it was tucked in with those. nothing. Another 5 minutes go by, what I believe the manager came over - but she didn't introduce herself. We just told her what happened and she also just looked on the ground using her cellphone as a flashlight.....20mins in, my colleague is ready to call his bank to cancel the card and we had told it to the server and the "manager". Nothing. Sever went back to the bar for a bit as the "manager" looked on the ground around our table. They were both apologetic, but 20mins in, I would have expected some kind of action, even give my colleague the meal ($8+soda) for free in lieu of the hassle and having to get a new card (it was Friday, so he would have had to wait till Tuesday, if the bank can overnight it, perhaps even for a fee - a new card sometimes cost $10 depending on your bank).  Server returns with the card...she apologized for the hassle. We were all relieved. I had asked where she had found the card, apparently she had THROWN IT OUT WITH THE DUPLICATE PAPER................................... THROWN IT OUT! eh ok. then she said "oh you don't need to tip me". WHAT? that's all you can offer? Call me a snooty NYer, but i would have given my colleague a free meal at least, if not a coupon for a free meal next time (if he decides to go back). For the hassle - work lunch, 30mins delay for 3 people to return to work.....i dunno, something.   Sure enough, I haven't returned since then. Maybe i'll check it out again, hoping the server / bartender is not there. Not sure, but that experience just doesn't sit well for me. Too bad, it was a good deal and delicious, but service belongs to the experience as well.  4 stars for the food 0 stars for guest experience averages to 2 stars.

M6QrAyEi3c76biFLt6VVtQ.text: Delicious as usual! Great service, great energy,  great food. This will forever and always be one of my favorite sushi restaurants. 9G1kGsGtyq3-_obFWeqEAg.text: The $10 all you can eat lunch special is what my coworkers and I love coming in for. The fried rice is perfect, not too greasy. Vegetable spring rolls are addicting. My go to lunch special sushi is the eel avocado. Never fails. Ambiance is nice too.

u95RTTewZefDZKD6IEOxqw.text: Great place to eat, Ive been here a ton of times. Only giving 4 out of 5 because we came in tonight (thursday) to eat and they said they close at 10:30 yet the page says midnight. No biggie, just a heads up for those who like to go out later during the weekday.

zyvDLOduebZ5iEzyjkFnMw.text: This is a solid good eat if you are searching for fresh tasting sushi. I ordered the screaming "O" roll and the cucumber special roll as well as the seared tuna in ponzu sauce appetizer. All of them were very good, especially the seared tuna. The staff are very accommodating too, our waitress was a little forgetful but her sweet personality made up for it. The reason they are not getting a higher rating is because we felt as though the table could have been more clean. The surface of the table seemed very sticky...just one of my pet peeves.

DshXlqiVWAFJEE82m1poSw.text: Went basic this evening and got the crunchy salmon roll.   Good stuff.  The food is good if not great. Good beer selection. But heres the draw. The atmosphere is really great.  They have these couch type chairs that are perfect for date night. Service is fantastic and I cant give one single complaint.  Try it you will enjoy Im sure.

K1VMAcm8sXtIMv_SMI0yzQ.text: My favorite place to have me some okinomiyaki, pan-fried dumplings, fresh mango/cucumber salad, and some rolls. I used to come here a lot, and I mean a lot!   But this place is a bit pricey :(  So I haven't been here for a while.   But I definitely will be back for some more! I like the all the waitstaffs here - they were attentive and friendly. It makes me forget about the prices and all (b/c of the yummy food and friendly ppl). Great atmosphere, trendy place to hang out.  Definitely a place to check out and dine!

cOkQYsEqBcc_6MqVjbkqxg.text: I have only been here for lunch.  But I come often, because it's one of the best places near Uptown.  The lunch buffet is made-to-order and all-you-can-eat.  The only stipulation is a limit on the number of items each person can order at once, and a requirement that you have to eat everything.  It's often not a problem!  Unlimited garlic noodles (along with things like spring roles, fried rice) are part of the options.  They can be hit-or-miss, but when they're good, it's hard to get enough.  Huge variety of sushi options.  Plenty for vegetarians and non-fish-fans.  Try the crunchy rolls.

Ad4-r4QT8MPuuh5o-Lzc7Q.text: Let's get straight to the point, they have a $10 all-you-eat sushi buffet for weekday lunch and this is probably why you're going to go here.   Nagiri (sushi with the fish on top of the rice) is an additional $5. The buffet also includes rice, garlic noodles and spring rolls. The appetizers are just filler in my opinion and not that good.  I've definitely had better sushi, and the sushi at Pisces is just ok and didn't taste that fresh. However, you're getting unlimited of it and can eat all you all you can for $10-$15, so it offsets (depending who you ask).  The sushi had a lot more rice compared to fish, and the rolls weren't executed cleanly (doesn't take an expert to see this).  Service was pretty slow and the ambience is cool except for those back booths where they seated us.  Not amazing by any means but if you're craving a sushi buffet for relatively cheap then go for it.

photos.caption: Photo of Pisces Sushi Bar & Lounge - Charlotte, NC, United States. Lunch sushi buffet; Lots of rice compared to fish and the execution of the roll could use some work.

xOj-Umsn9wSlnjjeY1tE_w.text: Great service and atmosphere. I got a rainbow roll and it was good!

bnr13iKC3ofqwBNcik3uyw.text: Visiting Charlotte from ATL. Sat at the bar and had awesome service. The salmon nigiri was delicious and so was the big salmon roll (sinner smoked salmon for regular). Only reason for giving 4 stars instead of 5 is that all of the salmon was a little chewy instead of buttery like I'm used to. Would definitely return.

photos.caption: Photo of Pisces Sushi Bar & Lounge - Charlotte, NC, United States. Drooling.

euBHhqes3c4iXKgCNYH32Q.text: Meh. I came in for lunch one day and ordered from the menu. My sushi roll was fine, but nothing too special. Everyone else seemed to be enjoying the $11 all you can eat sushi. If you're looking for unlimited sushi, this would be a good lunch stop.

WU58zhorQvz4tOpDH4eMwg.text: Similar to other reviews, let's be honest, I went here for the $10 sushi buffet during weekday lunch. Between my friend and I, we tried several different rolls. They're all basic and you get four pieces of each, so not a full roll like you'd get at other places. My favorite was the eel and avocado, seemed to have the most substance. The crispy roll is a skip, it literally was like tempura flakes rolled in seaweed and rice. Didn't taste extremely fresh, but for $10, how high can your standards really be?   Rolls weren't anything spectacular, fried rice (also included in the all-you-can-eat) was not your typical fried rice, it was sticky rice that looked like they tossed some carrots in. I wouldn't order it again. The spring rolls were just okay, sauce was at least yummy. Service seemed slow for a weekday lunch, after I arrived it took forever for our waiter to come back and take our order, but he was semi-attentive after that until the place started to fill up. He at least didn't let our drinks go empty. If I return, I'd probably order a roll off the actual menu next time.

UNnGsWVR-el7NAV9D2TbGg.text: Love this place. I usually go for the all you can eat but on the rare occasion I go for dinner I am always satisfied with the beautiful rolls you can choose from. I don't think I have ever been disappointed here. The drinks are really good too. I swear by the garlic noodles - get them when you can.

Ybvnu-qDmUH2nab456eIWg.text: Really nice sushi and at reasonable price! I ordered the cucumber special and it lived up to the expectation :)

photos.caption: Photo of Pisces Sushi Bar & Lounge - Charlotte, NC, United States. Special cucumber roll

GHqr7j8Ri_9ZcBzTmCFnNw.text: I've eaten here so many times and I can say that the food is always spectacular!! They have never let me down. The part that is a crap-shoot is where you sit. If you get those amazing booths that have darkness and privacy, you're golden. But if you are at one of the tables and there are tons of other people out there, too, you can't even have a conversation without yelling at your friends. The acoustics in there are insane. It's the opposite of a nice, inviting place to have a meal. The only time I've ever had a bad experience was when I went in for an early dinner, around 4:00, on a weekend and we asked our server if we could sit in one of the booths...and she straight up said no. There were people still in one booth (I assume left over from lunchtime) and I totally get that she was the bartender and she would have to walk an extra 20 feet to serve us (which she explained)...but, before we even got our food, we were the only customers in there, one table of four. Granted, I had a bad day earlier, so it upset me more than it usually would. But, even on a good day, I thought that was kind of messed up. When we first arrived, there was a table of what appeared to be coworkers having lunch together and they were so obnoxiously loud, we couldn't hear a single word any of us were saying. Hence, the request for a booth. Luckily they left right before we were served our food.  Oh well. Just one bad experience out of a whole bunch. But, I'd rather warn someone else about it and save them slight unhappiness than let it go.

BSPLCc3AiDfIxezbYJGT5Q.text: First time here. The roll we had was ok. I was especially excited about the fresh catch menu. Or a long king salmon fNew Zealand. I have never tasted anything so delicious and buttery. It melts in your mouth. We also had a piece of Japanese kampachi (young yellowtail). I detest yellowtail and ordered for my daughter. We ended up splitting it. Rich yet fresh. We then had kinmedai ( golden eye snapper - seated with yuzu sauce. My test of a Japanese restaurant is spicy hamachi handroll with crunch. Pretty darn good.

photos.caption: Photo of Pisces Sushi Bar & Lounge - Charlotte, NC, United States

cNcU-OjqAbvnnvElbuCkdg.text: After reading the discussions in Talk and seeing some recommendations for Pisces, I thought we would give it a try. Even though it was early lunch time when we arrived, there was a good vibe coming off the place. The large bar area and the private booths in the back looked very comfy, but we took seats in the middle of the dining room.  Opting for the all-you-can-eat, the sushi is prepared when it is ordered as opposed to the buffet-style at other places. A handful of hot plates (noodles and such) are complimented by a few different nigiri-sushi, (salmon, tamago, mackerel, etc) and a dozen or so temaki rolls. Don't expect anything earth shattering, but the stuff that they do offer is good, quality sushi that isn't nearly all rice.  Our waitress was quite attentive, refilling sodas before they were empty and getting our sushi orders before the plate was gone.  Is it the best in Charlotte? Maybe not. Is it the best ayce in Charlotte? Possibly.

photos.caption: Photo of Pisces Sushi Bar & Lounge - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pisces entrance, opposite Trader Joe&#39;s
Photo of Pisces Sushi Bar & Lounge - Charlotte, NC, United States. One plate of all you can eat

ZDIMC3Qs-miXUWq_e9I08w.text: Very good food and great service!! The all you can eat was more than just sushi!!  Well worth the try

CcKWMVqf6p89YRRCLQmAzA.text: After hearing and seeing so many positive reviews, I was very excited to give this place a try! I was hoping to love this place, and find myself a new "go-to" sushi spot for lunch. That just was not the case.  The service was quick and prompt. The quality was just lacking. I came here for the unlimited sushi lunch, and every roll I got was probably 80% rice and had very little fish in them. The best one was probably the spicy crab ... everything else was meh. I don't know if lunch is just this way, because many others have said the dinner rolls are great proportions. Based on my experience with various lunch rolls, I definitely would not recommend this place for lunch over many other tried and True sushi joints.

97Dd_ECLCS0CHXp8zPwK6w.text: You cannot beat this place for all you can eat sushi lunch. It really might be the best deal in Charlotte. And you only get half portions of each roll so you can sample a lot of different ones. Their spicy tuna roll is always on point, as well as their tuna and avocado. Their spicy crab salad roll only is crab salad with a line of Siracha, which might be my only complaint, but the crab salad is flavorful. Also, their garlic noodles and spring rolls are delicious, so save room for them, or at least a spring roll.

photos.caption: Photo of Pisces Sushi Bar & Lounge - Charlotte, NC, United States. All you can eat lunch menu (as of 3/29/16) 11:30-2:30

YfRj7MmPXpWKdcmTP3U-8Q.text: First time here and we loved it! The main room goes around the corner to their booths. I loved the atmosphere in the booth, private and cozy without feeling crowded.  Our server, Chelsea, was really great! She was upbeat and very knowledgeable about the menu. Since it was our first time we followed her suggestions and loved everyone of them-the Screaming O' roll was divine and she gave us a crash course in sake!  We will definitely be back to try some more of their sushi rolls!

photos.caption: Photo of Pisces Sushi Bar & Lounge - Charlotte, NC, United States

gzhSiBQ5toxIGtkcma0ciA.text: This is one of my favorite places.  I've been here 3 times since summer and it is now November.  The happy hour specials are awesome.  You get 1/2 priced rolls from 4-6pm M-F and they usually have a drink special.  A large group of us went last night.  Most of us got the rolls, one got the calamari, and we all got the crab dumplings and endamame as an appetizer.  Personally I got the XOXO roll which was warm and had scallops and other goodies inside.  It was the best one, a bit too much mayo on top but really good.  The rainbow roll was good and another one of my favorites, the spider roll was excellent.  Then let me tell you about dessert - omg, you MUST get the fried oreo dessert with a scoop of vanilla bean or green tea ice cream.  It is to die for.  Always a pleasure to eat here !

photos.caption: Photo of Pisces Sushi Bar & Lounge - Charlotte, NC, United States. Rainbow Roll, Spider Roll, XOXO Roll

I-zxsOJ76qcgzCdTJiUJMg.text: I've come for their $11 all-you-can-eat lunch special several times now, and it hits the spot every time. Yes, the sushi rolls are small and simple, but it's still fresh and a great deal for that price. The restaurant itself is also nicely decorated with a clean, modern finish. Great place to satisfy sushi cravings!

photos.caption: Photo of Pisces Sushi Bar & Lounge - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Pisces Sushi Bar & Lounge - Charlotte, NC, United States

1vTsPLW4TY4w8SRS_UNRxg.text: All you can eat is the best deal in Charlotte, happy hour is bangin, and it is a great spot for a date. I've been eating here for five years and have never had a bad server. The fish is always fresh, and if you want to try something different, they have a list of specials that rotate every week. Oh, and not to mention some amazing drink specials. Definitely one of my favorites in the Charlotte area.

8LRuVa05Tk3SbIEHlo5n-w.text: Nice staff, nice environment, and great sushi! I've been multiple times for the sushi lunch special and it's always been amazing! I love taking my friends who don't typically eat in charlotte to eat here! It's always a hit!

TCL4IGW2OLPsg6AUvACyXg.text: Showed up around 2:45 on Friday for late lunch alone.   Was greeted by a nice host.  He let me choose my table.     I was greeted by my server who took my drink order and who was also polite.  She asked if I needed a few minutes to look over the menu.  I did.  10 minutes passed....and she never came back.   I observed....she had lots of tables to serve, pre-bus, and check - out.   She wandered around with very little urgency.    I got tired of waiting.... so I just walked out.  No one seemed to notice I was even there or that I was leaving.   I kind of felt invisible.  Im sure the sushi was gonna be fabulous....but unfortunately, my fist visit to this restaurant....we didn't even get to the food.  I gave it 2 stars for the over all experience of being overlooked.....it's not that there was a bad experience.  It was just disappointing because I could have gone to my regular sushi joint....but wanted to try something different.  Bummer.

AFznUeNgFfIb8tg_0h9l9A.text: Chelsea was AMAZING! First time at Pisces and she knew exactly what to recommend. Those roles were everything and more.   We wanted a booth and only tables were available. The staff remembered and when one was available they moved us right away without us asking them.   Thank you Chelsea for your wonderful costumer service.

rXKzvX1sCGAmgWMCNKuQ4A.text: Great sushi! Great place for a date...fun booths!

a3VPizYaGVngrAd7tM3E3A.text: Beware the rice Nazi!  The $9 all you can eat special is still a great deal, but as stated on the menu, if you don't eat all of the rice you will be charged extra.  Spicy rolls were not so spicy.  Outside of that, very good food, good selection, the atmosphere was great, our waitress was very pleasant and attentive, and the private pods were a great touch.  Full bar available also.  ***Update 10/1/2010 - this is now a $12 all you can eat special!  Take off a half-star.

4DpaPiLi2vRa51-4ujruXQ.text: Boo - I guess I knew going in for the all you can eat sushi for $12 was a little too good to be True...my instinct was right.  The plus was the atmosphere I think the restaurant was decorated very hip and they had these really neat little booths.  The sushi was not good though you could have served balls of rice and it would have been equivalent to what I received.. The nigiri pieces I did get didn't taste very fresh which is always a bad sign for me when I'm eating sushi.    But I still would be willing to give this place another chance perhaps for dinner and ordering off the full menu.  I've seen some good reviews on this place and don't want one bad experience to scare me away.

46aUeUBCkPek7OYcb6i_mQ.text: Yum! Came here while visiting from out of town and was looking for some delish sushi to start off our Saturday. Pisces did not disappoint! We started with some house ginger salads- loved the homemade dressing! The sushi was fresh and flavorful- I had the rainbow, metro, and a california roll to top things off. My friends liked theirs as well. Overall, pretty cool scene and good sushi. We had a booth in the back that was tucked into a wall which would be perfect if you're looking for something a little quieter.

ZAAyocMF3hG4lmSU39cpAg.text: I'll start by admitting that I am a huge fan of this place. I find myself at Pisces every other week, regardless of my budget, I can not stay away. Why? For one, it's got to be the most laid-back atmosphere I've ever experienced at a sushi joint. That does not mean the service is listless, It's not. It just has a cool vibe w/ the circular booths, the jellyfish fish tank, and now w/ their new lounge. I suggest everyone start off w/ one of Bob Peter's (best bartender in Charlotte) custom cocktails. Just tell him what you usually drink, and he'll blow your mind w/ something you've never even thought of. As far as the sushi, it's topnotch. At this point, I just tell them to surprise me, and they bring out something delicious every time. There are a few don't miss items: the "Screaming O roll" is my favorite, w/ "the Pisces roll" a close second.

IS0es28uYjkC_5tcAue4GA.text: I've only been for lunch for the all you can eat.  The service is very slow, BUT that is because all the sushi is fixed to order. Nothing sits out with people grabbing or setting tongs on top of the food after handling them. Not all rolls are available on the all you can eat menu, but I'm not complaining, the food that is on the menu is great! They even have inari, whish is difficult to find sometimes. I recommend you try one. For all you can eat lunch, you get to pick up to 10 items at a time per person. once you get you items, don't hesitate to order more as long as you know you will be able to eat the majority of it without being wasteful.

mzJK4TC82gcC3cFw9_NkEQ.text: I reserved a table for restaurant week and was late. They held it for 40 minutes after I called so that was appreciated, but we lost our table and was fortunate to find a seat at the bar. We met Bob and he was awesome. Live music from guy playing cover songs on guitar, which was great especially when he played classics. Hibachi is hard to find in Charlotte and I can see why. The food wasnt the special yummy Hibachi I am used to up North but I wouldn't  mind going back for drinks and live music.

5k3wFJKBQzEh3o5ubGxz8w.text: First time in Charlotte and me and my husband enjoyed diner here. The fried calamari was great and the drinks where on point. Sushi was good and the presentation was pretty and chic. Will visit again next time we are in Charlotte.

photos.caption: Photo of Pisces Sushi Bar & Lounge - Charlotte, NC, United States. eel special roll

ya6JL0zpVKPmERCvwgQHKw.text: I've eaten here multiple times and sometimes I really enjoy it (and the half off bottle of wine) and sometimes I'm not as pleased.  I have enjoyed the Bagel Deluxe roll...  Their tuna (maguro) ngiri seemed fresh but there wasn't enough of it.  It was a very thin slice of tuna on a large piece of rice... just not exactly what I was expecting.  The atmosphere is nice and can be quiet on the right night...

K6fMS42zu0qkK4jph27Jxw.text: Went last Saturday and it was great. Had the Love Boat which was a lot of sushi.  Spicy tuna rolls, amazing! The booths are quiet and private, a perfect place for a date so you can have good conversation. The only reason I did not give it five stars is the prices of the drinks.  Although GREAT, the drinks are a bit pricey. I had the divine wind martini which is really good.

TQBfW48oCmVDBEzjVsRubg.text: Everything here is fantastic. They've recently added new sushi rolls to the menu and I have to say I'm never afraid to try anything new here because I know it will be delicious. Screaming 'O' is a must try. The infused vodkas are fun to try too. They don't have drink specials anymore and I wish they'd bring those back, but the food makes up for that!

SZcI1Ef39KPuelBT3Vb6TA.text: It's a trendy new place to hang out. The food (sushi) is OK. I lived in Japan for a while, and enjoyed sushi there very much, but I'm not a picky gourmet eater or anything and find most of American style sushi pretty decent, though entirely "different" from what I'm used to in Japan.   I went to the place for all you can eat lunch deal (which was actually restricted to 10 tiny orders total, but whateva). I don't know about regular menu items, but their portions were ridiculously small (one piece instead of normal two for each nigiri order, and tiny 4 pieces for each maki order). I can see they're trying to pretty-fy (trendy-fy or whatever the words you can come up with) their sushis, but especially makis were easy-to-make cheater dish anyway (which you never see served in a restaurant in Japan), so it's kind of funny they try to make those look "high class" by making them ridiculously small.  Another thing I'd never understand (not just this place but all sushi places I've been to in the US) is that they serves those cheap fake crab-flavored fish-meat substitutes as "crabs". Really, do they expect anybody actually thinks there's any crab in those things? If you can't afford real crab, why not just skip it from the menu, or at least clarify it being fake on the menu? I've gotten used to this fake advertisements in sushi menus in various places by now, but it's still surprising to see them proudly served in a supposedly posh place like Pisces. My order of "crab" nigiri sushi came with a piece of rectangular fake crab meat placed on top of a ball of rice. Do you seriously call this a sushi?  All in all, it was OK. You can find better (and cheaper) sushis even in Charlotte. I won't name names since I don't wanna sound like plugging the places.  On the plus side, the waiters were very cheerful and attentive. All in all, I think it's a nice trendy place to hang out. Just don't expect too much in terms of food or its cost performance.

-PGlMlYit-qn6GsLdFUt1w.text: UPDATE 9/5/2011  Went here again to test out the all-you-can-eat sushi lunch special before grocery shopping at Trader Joes, which, not surprisingly, was a bad idea. First off, their web site says the special runs from 11:30am to 3pm, when in actuality, you have to place your order BY 2:30 and they stop serving you at 3pm. So if you go and want the all-you-can-eat deal, you better get there at 11:30 if you plan on having a leisurely lunch.  That was a bummer, but we gave them a pass since we didn't walk in until 2:50pm. Then, however, we were told they had a deal--half-off bottles of wine. We ordered a bottle, but the server returned to us and told us that the half-off special was only for wine, not for champagne. We'd ordered a prosecco from a section of their wine list labeled "sparkling wines."   I'm married to a sommelier. Prosecco, as it turns out, is actually wine. A sparkling wine. This miscommunication could've been avoided if it had been more clearly defined what the restaurant meant by "half-price bottles of wine on Mondays," but alas, no. After two strikes (and similar experiences here before), we decided to cut our losses and head to Zoe's across the street. It wasn't sushi, but the service was good. Sometimes that's more important.   Unfortunately won't be going here again.    --  I really want to like this restaurant. I really, really do.   Truth be told, the sushi isn't bad -- I would give the XOXO Roll and the Yellow Submarine 5 stars on their own. Those sushi rolls are the only reason for the two-star rating.  Although I've noticed they've cut the portion sizes on some of their items (most noticeably the seaweed salad), the big problem is the service. I've been here four or five times, and at its best the service has been OK. At its worst...terrible. I may not be able to go back there after the last time. We waited for 10 minutes before flagging down the hostess to ask if she could send a server our way, and then before a server even made it to our table, the table next to us was seated, ordered, and was served.   There are too many other places to go in Charlotte to waste my time here.

afbXPoIRrru-aOhU5X_VYg.text: I was hoping this place would live up to things I had heard about it, but sadly it did not.  First our waitress seated us right in the front of the house in the most awkward place and then refused when we asked to move further back.    I had the spicy tuna roll and the first love roll both sounded promising on the menu, but did not deliver in taste. The spicy tuna was not spicy and was reminiscent of catfood, the first love roll was o.k., but nothing to write home about. Both were DRY, bland, and seemed poor quality.    The price for both rolls was pretty ridiculous (about $10 ea) considering you only get  6 very small pieces of each. Hungry guys would have to order about 5 to get full.  My advice: skip this place and go to RuSans for better sushi and better service.  One star for a pretty interior. Zero stars for service and food.

XEpC6ZyWt6DstPEuh6BtuA.text: I looked past all of the tepid reviews and decided to give Pisces a try--if for no reason other than having someplace new to write about--last night.  Bad choice.  I should have listened to all you Yelpers.  Hell, it's why we all Yelp.  I won't make the mistake again, I'll tell you that.    I'd give Pisces 2 1/2 stars because they're not "A-OK" to me, but our waitress, Nicole, garnered an extra half star for the restaurant because she was so kind and helpful.  I could give a quarter star for the booths because they make you feel like you're eating sushi in a cave.  That's pretty cool.  The rest of the uber-modern decor made me yawn.  It's becoming so passe.    The food is waaaaay overpriced.  They're charging Nikko prices for Sushi 101 quality.  We chose to order no rolls because they all seem to include cream cheese, something fried, mayo or whatever the hell Screaming O sauce is.  The sashimi certainly wasn't as bad as some strip mall sashimi that I've had, but it certainly wasn't worth the price tag they attached to it.  But here's the reason why I'll never return to Pisces......  We ordered the sushi-sashimi combo, which comes 9 pieces of sashimi, 8 nigiri and a California roll.  California rolls suck, and therefore we did not want to eat the California roll.  We asked to replace the California roll with a spicy salmon roll and be charged the extra dollar that the spicy salmon roll costs.  Makes sense, right?  Not to Pisces ownership, it doesn't.  So...we ordered the combo, minus the California roll (so no food was wasted) and ordered the spicy salmon roll ala carte for $6.  Now here's a word to all you business majors and future restauranteurs from your Uncle Todd:  don't give up future business for something as silly as a simple substitution.  It's a bad business move.  And so I say to you, Pisces ownership:  seriously?  You're willing to lose potential long-term business over something as simple as substituting one simply made roll for another simply made (yet not as tasty) roll?  Silly.  Just silly.

vnI14lDyW60yRQhiG_jvwQ.text: Pisces has returned to the top of the list as my favorite Sushi restaurant in Charlotte.  The atmosphere and the service has always been impeccable but I must say that I did throw quite a fit when the XOXO was removed from the menu.  Well, I am happy to find that it is now back.  Love this place and it has some of the best sushi and service around!.

1T0wRgTnYTK7IfXaoOsvgw.text: After hearing awesome stories about Pisces from a few of our friends, my boyfriend and I decided to check it out one night before we hit the bars. We came in and immediately commented to each other on the cute atmosphere, even more excited than we were originally. I ignored the hostess' flat tone when she asked us if we'd rather sit at the bar or in the lounge, having worked at a late night restaurant for two years of my life, I figured she was just tired and gave her the benefit of the doubt.  Our server bounded over to the table almost immediately after we sat and asked us if we were ready to order. We explained it was our first time and that we'd be ready to order a couple of drinks and some appetizers soon. When he came back, we ordered beers and he asked to see our ID's. My boyfriend's ID is pretty old and beat up, so we were cool with it when the server said he'd have to ask a manager if he could accept it. He came back a few minutes later and asked my boyfriend what his zodiac sign was. My boyfriend is no astrological guru and accidentally answered with the wrong sign and the server simply narrowed his eyes and said "I don't know..." My boyfriend (who also has worked in the restaurant industry) then told him that if he didn't feel comfortable serving him alcohol, it was okay, but that I'd still like my drink and then  we'd be ready to order food. The server said okay and left the table. Ten minutes went by. Fifteen minutes. Twenty minutes later, we saw him - changed into a t-shirt with his backpack on, waving to his coworkers and walking out the door. REALLY? Since when has it ever been okay to leave work when you've still got a table?!  Thankfully the bartender was very cool and took over the table after I went over and explained to him what happened. He was also much more attentive and quicker when we asked him for anything (this is while also waiting on another bigger party and having a full bar of patrons). I don't know if we'll ever be back. It's a shame because the sushi was delicious. I don't remember what we got because I was so annoyed at the nerve of our original server. If we ever do come back, I'll be sure to let the disinterested hostess know we'd like to sit at the bar, NOT the lounge.

SCFWjplsqImik1AY4nqTsA.text: Pisces Sushi is the best sushi that I have had in Charlotte. My husband and I tried it out for the first time during restaurant week and we were both wowed. The lunch buffet is not to be missed if you are lucky enough to work nearby. The waitstaff was super friendly and offered great suggestions. This is a great spot for a date night or a casual meal with friends. Definitely check it out!

x3vlyOXHrcUm3FCRUBNWMg.text: We had such a great time we decided to try it again! I still am completely in love with the Metro roll but the presentation was a bit less put together this time - and the food seems to take quite awhile to come out. I will say I found a delicious new drink- the Cucumber Refresher - not too sweet or sour but just right. I will say their martini's/cocktails pack a punch so be careful or take a cab!

tDTTF4bRkDwdM1TEOQ0qRQ.text: Must say this place is a solid choice for me when I have a hankering for some sushi.  It's a solid alternative to Enso because I don't feel like I have to get dressed up and the costs are a little less.  I also think it's a fairly good romantic place to go if you can get the little cove bench seating in the back.  My girlfriend and I have been lucky both times to be able to sit there and it makes you feel secluded and like you're dining privately.  If you are here on a date, get the love boat!  It's $50 for 2 people and just a cute approach to a romantic dinner.

o3TrwgrH_3sBTSdQfsvccw.text: This is probably my favorite sushi restaurant! I absolutely love this place and the atmosphere when I visit during lunch and dinner.   $11 All you can eat sushi for lunch is the best. I always order the spicy crab, shrimp tempura, and the veggie spring rolls. Everything is made to order and the spring rolls are always hot when they come out.   I definitely recommend this place for lunch and dinner.

photos.caption: Photo of Pisces Sushi Bar & Lounge - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Pisces Sushi Bar & Lounge - Charlotte, NC, United States. Lunch Menu - All You Can Eat Sushi $11

sq1AQPClNkWpozTzctGqWg.text: Came here at lunch time when I find out they had such an amazing deal, $12 for all you can eat sushi. Really was an absolute deal. They had one sushi roll that I have never heard of before which was the sweet potato roll which was really good. On the all you can eat menu they didn't have any fried options so definitely a little more health conscious than most of the all you can eat sushi places I have been to. I was only in town for a couple days so didn't get to return to the restaurant to try anything other than the sushi, but they have some other meals that looked quite delightful. The restaurant itself was also very nice and in a good part of town that was clean and safe. The service was a tad bit slow, but that was expected given the tremendous deal they have and how many people were in the restaurant. I will definitely be returning to this place to eat when I am back again in Charlotte as this was one of the best places to eat in the area.

photos.caption: Photo of Pisces Sushi Bar & Lounge - Charlotte, NC, United States. First order at the all you eat sushi

u4dYEpGLZoPac0PRqDK_0w.text: I shall return! The sushi here is very good. I've been finding it quite difficult to find different sushi rolls near me that aren't skimpy and just too damn expensive. Service is pretty quick and liked the ambiance of the restaurant. I ordered the Fineapple express roll and that (beep) was banging! I probably should've ordered 2. Sushi rolls were a decent size too not too thin but not too big to fit into the hole in my face. Priced on point I left here feeling like I was not ripped off and completely satisfied. This place would definitely come to mind if someone would ask me for a recommendation.

photos.caption: Photo of Pisces Sushi Bar & Lounge - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fineapple Express you are divine!
Photo of Pisces Sushi Bar & Lounge - Charlotte, NC, United States

Ib4UqwJtsAQnKNqC436s6A.text: Oh my lawrd, why have I never been here before? Well that will all change since we'll be within walking distance from Pisces soon.  As someone who has been to Japan 6+ times in the past decade alone, I very much appreciate their fresh menu which had several selections from the land of the rising sun. Seriously, you guys won me over right then and there.  My only dings were:  1. I've been on keto for a long time - it's a health/fitness/lifestyle thing - and the sashimi combos come with escolar or other carby selections. I wish you could sub that out.  2. The sashimi combos come with soup and salad, both are kind of carby for us keto zealots that want to remain 5 carbs or below. I'm sure they are also factored in to the price so I wish you could modify that as well.  Other than the two dietary nitpicks, I look forward to a long lasting culinary relationship.

photos.caption: Photo of Pisces Sushi Bar & Lounge - Charlotte, NC, United States

2zjaL0Q8aaaJw8sonbNw6Q.text: We go here for the boa buns. Pisces is a go to and has great service. The spring rolls are our favorite!

id26iJacPCvUEs_viw-PiQ.text: *PLEASE NOTE THIS IS MOSTLY ABOUT THE SERVICE* Second round of trying Pisces. Same server. Same sushi buffet. Price went up from $11 to $12. Still a good deal for freshly made sushi and all you can eat but service still slow as molasses. Same server that's like angry at the world, every time we needed her attention to order something or just even to get more ginger it was like such an inconvenience to her. I don't know if $12 is worth it for good sushi with such slow service and a grumpy server. Yeah back to Rusan's and New Zealand we go!

2vrzThV0beaNuaAU9tqhRw.text: A great spot to grab lunch with friends. I always try the All-You-Can-Eat sushi that runs from 11:30-2:30pm. They marked up their price by a $1 so now it's $12 for the deal. The sushi is all made the same - rice on the outside of the roll (Uramaki). They have good appetizers! You literally pay for what you get, everything is decent!

photos.caption: Photo of Pisces Sushi Bar & Lounge - Charlotte, NC, United States. from left to right: shrimp tempura, crab tempura, and crunchy salmon

qbPic3XXGPMNevNdctrBJA.text: Sorry folks, this place didn't win me over.   Everything was average at best.  I stopped in for sushi on a Friday night and the place was steady but not packed. We were seated immediately but that's about it for our "fast customer service" experience. I guess, I should say to be fair they were having their holiday party and serving guests...but me having to flag you down for a refill or napkins is never a win in my book.   We started with the spicy garlic edamame, shrimp and vegetable tempura  and spring rolls. Meh. They were all just fine, nothing that I'd have to order again.    For dinner we ordered the Love Boat it's a good mix of food - perfect for a group to share. It's got tuna, salmon, shrimp, a philly roll, spicy tuna and rainbow roll.   The presentation was beautiful. But everything was just kinda underwhelming. Perhaps I just expected too much based on all the good reviews. Either way,  I'm not saying that I wouldn't come back. Maybe next time I'll try one of the speciality rolls or the hibachi.   Stay tuned.

photos.caption: Photo of Pisces Sushi Bar & Lounge - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Pisces Sushi Bar & Lounge - Charlotte, NC, United States. Love Boat
Photo of Pisces Sushi Bar & Lounge - Charlotte, NC, United States. Spicy Garlic Edamame

qdAqA_j7E2fF0dLv80PHJw.text: Only giving two stars cuz the food was good. Came here for a friend's birthday. Waited 45 minutes for one glass of wine. We need more accommodation for our guests as more showed up and the hostess was completely rude. She told me "No." and turned away. The server was so slow and couldn't get an order right to save her life. She FORGOT the birthday's girls food and she didn't get a meal on her birthday. When it came time for checks, she split it up asking each individual person what they had (isn't that your job know what we each had?). Terrible service. Won't return.

1nWYquL16Zl-Ajp4tuOCxQ.text: I randomly stopped in here after a dr apt. I was in the mood for hibachi and yelp led me here. Win!  I had the chicken and shrimp hibachi in the lunch sized portion. It was an ample amount of food. I even had left overs. The entree comes with a ginger salad which is pretty tasty and miso soup which is good for miso soup (I'm not a huge fan). The chicken and shrimp itself was super tasty and seasoned perfectly. It came with some tasty veggies which included broccoli, onions, mushrooms, and zucchini. I would have liked a sweet carrot but honestly didn't noticed they weren't included until well into my lunch. lol. I also had the fried rice which was perfectly cooked and garlicy. I ordered the garlic noodles as an additional side. It was tasty but not needed.   They have an all you can eat sushi special for lunch. I'm preggers so I can't partake right now but please believe I will be back in about 2-4 weeks to give that a try. Lol

photos.caption: Photo of Pisces Sushi Bar & Lounge - Charlotte, NC, United States. Hibachi chicken and shrimp was love!!!
Photo of Pisces Sushi Bar & Lounge - Charlotte, NC, United States. Lunch sushi special. I&#39;ll be back for you.

6EKREFg3lZmfI-E3c_vN4A.text: My fiance loves to come here for the all you can eat sushi. It is limited to just maki rolls but it is hard to complain for the price. For all you can sushi i think the quality of the fish and rolls is pretty good when you factor in price. Service is always top notch for us and the hassle is waiting to get in and dealing parking in the garage but those are minore.

XrbvrK41gPbzMJoFRF60XQ.text: Tried this place with my other for the first time and we thought it was pretty good. We ordered the Karyu, the hurricane and the lil' bastard. Everything was quite delicious! Definitely intend on ordering from here again.

w34__OOSqJdCr3yEDztPyA.text: The sushi was great but the smell in that place is HORRIFIC!! I felt like I was eating sushi in a PORTER POTTY!! I said something to the server and hostess and they both acted like they didn't hear me and ignored the comment completely!! I don't think I'll be coming back now but the sushi was delicious surprisingly!

KKoHARKG9I51IIGY3jTjAg.text: The sushi at Pisces is excellent and the seafood has always been fresh. The service was great as well.

WDYwVB-WoU3nEnoIIRN-oQ.text: This was our first stop while visiting Charlotte. We intentionally left Raleigh to make it here by the time they opened for all you can eat Sushi! The ambiance was nice, I loved the little cut out booths (see pic) the service was decent.  I would say attentive for sure. We ordered 2-3 rolls at a time.  I have to remember that all you can eat sushi comes with a price. The flavors were there - bu quality and food consistency seemed off. For example, the salmon was not sliced but more like ground salmon??? That was the last roll my husband ate. I loved that you can order soup, salad and rice all for-the all you can eat price ... it was a good experience, but we won't be returning. If you are trying sushi the first time this is not the place to do so. Charolette has so many other sushi bars to explore and with great quality !

Photo of Pisces Sushi Bar & Lounge - Charlotte, NC, United States

7ylRAS8mnCHDnaSkOCi9fA.text: We decided to go to this restaurant before our NYE festivities began. The service was quick & nice. I ordered the hibachi shrimp & the tango my mango roll... omg AMAZING!
