Jxjsi244XLqIAetOepn2Mw.text: Sushi wasn't the greatest.  The rolls are very small and average price of $15-18.  The service was a little slow and it didn't seem very busy.

6Dp_K-atmradNVzfB8cqLg.text: Your impression when you first walk in the door will make you question why you came to this place.  But don't let your first impression be a lasting one.  They have a great assortment of tuna including toro. I opted for a beautiful sashimi platter.   It was awesome.  Will go back when in the area.

photos.caption: Photo of Pisces Sushi Bar & Lounge - Charlotte, NC, United States

FsliEA2KlJanfWvPm2Xepw.text: Horrible service, food was forgotten. Hostess was extremely rude. Food was cold. We will not come back! Absolutely terrible!

qX97m_GTtX1zIBx08ACYxQ.text: Went here for a date night with my husband and had a great experience! Our server/bartender JP was great even though it was super busy for restaurant week, he was nice and over the top. We had the crab appetizer which was okay and the garlic pepper edamame which was the best I have ever eaten! I got the screaming O roll which was DELICIOUS and the crunchy tuna roll, it was okay. My husband got the filet hibachi with rice and veggies and it was some of the best steak he has ever gotten! We will definitely be back!!

photos.caption: Photo of Pisces Sushi Bar & Lounge - Charlotte, NC, United States

Fc9rli2WoNUxtK3t9Jsi8g.text: Pisces had great appetizers (I had the pork gyoza and pork belly buns), but I wasn't impressed with my entree - hibachi chicken. The garlic noodles were overcooked and mushy, and the chicken and vegetables weren't anything special. Someone who doesn't like sushi would probably enjoy this restaurant for happy hour rather than dinner.

9oKKmzyftLFIjRchqa1ffQ.text: My friend and I just had a wonderful experience after a problem at Pisces. We were enjoying our meal and wine when there was an issue with a sushi roll. The staff, manager and, I'm assuming, owner were extremely apologetic and accommodating. They fixed the problem then you took several additional steps to make sure the problem was taken care of. This says a lot to a customer! We will be back.

o47pwZeVfhHiV-vJdXn93g.text: Worst customer service ever. Manager very condescending.  Service very slow. Second time here and will never be back.

EDK72JfX7UR4jwJ_DSP4Ag.text: I can't say enough good things about this place. I come here for lunch (1100-1400) during the week where it's all you can eat sushi (from a select menu) along with rice, noodles and spring rolls. Great service, great food, inexpensive prices.

0E90TXFMJP7HbrDfsRHh3w.text: I have now been to Pisces, located in the heart of the Met twice, and I have thoroughly enjoyed my experience there each time.    The ambiance of Pisces is noticeable the second you walk in the door.  Despite the fact that its sandwiched in a busy plaza in the heart of Charlotte, the interior feels, calm, clean and quiet.    The service has been top notch the two times I've been there.  I've sat at the bar and ordered drinks.  I've also sat at a table for their lunch.  Each time, my server was the same chill dude, he knew what he was doing, and was very knowledgeable about the sushi and the variety of rolls they offer.  In addition, my order was correct and served in a timely fashion.    The food, in this case, sushi, was excellent.  I've had a few different rolls and they tasted fresh, were full of flavor, and stayed intact.  What else is there to say?  The ONE AND ONLY REASON, I am not giving Pisces 5-STARS is because of its location in the MET and the cluster-fu*k of a parking garage they have over there!  Its sad to say, but I don't go here more often because I'd rather peel off my fingernails than park at the "trendy" Met.     Finally, I wouldn't be doing my job as a Yelper, if I didn't mention that Pisces has the BEST ALL YOU CAN EAT SUSHI DEAL in CHARLOTTE!  You really have to go here to believe the quality and variety of fresh, made to order sushi you can get for one low price (around $12).  Otherwise, I love Pisces, and I will be there sometime soon for lunch - once my fingernails grow back of course...

8h4XdOnuUSvZSpa-kzITeQ.text: Pretty good sushi and love the $10 lunch all you can eat! Cant beat that deal! I would recommend and will return. The spring rolls are pretty good and the service was okay. Thats the main reason it got 4 stars.

0wPO5OMwkK6s_Og29PM8dg.text: Absolutely love this place! My husband and I are sushi and sake snobs, and this is our favorite place locally. Sashimi is amazing and extremely fresh! Their specialty rolls are as well, screaming o is my favorite. Definitely recommend to everyone.

Mm_3Fmg4uynMXchIFkEHfg.text: My husband and I decided to come to Pisces last minute and were surprised that we were able to make a reservation without trouble on Saturday night. It was restaurant week last week and the menu looked incredible. To my delight, every dish on the restaurant week menu was also on the main dining menu. I think when a restaurant tries to create "features" for restaurant week, instead of highlighting great dishes from their menu, it's a great disservice to the restaurant and customers who are there to gauge the quality of the restaurant and it's food.  How else would you know if it is worth coming back to a restaurant if you can't even sample the food on their everyday menu!?   Regardless, that was NOT the case at Pisces!! First off, the service was incredible. A girl named, Crystal, I believe was our waitress. We were seated in a place where the AC was blasting and she was really sweet and turned the temperature up slightly so I wouldn't freeze to death! She was very attentive and easy to speak with throughout dinner.   I can't say enough good things about the sushi!!! We ordered the tuna tataki and the A2 appetizers and sushi rolls (the Screaming "O", panthers, and the big salmon roll). The Screaming "O" was hands down the best roll and the A2 (sashimi tuna) was the best appetizer. But really, pretty much ALL OF the food and wine was great. The fish was fresh and had the right fish to rice ratio with the rolls. There is nothing more disappointing than a place that skimps on the sushi and makes the rolls laden with rice. Needless to say, we will definitely coming back to have sushi and drinks at this wonderful place!!  I have been to Pisces before for cocktails in the evening and it is a great place to bring your friends for drinks.  The decor is modern (on the lounge side) and it is dimly lit, so provides a great ambiance for small groups or a date.

YrxCmHpme_YADBwOPXhc3g.text: Found this place on my break from work. Walked in and it was small but comfortable. Everyday they have specials from all you can eat sushi to 1/2 off wine and cocktails. I got the "screaming-o" and it was delicious also got the garlic noodles. Over all had a great experience and I will definitely be coming back.

photos.caption: Photo of Pisces Sushi Bar & Lounge - Charlotte, NC, United States. &#34;Screaming-o&#34;

lshwB9MRuDctqh3XNYLw0Q.text: The service was perfect and the food was amazing! We are here visiting from FL and they exceeded our expectations!

_JHbD-_ew9pfA21PJLB81g.text: We were highly disappointed with the experience after seeing so many good reviews. We called in a to go order and the staff taking the order did not even know the sauces on the menu I was asking about.  I also requested sauce to be on the side but it was globbed on the top.  My girlfriends cucumber rolls were the smallest pieces of sushi I had ever seen, and the same goes for my $3 sashimi yellowfin tuna.  After spending $23 on two rolls we were extremely unsatisfied and ended up grabbing breakfast sandwiches at McDonalds.  I would recommend trying anywhere else. I have had 5x better sushi at cowfish and ginbu for half the price.

YtS1UssiCzTqOkAkoae3tA.text: Lunch time all you can eat sushi(4pc rolls) for ten bucks was a pretty great deal. Friendly service. My friends and I ordered an abundant amount and none of us had a complaint about quality. Highly recommended for any group craving sushi for lunch.

HTVmd-6nbacXFjr-itqE_g.text: It makes me sad that I had a four star experience here before and have to downgrade to a two. I went the other night with a big group and it was just a bad night. I felt like Pisces is now in RuSans league-loud music, bad service and mediocre sushi.   The service was pretty crappy-we had two servers --the regular server who had someone shadowing him and helping out. So you would think double the plasure, double the fun--or whatever, you would think two servers would be more effiicient yes? No. it took forever in all aspects. We ordered our drinks, waited awhile and then after sitting around for 10 minutes after that just looking around and rubbernecking for our servers-they finally took our order. The food came out at different times so one person would get a hot entree dish 10 minutes before another person would get their sushi, then three minutes later another person would get their sushi and so on.   I ordered two rolls and as said before, it was mediocre. The salmon and tuna tasted rubbery and just not as fresh as I've had before at Pisces or even other sushi establishments in Charlotte. If I wasn't getting fresh fish. I hoped to get some kind of flavor enhanced sushi but nope--the sushi I got was Harris Teeter sushi quality- if that. They offer reasonable prices for their sushi but I was expecting more bang for my buck. After they cleared all the plates, we were still there waiting with empty drinks and looks of impatience with our servers really not acknowledging us or asking us if we need anything else.   I thought I was going to dig Pisces after my first time there but sadly, this past experience was a let down.

photos.caption: Photo of Pisces Sushi Bar & Lounge - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Pisces Sushi Bar & Lounge - Charlotte, NC, United States

ttbwgJXVh5X4aoblOxiIHg.text: I come here from time to time and I always have an outstanding experience. Christine took care of me tonight and recommended this amazing cider beer that is a must try the next time you eat here. The sushi is phenomenal and so is the service! The managers are also extremely friendly. Love this place!!

w224pr5E8yKvANcClis9Dw.text: Definitely a fan of this place and I am mad at myself for not trying it out sooner!  Met a friend for dinner here last night and I tried not to hype myself up too much about it, but I was pleasantly surprised at a nice sushi/bar place in Midtown.  I got there early so it wasn't too busy, grabbed a table and was super surprised at how comfortable the chairs were.  Usually at 'super modern' places the comfort of the furniture is compromised for clean lines, but here my behind was treated to a nice seat and it is catered to make you want to stay longer and order rolls and rolls of sushi ;).  I ordered the house sake which was surprisingly good, and the other sake options on the menu definitely were enticing.  Our server was super nice and we had mentioned that we were both new to Pisces.... he immediately rattled off some recommendations from the menu.  Even had an "off the menu" item (a roll they are thinking about adding to the menu in the near future) called a "Stop, Drop, and Roll"  My friend ended up ordering that and I had a piece, definitely a nice roll and would stand on it's own if added to the menu.  The Kissy Roll (crab, mango, cream cheese in soy paper wrap) was refreshing... I also ordered the Screaming "O" at the recommendation of our server and it did not disappoint (shrimp tempura, cucumbers, aioli sauce, and a nice slice of jalapeno on top of each roll piece).  Overall I had a great sushi impression of this place....  they had a nice sushi bar and regular bar as well with a couple of flat screens.  Good place to wind down after work or catch a game on the tv... while having great sushi.

zZ5KdKEQr7eqgXVdUSof5A.text: There are some good sushi places scattered here and there around Charlotte, and this one holds its own.  That said, it's a bit pricey compared to other local sushi spots.  This is understandable given its location in the city.    It's located in the Met so be prepared to deal with parking in the big deck.  If you're unfamiliar with the Met, it's basically an urban strip mall and since it's packed into a relatively small area there are multiple levels and a parking deck rather than big sprawling parking lots.  Ok, so back to Pisces...  We've been here a few times now and have always been happy with the service and the selections.  They have a pretty good variety of rolls to suit different tastes.  My favorites are the Screaming O and the Big Salmon.  They also have a pretty good beer and cocktail list that helps it stand out among some of the other sushi places in town.  The atmosphere is very cool and modern and fits the location well.  There is a dining room side and a bar side that feels more like a club atmosphere.  We were seated at love seats in the bar side one time and it was kind of a weird vibe at first but it ended up being really comfortable once we settled in.  Good sushi, cool atmosphere, definitely worth checking out!

QLyn0jSFh8zxgfKhQWhDhw.text: Drops head and shakes it from side to side slowly and for a full minute. That is all I could do after leaving a restaurant rated so highly by so many people and feeling sick from what I experienced. The service was great, but the greatness ended right there. My date and I both chose drinks from the cocktail menu, you know the drinks the bartender should know how to make, and both were equally disgusting. The fish used in the sushi was chewy and not fresh...yuck yuck yuck yuck!!! Oh yeah I almost forgot, the garlic noodles were so dry...I'll have to stop now I'm having flashbacks.

LOXpH84z52RNfHa8Ci6vNA.text: this place was pretty good! located in a downtown area.  Parking was in the garage across the street.  the atmosphere of the restaurant was ok, food took awhile to come out.

rucz_BwwcHNigxBvrfLv8g.text: First, I have to let you know that apparently I don't really like Sushi. I like California Rolls, and that's "not sushi." Haha! I always get the Crispy Cali Roll, it is my absolute favorite and hard to find flash fried! The pork dumplings are delicious and the chicken hibachi is pretty good! They have a huge list of sushi rolls and they are generous portions. The service is spotty, sometimes good, sometimes bad. And the atmosphere, although looks trendy, needs some refreshing. The chairs and tables are all torn up, and other small things could make it go from good to great. I do also wish they would serve brown rice, and be able to have your sushi made with it. Overall, we keep returning because the food is great!  Update, they revamped their chairs since the previous fabric was peeling off and sticking to clothes and looked horrible. With the reupholstered chairs, the restaurant looks a little better! The tv on the back wall is still ridiculously crooked though. We also met the manager since we're always in there and he is awesome. Very kind, and makes sure our order comes out correct and that the waitress isn't slacking. We still continue to eat here all the time!

RgKZ9tz5QUZBp9wrF6rJIA.text: Love the lunch.spe ial. I come here about once a week or every other week depending on my schedule. I love the staff.

WVXmThyJHvEOduyxA5FNbg.text: No impressed.  While the All You Can Eat Sushi lunch special sounds appealing, it is less than that.  I'd be willing to try this place out for dinner but I won't be back for lunch.

3ZMYL1Zsqxejcy2Iwg_xiA.text: Went for Restaurant Week and was under-impressed.  Service was good but food was disappointing compared to previous meals here.  Biggest complaint was the "bite" sized hibachi filet dinner contained pieces that were much more than bite size and even requesting a fork did not help the situation.  Filet Mignon should not be chewy and tough - ordered it med. rare and only a few pieces fit that order.  Garlic noodles which in the past were killer were only fair at best - no garlic flavor even after ordering the noodles with a request for extra garlic.  Dessert was 50/50 - lava cake was scrumptious - chocolate oozing out of center with vanilla ice cream, but the deep fried cheese cake was disappointing.  When you brought the cake up to your nose, the smell of old oil was very prominent - reminded me of "county fair" food.  Just could not get past the smell enough to sample more than a bite of the cheese cake.   Interior in need of some upfit - noticed several areas around booths that needed repair.  Wish Pisces had stepped it up for Restaurant Week instead of coasting - that is how it felt.

U3Y73DHKtuSQzZCTOxRLTQ.text: I love Pisces! The hibachi is amazing, the portions are much more than one person can eat. I always get a side of the delicious garlic noodles too. My boyfriend and I have eaten here quite often lately. They have some amazing wines as well. The service has always been great too! Sad to see any poor reviews because it has always been an amazing spot and time for me. Two thumbs up!!

LYo2hJdH1GoCvoYmqwtLvQ.text: Went there last weekend.  Food was good but there was a creepy guy there that bothered my friends and I all night.  Management had that "oh no, here we go again" expression on their faces.  At the end of the night the guy was handled poorly when he got out of line.  I can't believe they let him hang out in their restaurant.  Sure he spends dough there but I won't ever return simply because I know he frequents the place (he told us he's a fixture) and I don't ever want to run into him again.  Get rid of the eccentric weirdo and I'll come back.

bX4nesTqAvPB98Ap6CcMog.text: came here for the all you can eat sushi and i destroyed it. i had pretty much everything that was sushi and nigiri. service was great and the fish was good. i had a few chewy pieces of tuna but that happens and i did not get sick. i would come back for sure. the best part is your sushi/food is made to order by the chefs, instead of it being mass produced which is great

1zxL5Evvh45Hq9PzTcQQOQ.text: First of all, I love the concept - football on the TV's, a nice fully stocked bar, nice decor, and sushi!  5 of us showed up on a Sunday night for dinner, around 8 and it wasn't very busy at all, in fact we were one of the only people in the main dining area (they have a private booth area as well).  We ordered our miso soups, which took a fair bit of time to come out, and we honestly had to wait for about 45 minutes for our sushi to arrive.  We each only ordered 2 rolls and nothing overly complex.  I would really hate to see a sushi order during a peak busy time!  The sushi itself was decent, but for their 'specialty' rolls, I was really sad to see only 6 or 7 pieces, most of the time in a nice sushi bar, the most expensive rolls are around 8 or 9 pieces (for 9 or 10 dollars a roll I don't think that's unreasonable to ask for!)  Overall, not a great experience, but not a terrible one either - the company I was with made this a solid 3 star experience.

3Y0ITeJ6nlXaWktP4q_5nA.text: This is our new favorite Sushi spot when we can get into the private booth section. What is exceptional about this place is the bar, service, and foods presentation.  I have never been to the All You Can Eat Buffet, only dinner. I found the Sushi and Sashimi here to be very fresh and very attractively presented so I was shocked to hear other bad reviews. We ordered Sushi Deluxe and Sashimi Deluxe plates.  I also had Uni which was fresh here. Hibachi Chicken was very well flavored with tender pieces of chicken served with fried rice and saute' broccoli and mushroom; Filet Mignon Stacker was cooked perfectly and a tempura roll was also generous portion. For dessert, we had green tea ice cream and Mango mochi both very similar tasting to other Sushi restaurants. I agreed that this place is very pricey.  Dinner for the four of us including 2 drinks were $198.  Our Sushi dinner at Musashi, our other favorite Sushi restaurant, is usually half this price but Musashi does not have a full bar and service is more traditional Japanese and so can be less attentive.

T5y53dLBehsA3frapvS1Pg.text: My husband and I visited Pisces last night with a Groupon we recently purchased.  I'd already heard rave reviews from friends about the place so we decided to try it out.  There are several ways I'd like to describe our experience...  First of all, my husband spent a month in Japan a couple of years ago so he knows authenticity when he sees it.  We were sitting at the bar and he was telling me about one of his favorite dishes from Japan called Okonomiyaki.  As soon as he said "If I ever find a place that makes it here I'm going to..." and there it was on the menu!  They have authentic Japanese beers and the House Sake is amazing.  Now let's get to the Sushi...  FRESH, perfectly prepared, so full of flavor, and just plain delicious.  And above all this, every single staff member was superb.  It was my first time in the restaurant and every one I had contact with made me feel like I'd been a regular for years...  The atmosphere is classy and if you get a booth in the back it's even romantic and somewhat secluded which I loved...  Needless to say, I'm now a HUGE FAN of Pisces and will continue to visit as often as possible.

C4I7BfNh6jrYxRSxmZ4u-Q.text: Love this place!! My favorite sushi restaurant! The same great waiters are always there, and the food is great. Yes, a little pricey, but good for a date or nice night out.

cs9sa2ToDQ-T6Zyd-JfIUg.text: i love to try different sushi spots....but hands downs this place  is fab!!! love the vibe ...and  the sushi melts in your mouth.

A4oCdY5GXX8q_giZkvAatg.text: Fast service, ordered the desperado roll with a miso soup, sushi tasted good, and waitress was really nice. I would recommend trying it if you're looking for a sushi place in Charlotte.

qOI_m_HqzSGF361O5m-Cfw.text: The yelp reviews were correct.  This is a very nice sushi restaurant with a nice vibe.  The wait staff is great.  Our waitress Melissa was very helpful and pleasant.  We enjoyed the saute edamame and garlic.  The sashimi tuna was fresh and melted  in my mouth. Also very tasty was the tuna,cucumber and avocado salad. They have a lunch special that I am eager to try next.   I will definitely return to try more items on the menu.

s5Z1g21FqnyyOc8tY7gEOw.text: Pricey. Sushi rolls weren't all that. Had a couple of different rolls from this place multiple times and nothing stood out. However garlic noodles were awesome. They have all you can eat buffet for lunch but the ordering style was annoying, since the server had to come check on you to place your order ...then you have to wait for it to be made and sometime you sit there waiting forever and the server is no where to be found.  Hello? It's lunch time. Don't you know some people have a time limit on their lunch break? Nothing spectacular about this place other than it's in a hip location and good for younger crowds on weekends. Decors are nice but I wouldn't wow my friends and families from out of town with their sushi. Go to Rusans, decent priced and way better flavor in their foods.    Last time I was there at Pisces for a friends bday, two of my friends made a mistake and ordered the crab salad thinking it would be something awesome considering the price! When it came out, it was nothing but shredded imitating crab meats (wtf?) mixed with tons and tons of cucumber, so flavorless! Anddddd it tasted like something a kid could make.  They both didn't even want to finish it. Seriously not impressed.

sfiQcbVwTwy0oKS9K6cD-Q.text: Pisces has a very lounge-y vibe & accompany that with the yummy food & drinks & you've got a winner!  I went here on a recent Saturday night with fellow yelpers Dion L. & Simone M. We arrived around 7 PM & due to the first night of college football, the restaurant wasn't too busy. We were seated in the lounge area. Our waiter (wish I could remember his name) was absolutely fantastic. So friendly, knowledgeable, funny, & witty.   We started out with the tuna mango bruschetta, which was AMAZING. I really think I could have had two of these & been happy. It had just the right amount of "kick" to it & the tuna was perfect. It all tasted very fresh.  I ended up getting the crazy roll & shrimp tempura roll. Delicious! The crazy roll was my favorite.  You'll probably recognize one of the bartenders, Bob...he recently left Soul Gastrolounge.  Drinks are exotic & they'll even craft you up one if you tell them what all you like.  Service is top-notch, friendly & the place is clean. Prices are what you would expect.  I'll definitely be back!

QgD3V1J6g0nwQsznLquQ0g.text: The food is always amazing and the staff are very friendly.  You have a wide variety of seating options from traditional tables to booths that are extremely private in the back of the room.  Sushi is always prepared fresh and quick to suit your busy schedule.  There are nights every week where they have half off bottles of wine, call ahead to verify the correct date. This is somewhat new to the business.  The dining area is clean and so are the restrooms.  Great for parties and large groups.

Q25eounERkrfnYKF_jHG4w.text: I came in last night, for dinner and I was really impressed on how fresh the fish were on the menu. I order a few sashimi pieces and some rolls. Ora king salmon, is a must have sashimi !!!! It had this buttery texture and it just completely melted in my mouth. The Bluefin toro tartar was , just amazing nothing can describe how tasty it tasted!!!?I order couple of rolls after, I think one of them was call rub my belly, and selfish bastard, really unique names. And the sushi chef did some art on my plates too!!! Definitely coming back!!! For sure!!!! Thank you Pisces for bringing me such a wonderful experience!!!

Fsf9EyNoEP3lbJwKHpqPvg.text: Thank you so much Pisces for making my boyfriends birthday special!!! They accommodated our table of 11 very well and everyone had a great time. I don't normally like sushi, but this place has changed my mind! With vegan and vegetarian and gluten free options, this is the place for everyone! I am so thankful for their wonderful service and food and absolutely will be back. They catered to everyone's dietary needs and answered our questions professionally and enthusiastically. I'm not really into seaweed and they have options for that too ;). Overall a great experience. The parking was also very easy as there's a deck right across the street! Thank you to the wonderful staff and chefs.

iTllFrN6i8uFMI9Aj3O3Og.text: By far my favorite place to get sushi. I'm there at least once a week for the lunch all you can eat sushi and kitchen items. They make the sushi fresh so you know it's not been sitting out. The fried rice and spring rolls are phenomenal, and all the sushi is well-made. The restaurant is contemporary and good looking, and the staff friendly.

AbJXM94Nr23Mq-8K1Aq-FA.text: I finally made it for dinner and I love this place.    Our "table" were 2 comfy couches with a small table in between.  It was so perfect.  Live music quietly played so we could still maintain a normal conversation.  I love the low-key atmosphere and little quirks this place has.  It definitely makes a perfect date night.  ;)  For the sushi we ordered First Love Roll, Bobcats Roll, and a Screaming "O" Roll.  First Love was a more basic roll with mango that did not overpower the roll.  Had a big of a wasabi kick to it.  My favorite was the Bobcats Roll.  It was a more complex roll with a lot of elements to it.  The crab salad topping made this roll.    I only had one piece of the Screaming "O" roll and, although it was not as spicy as I expected it to be, it was still a yummy roll.    I will definitely be back here since I loved every second of it.

otJgparLagETn-yuMbIWNw.text: I was on vacation from Fort Lauderdale and caught a craving for sushi and this place showed up in my recommendations. The sushi was spectacular, I usually order 3 or more rolls which always costs me $40 so I thought it was awesome that I had the option to get all you can eat sushi for $10. Everything I ate tasted so fresh, my servers name was Andrea and she made my experience so awesome. She knew everything on the menu, any question I asked her she answered without any hesitation. The service was so warm and hospitable. If I ever come back to Charlotte I will be sure to come back and ask for Andrea!

PR7uiD2rsYAqvoA3VrjIYw.text: Love this place! Amazing toro selection and fresh fish selection. Huge fan of the brussel sprouts, must order. I enjoy the spicy garlic edamame. Servers are always great and knowledgeable about the selections (very important!)  Chef tasting menu is usually my 'go to'.

Qrg9LcSDHyNkRqDQ_BwnHQ.text: This place was not at all what the reviews say. First of all the sushi was not good. I got the octopus sashimi and it tasted really funky I almost puked. The salmon sashimi was not cut properly and the spicy tuna roll wasn't even spicy. Also my server brought out the check and I wasn't even finished. Maybe my expectations were high because of the reviews but I wouldn't recommend anyone eating there.

cgPZwD7S-WOKvpmDegoQ6Q.text: Bad sushi to go. Less than 10 miles from the restaurant and attempted consuming immediately.  Did not stay down long. It smelled fishy when I took the lid off, I should have stopped then.

nzEtP8LcYG8nkXpYjl6BOQ.text: I am not a fish/sushi eater, but the Karyu roll at Pisces is the only roll I will eat. If you like spicy foods, but are like me and don't eat a lot of fish, this is a great roll to start with! Pisces also has a great drink list/specials and awesome lunch specials. The only reason I am giving it 4 stars is because I think the dinner menu is a little overpriced.

wr865pXdUeOI5t431rCalQ.text: Fantastic place for lunch. $10 gets you all you can eat sushi, made to order. This is not a buffet with a lot of hands reaching into a large tray. There are about 12 or so rolls to choose from, and they come in small 4 piece rolls so you can order a bunch of different things. Also available are three kitchen items: fried rice, garlic noodles and egg rolls. And for an additional $5, you get some all you can eat nigiri options.  Don't be a jerk and order a bunch of sushi and just eat the fish out of it. They are more than happy to charge you full price if you waste the food they prepare for you.  Highly recommended, especially for lunch!

TbGDHCd37Z5_bJwsB3WLTg.text: The main reason I'm giving it 5 stars is because they do half price sushi during the week- and their sushi is actually reallyyyy good. I expected it to be sub-par because the discount, but it tasted so fresh I couldn't believe it. The sushi menu is also unique which I appreciated. Next time I will have to try out something besides sushi.

photos.caption: Photo of Pisces Sushi Bar & Lounge - Charlotte, NC, United States. Sushi is awesome! They also have some really good fish and daily specials that I&#39;ve seen on the menu.

m7sXbl_-JXiv3NxjMNNgUA.text: Not overly impressed.  Just overpriced sushi.  I wish it wasn't as expensive so I could try different things and come more often. Service was decent, nothing wonderful.

77VLPgkn4_-Bp0Ih6WvZJA.text: I was only in town for the night and I'm really glad I ended up here (thanks to the desk clear at the Westin).  The food was great, the service stunning and knowledgeable and the atmosphere chill and laid back.  If I find myself back in  Charlotte again I hope I get to go back.

qmfxaitVyxEQeeVXYXNN7w.text: All the rolls were cold and kinda disappointing. Also my cat died. Charlotte is ok. Why do all my friends hate me? The sushi was okay though.

photos.caption: Photo of Pisces Sushi Bar & Lounge - Charlotte, NC, United States. this is me after eating the sushi and crying.

4pLqCHEaTiys54-YOdjBFA.text: Great place! This is the first time I've been here-and I'm happy I tried it. It happened to be restaurant week, which was great. Our server was fabulous and helpful, she had great suggestions and was genuinely happy to be there (which isn't often in restaurants)! She was wonderful. We had the garlic spicy edamame and chicken sesame appetizers; hibachi and screaming O for our entrees- so delicious.  The fresh fish was so fresh and high quality. We will come back again soon!

8Q94GVObi1BN1e6UG1LzzQ.text: My sister and I dined here last night. Though this was her first time at Pisces, I've been several times. I'm a huge fan of the "Ninety Five" specialty sushi roll. Last night, we ordered that and a Wagyu burger, which was very tasty! The sweet potatoe fries that came with the burger were mediocre, however. I would highly recommend Pisces during lunch because they have an all-you-can-eat special for 11 dollars or so, including your choice of various rolls, rice, spring rolls, noodles, etc. The service is just ok here from what I've experienced as this is a busy place. Stop in if you're in the Metropolitan area!

7kt6jE43ZLANTxRkrgYYvg.text: Highlights - Upscale sushi bar - Sushi selection and quality is a 5 star - Hibachi filet mignon is a 3 star. Meat was good but missing on overall flavor. - Great cocktails - Decent wine list - It is expensive, unless you go during happy hour - Parking is street or the deck  I enjoyed the sushi.  Place is a solid 4 star overall.  I would recommend going during happy hour (Mon - Fri 4-6). Sushi is 1/2 price then.

photos.caption: Photo of Pisces Sushi Bar & Lounge - Charlotte, NC, United States. Hibachi Filet Mignon no Rice

Photo of Pisces Sushi Bar & Lounge - Charlotte, NC, United States. Rosemary&#39;s Baby Cocktail

BLIDGZohpdtVN9mqoG82xg.text: This little gem is tucked away in a business district of Uptown Charlotte. Unassuming from the front, we passed it by for 2 days before going in - after the visit I kicked myself for  not trying sooner.  ATMOSPHERE - Meh...Quiet, subdued even, with black tables and minimal artwork. The tables are close together, so if you're looking for romantic this probably isn't it.  SERVICE - Efficient... we went during lunch time, our server understood we needed to get back to work and served is as quickly as we needed her to. Unlike other "all you can eat" places that slow their roll as soon as you have your first helping, this place was literally willing to give us as much as we could bear.  FOOD - Not perhaps the most inventive sushi I've ever had, but fresh, tasty, and plentiful. I did not expect to find enjoyable sushi in Charlotte, let alone in this section of the city, but was pleasantly surprised.  VALUE - ALL YOU CAN EAT SUSHI for $12 for lunch... you're kidding, right??? Do you KNOW me??  :) - For real, there were two of us, we had probably 50 pieces of sushi all in (more him than me!!), and the total bill with sodas was $34 before tip. Absolutely can't be beat.  If you have a sushi hankering, and have worn your elastic waistband pants, DEFINITELY stop in here.

cGTIngZn5y4UJzm9Nv0Xfw.text: I've been here twice and received very different service both times. First time was great, our server was extremely attentive and made sure we always had food coming for the AYCE deal. Second time around our server was all over and seemed to always miss our table. I'm unsure which is the norm.  For a faster and more casual sit down sushi restaurant, the quality and quantity is great. AYCE is a good deal and it's available every day of the week. I think some of the more negative reviews about the quality are unfair and I believe they may be comparing at an unfair advantage/ level.   Only negative comment that isn't really even that negative.. weird chopsticks. I like to have my own wooden chopsticks and this place has plastic reusable ones. I like to think I'm pretty good with chopsticks but these things make me feel like a noob! Ha! The waitress kindly brought me a to-go wooden pair.

photos.caption: Photo of Pisces Sushi Bar & Lounge - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Pisces Sushi Bar & Lounge - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Pisces Sushi Bar & Lounge - Charlotte, NC, United States

S7PtJavDLk4Ry68IvPa5HQ.text: My favorite sushi place in Charlotte. I order takeout from here for my family about once every week or two. The bartenders welcome me by name as soon as I open the door to the restaurant every time. They always have my order correct and well organized. GREAT service!

Ylvfmv3ZAb4Q4rhoG-pbhw.text: Yeah, so this place really is as great as everyone else here says.  I came with a big group (12) today for the lunch special. We had to wait almost an hour for a table, but that's what we get for showing up at noon for the lunch special with an entire office worth of people. It was fine.  Once seated, the service continued to be on the slow side, but the food more than makes up for the lackluster wait staff. They have an expansive sushi menu of classic rolls, but I love the fact that you can also choose from a bunch of delicious, unlimited sides! Especially worth noting are the veggie spring rolls, which are the FIRST I've ever seen that are wrapped in rice paper, making them essentially gluten-free. It's a big deal to people like me who don't want to eat gluten but do NOT want to give up the pleasure of a hot, crispy spring roll every once in a while.  The sushi tastes fresh and is flavorful, the rolls are tiny (4 pieces) but it's unlimited, so order a whole bunch to start with and you'll be good. I always feel a little bit like I'm stealing when I'm so stuffed I can hardly walk and open the bill to see an $11 charge. AMAZING.

Rrd1AvIuEMxVDBBhfXG1vg.text: Eh. That's really all I can say about this place. The atmosphere is a little fancier than the quality of food that they serve. My gyoza was served cold. And the sushi is honestly just glorified Harris Teeter sushi with a higher price tag. The wait staff was accommodating, but nothing to write home about. The price for the all you can eat is a lot better than other All you can eat sushi places around town. That's really the only reason I would come back... other than that I was not impressed.

YZiLHKSwex8WV3amHAUbwQ.text: So good! We eat the sandwiche roll and it was so tasty! We are coming back for it!  Service was awesome.  The booths were a hit for my kids.  Kid friendly. Awesome food. Awesome service.

_3sCUeb4OnaPUo3I0OJsYw.text: My girlfriend and I have been meaning to check this spot out a few times on our trips to Charlotte. Glad we finally came in.  We had a wonderful time there that evening.  Great parking near by, easy in and out.  The food was great and lady  at the bar was really cool.  Next time we are in Myers Park we'll be back.

T7NrhvoTQRaIQkVdPHDvqQ.text: All I can say is.... AMAZING! I really enjoyed this place. My server, Lin, was so friendly and attentive. I really like the atmosphere also. My friend and I wanted to try a few things so we ordered the miso soup, crab dumplings, calamari, and spring rolls as starters. For our entrees we both had sushi rolls. I had the little bastard roll and my friend had the aries roll. All of the food was amazing.   We also ordered the little mini crabs that they sell. They're flash fried and you pop them like potato chips. You eat them whole, shell and all. It was an experience lol. If you're into trying different things you may like them.   This place also offers unlimited sushi lunch specials during the week so I know I'll be back for that. I definitely recommend this place if you're in the area.

gvXr0Eqgq4zWVzBl3Ck4Hg.text: The food was Absolutely delicious and the service was great!! I enjoyed the ambiance on date night with bae. We sat in the lounge and the booths were cute and comfortable! The soft music was an extra added touch bc it wasn't too loud that you couldn't enjoy conversation but it was also very relaxing. They also have a TV in the lounge that they were more than happy to change to the basketball game.  Drinks: Bae had a Tito's and Tonic and I had a mimosa. Definitely no complaints. They do have a few drink specials throughout the week. (FYI - They have a drink on the menu called Cardi B which I think is super cute). Food: Appetizer - Sesame Chicken - it was absolutely delicious. It also comes with honey mustard which was a great added touch. We both enjoyed them.  I had two sushi rolls, with cream cheese, cucumbers, tempura shrimp and crab salad. Bae had chicken and boiled rice. He didn't have any complaints he too enjoyed his meal. Will definitely come back to visit as a go to sushi place this summer!

photos.caption: Photo of Pisces Sushi Bar & Lounge - Charlotte, NC, United States. Tv in the lounge

OqoYG0oK56PktvDe5p2_qA.text: Pisces is my go to spot. They have never let me down....ever!!!! The crab dumplings are insane....the soft shell crab appetizer is amazing. The service is great and I highly recommend!!

jsS_KCTWZDDUJhCSEOYUmQ.text: It was just ok.   My boyfriend and I had been planning a trip to Charlotte for an upcoming concert and I immediately wanted to try this restaurant while in town! I ordered the Hurricane roll and the crunchy spicy tuna roll. My boyfriend ordered the oceans 7 roll and the screaming o roll. It's nothing I would come back for. The service was ok she seemed rushed the whole time even though there was hardly anyone in the restaurant.   We did have to wait for a table even though we called in and asked to make a reservation and were told they were not busy to come in. We got there and while they weren't busy we still had to stand up front while there was plenty of open tables.   We ordered 2 different appetizers, my boyfriend ordered bacon wrapped scallops & they were bland. I ordered the steamed edamame & it looked like the person who prepared the dish dump salt on one piece of edamame and spared the rest. This isn't a bad establishment just not one I would return to if back in Charlotte!

Photo of Pisces Sushi Bar & Lounge - Charlotte, NC, United States. Crunchy Spicy Tuna Roll &amp; Hurricane Roll

Uq7p3WoIqx4yLqliBFvFOg.text: Long time, no see to one of my favorites in CLT. Stopped in on a Thursday to catch up with a friend. Pisces is still awesome. I ordered my usual, The Bobcat aka the Knight. Despite no longer being on the menu, they were able to whip it up with no problem. My friend wanted Poke, which isn't on the menu, nor has it ever been. However, raw fish is raw fish and they made it happen. It was fresh, tasty, and I was extremely appreciative that this was done without any hassle. Precisely why Pisces remains one of my favorites in Charlotte. They could do with less ice in their cocktails. I understand less ice does not mean more alcohol, but after I take out all of the ice, the glass shouldn't be 1/3 full. Geez. Just make it a shot if that's what we're doing.

MFPQA9oZoShOiYux0ZD9_g.text: atmosphere 3 price 2 food 2/3 service 1 overall for the money and experience probably 1.5/5  Went with a group of people for lunch only a few days after another AYCE sushi place.   This place was worse.   Service  Not the typical AYCE sushi place where you write down a number in front of the item on a piece of paper. Nor the more advanced ones where they just put the order directly into a PDA or tablet on the table.  You're also limited to order 10 items per person which confused the entire group for a bit and had to figure out how many each of us can order. Example, if you order 10 nigiri sushi, that's your order and not like 10 different kinds of dishes.   Waitress is either new or stressed. It was relatively busy around 1330 on a week day. ---   Food for pricing. Typical quality for $-$$ price range.  Not suprisingly, no sashimi on the menu for AYCE, even with additional price. BUT, it costs extra to order nigiri sushi! What?!  The AYCE menu have tiers, basic tier is just rolls and appetizers. Have to pay extra for nigiri sushi (and you can't just get nigiri, have to pay the basic tier first)  Ohh, miso soup is extra and on it's own add-on tier! What?! Never have I ever seen this at an AYCE sushi place in multiple states and countries.   So yea, I don't recommend this place at all and never going back again.  ---  Something positive about the food... a few of their maki rolls were pretty tasty but doesn't stand out from other sushi places at all.

bZCpYtxAhW-Kew9I4_C8Sg.text: We really enjoy this place! We live so far away yet we are willing to make the trip for the sushi!

o99Kylcf8df3_QmIInRSRA.text: This place is ok. Nothing special. Came here for a very late lunch with a friend (3pm). We got sat at the worst table possible. Up against a wall and it was super small. They weren't busy at all. Maybe 2 tables including us. We waited a while to be greeted. When we were finally greeted and we told her our drink order and that took a very long time to get our drinks.   We ordered the calamari and each a sushi roll. The calamari was good but very salty. I got the bastard roll and it was good but you can tell the avocado was not fresh. It was super mushy and slightly slimey. My friend liked her roll.   Overall, this place is just ok. Nothing super impressive about it and a little overrated. Service could have definitely improved especially with hardly anyone in there.

7t1vWJNJBxLbElyyZHx7pQ.text: Absolutely disgusting. Service was trash. They kept forgetting parts of our order. They have roaches all over the restaurant . We were eating next to a dead roach and when we asked to have it removed they declined and proceeded to tell us that things tend to get in the restaurant and swore they sprayed the restaurant but there is absolutely no way because the roaches are in the back near the kitchen. I'm so disgusted I'm never coming back.

Wuv462sHOoYpbIyvAWb6Ow.text: This is probably my number go to spot for sushi in Charlotte. They have the best lunch special for sushi! For $11 you can get all you can eat sushi plus fried rice, spring rolls, garlic noodles and other appetizers. The face a good selection of specialty rolls on the all you can eat lunch special my favorite is the spicy crab salad or the bagel roll which is salmon and cream cheese.  Today we also had a tuna roll that tasted as if it was caught this morning. There sushi always taste very fresh and the spring rolls are fried to perfection and are always nice and crispy!  That atmosphere is very nice  make sure you check out the jelly fish tank! The drinks have great names also we had the Cardi B wich was their take on a Moscow mule. If as pretty good and went great with good music playing In the background. I also recommend this as a date spot.

Fcm1qm2EbL-dBx6kz03j8Q.text: Service started out good till we told the server that our child really wasn't hungry so he was going to just share with us. Her response was an annoyed face & "we dont allow sharing but I guess you can." I'm a server myself & while i dont like sharing I'd NEVER respond that way. After we ordered service was just terrible. Our cups were almost always empty. We talked to the hostess about a surprise dessert & after 15 mins the server comes over and asks about it in front of the bday person but by that time we just wanted to leave. Waited another 15 mins for our check to be picked up. We won't go back.

lspzGLAWn97FuZUUAJrjHw.text: My boyfriend and I come here regularly for their happy hour.  Half price all sushi rolls Monday - Friday 4-6pm!! Plus they have all-night drink specials that you can combine with the half price rolls!    Monday: half price glass of wine  Tuesday: $15 wine special  Wednesday: half price bottle of wine Thursday: half price cocktails  Fri/Sat: $3 all draft beers  It's a great deal, but I knocked a star off because the bartenders need help on how to make a good cocktail.  As for food, definitely get the spicy garlic edamame.  And for vegetarians, the tree hugger roll is a must.

MuhjqMhnwdG91rBH1E6OFw.text: This is definitely a house favorite for my household. The sushi is always fresh and delicious. We always get the hornets roll! Half price bottle of wine on Wednesdays are great. All you can eat sushi during lunch. Hands down the best sushi spot in charlotte! The crab dumpling appetizer is to die for! Prices are good for the quality of food and the atmosphere is super chic.

ODowk7iMPrOFOEkM-GJd1A.text: A very cozy and warm atmosphere with private booths. I would give the food three stars but overall 4 stars considering the $11 AYCE lunch - which includes sushi rolls and a few appetizer to choose from. The speed at which the food came out compensates for its presentation.

x6Y5gvaJrCn6-NcxlDgKwg.text: Where to start...first off a lot of people were telling us to try Ru Sans. But I trusted my Yelp friends and our sons nurse and went here. We were visiting the Levine's hospital and our nurse said this was the spit. It was great. We went on a Wednesday and got there at 530. We got a bottle of wine 1/2 off and it was 1/2 off sushi rills until 6 which is why we went. Every roll we had was fantastic. Our waitress, Kaitlin, was awesome very friendly. She actually helped us order and sat and  talked. Somehow, we got on the subject of our son, and the next thing you know she brought out a fried Oreo and vanilla ice cream desert that was..hmmm good. We had 5 sushi rolls and a bottle of wine for $55. We obviously gave her a bigger tip than normal but was still a great price for awesome food.

x0q2HyE7PVrBathf8GIOWA.text: I've never been to picses and not been impressed. Their staff is friendly, the location is clean, the food is good and the ambiance is great. I've even had a working dinner there and their staff was super accomodating with my request to be near an outlet, and left me alone but checked in to ensure I had everything I needed. They also have great drink specials.  This is a good venue for a group gathering, too.

NdZtFcOtK0vb3NkRmO31nA.text: I haven't come across a better sushi place in the Queen City in the 15 months that I've lived here. First, the atmosphere. It's an elegant party. Not a forced party, but you feel like having a good time when you walk in. The high, vaulted ceilings matched with the music and elegant decor make it a great place to hang and eat with friends. The food is seriously delicious. I haven't tried the hibachi food, but the sushi is nice and fresh. There are unique flavor combinations and cooked and uncooked options.

3kCIjilrS3zIrREGRShe5w.text: Service was great and the lunch special was incredible for what you get. We left stuffed and super happy. I'm glad we stopped in for lunch!

HJP3XpzVz9NgoumYHYgu-A.text: Love the $10 lunch special! They serve only simple rolls but I like them. Along with the garlic noodles and yum yum sauce: perfect lunch!

2P1-hXAhGgS7jtHsOQx9gA.text: I was been here many time with my friend.The food taste good.Great service.The host and waitress are very nice and friendly.I love the sushi here.

pk36R8BeLt5GHCGKWOpJuA.text: Sushi restaurant found in midtown near target city. Sushi did not exceed my expectations. Overpriced since your paying for location and "fancy" looking environment. Did was just decent. You could go anywhere else in the Charlotte area for better price and quality. Service was good but the reason I rate 3 is beside pricing and food quality.

YzJYi6Plc9zpagkFRxUsrA.text: This place was great! We went on a Monday night, so it was pretty slow. That being said, our service was great. So I can't really comment on the service when the place is busy. The food was great, we all got sushi and it was all amazing. We also got hibachi chicken, there was a lot of chicken which was surprising; but it was good! And another member of the group also got the duck, and he absolutely loved it. We also had crab dumplings and those were great, the sauce that comes with those was unlike any I'd had with crab dumplings/Rangoon before! For me and my boyfriend our total before tip was about 65. We got two sushi rolls, hibachi chicken, crab dumplings, and two beers (maybe three?). The other two that were with us got two sushi rolls each, split a bottle of saki, one got the duck, and one got a handful of sashimi, their totals were about $50-55 each. I love this area and this restaurant is definitely on the list of places to go back to!

kNaiShTW9xqRSsSnDFJotg.text: CAUSED A TRIP TO THE ER!!!  Went for the first time for their AYCE lunch. On our way there I got on yelp and started reading the reviews. Saw one where someone said it gave them food poisoning. Like an idiot, we ignored this. BIGGEST MISTAKE! My husband got a bacterial infection from the sushi. 24 hours after eating here he started getting terrible stomach pains and diarrhea. Next day add on a fever and dehydration. The following day we're told we need to go to the ER. They put him on an IV drip to get his vitals back up because he was so dehydrated and had a 103 temp. A CT scan shows inflamed intestines. Between the ER trip and meds and everything, our sushi lunch cost us over $400! DO NOT GO HERE!!!!!

0afKh_N7JuWIW_Er26_7Uw.text: I went there to try the Sushi. For the price it definitely wasn't worth it. We had a few OK rolls but this wouldn't be my place of choice for Sushi. I've heard Pisces serves other dishes that are quite good but have yet to try them.   I'd be up for trying something else other than their Sushi to give the place a fair shot.

kDFHGH3aaDngk3WhSWtK-g.text: The $10 all you can eat sushi during lunch may seem enticing but don't be fooled... Absolutely horrible! If you want a rice roll for lunch, then come here! 2 servers for the whole restaurant during a busy lunch hour is also a mistake. When the server came back and saw me cutting some rice away so I could taste my fish, she informed me that there is a charge for not eating all of the rice!!! WHAT????? If you don't eat the whole piece or leave 4+ rolls behind, you are charged a fee. I've never heard of this- absolutely insane and just blows my mind. I will NEVER be back!

t-ZXh9cVTlakrzstZgrwww.text: I've been a long-standing fan of Pisces and can't believe that I haven't written a review until now. Easily one of the best places to eat at The Met and happy to say that they have some of the better sushi in town for the price. Also, with the $14 all-you-can-eat sushi during the week, it's a solid joint for lunch, too.   Recently came in for dinner with the Mrs and we enjoyed our time heartily.   Tempura Veg - Stellar Cali Roll - Textbook Spicy Tuna Roll - Perfect Screaming "O" Roll - Not my favorite, but I had heard quite a bit about it and had to try it. There happened to be a minute amount of wasabi lurking somewhere within, so I wasn't too keen on the flavor. Other than that, great stuff.  Cocktails - The Fresh Fruit Gin Fizz and Pocket Fours are both wonderful. Nothing fancy, just served in a pint glass with tons of freshness. Not too boozy either. I'd order both again in a heartbeat.   The service was great as well. Our server was nice and to the point. Not too much nonsense or over-communication, which I appreciate.   Pisces is a great choice for sushi and cocktails. Also, never had the chance to witness him in his element behind the bar, but I know Bob Peters slings a mighty fine beverage.

Photo of Pisces Sushi Bar & Lounge - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pocket Fours.

-oPKomqgBT9l9Xa5Bi1EzA.text: Over the years, I've really seen this place grow from a limited sushi menu to having specialty sushi rolls and high-quality dinners. (Wagyu beef, wut?) I was glad to have taken my friends from Atlanta here since everyone was extremely friendly and willing to go above and beyond to meet our needs. Our waitress Heather was extremely knowledgable about the menu and gave us great sushi recommendations, in addition to the pork belly buns that were delicious. The drinks were mixed well and the overall presentation of everything was beautiful.  Did I mention that the owner came to our table to talk us and get to know us personally? (you're cool in my book, Bryan!)

GQKiRx-vCkqw_0dZlC2kNw.text: Good food..relaxed atmosphere. Not too pricey but not too cheap. Relaxed atmosphere. Parking is tight on the weekends. Best to take a cab.

Z0usDcttVA_OaCnvoARulA.text: So I really enjoyed the food here, but goodness the service. First of all, miss Laura, our waitress couldn't give us a direct price on two sides that were not listed but was ordered many times. She kept leaning on our chairs and table... and she gave us a stank face when we asked her if she heard our order. She didn't seem to pay attention so we asked. Didn't check on us but once, we had to ask the hostess for a few things... but food is pretty good ! Love me some SUSHI

PP0UlmpxGcedh7XBBd-AJA.text: Good sushi but my fiance and I have had much better.  Maybe because we have been to the best of the best, but this was just ok and nothing spectacular.  It was fresh ingredients though and a nice cute date spot for maybe a first date.  Service was quick!

Photo of Pisces Sushi Bar & Lounge - Charlotte, NC, United States

TEhaxQosb1Irfl0xElCoVw.text: This is one of my favorite sushi spots  in the city . During the week they offer an all-you-can-eat lunch menu that includes some of their popular sushi rolls and other menu items for $14. (I enjoyed it even more when it was only $12).  The atmosphere is very quaint and charming. It's both trendy and welcoming. The staff is also very friendly.   Regarding the sushi, the rolls are quite good. It's not the best sushi in the area, but it's very enjoyable. It's hard to describe; the rolls are fresh, but they aren't very refined. With that said, I always enjoy my meal. I've even brought out-of-town guests here.   Regarding the appetizers, I love their edamame which is served hot (like I like it). I also really enjoy their vegetable spring rolls. The calamari, however, wasn't very good. It was a little chewy.  My favorite side is the garlic noodles. Delicious!!!   Overall, this is a solid spot. It should definitely be added to your sushi rotation.

Yfk93PGSQMdq3Og0T-PHiQ.text: $12 for a sushi roll all you can eat is quite a deal, given that the sashimi in the rolls are reasonably fresh despite having very limited options and the rolls themselves are pretty small.   The interior of the resturant meets expectation, the bar table fits in well and there's some privacy in the corner.  The service is reasonably attentive though there would be gaps here and there.  I probably would comeby here again for lunch if I actually lives in this area.   3.5 stars

LdyyUOPGjlAbRv8agvat_Q.text: A love poem A work trip isn't complete Without a bite to eat Of those succulent Brussel sprouts  Let me tell you there is no doubt These are the best I've had Why don't you serve them at Lake Norman? LB9tuDU3BXdJueepwiO_gA.text: Worst service / experience ever!!  Longest time ever in between getting food and ordering food. The order was not satisfied as requested. Left off items and was not up to the correct temperature. Seamed like they sent it back out cold after picking off unwanted item.  They tried to over charge our check by another entire meal.   Hibachi - came with a vegetable I specifically requested not to be on it due to allergy. Then, came back luke warm at best and messy plate. Didn't bring shrimp sauce until I was almost finished.   Water with lime - girl didn't bring lime.   Unlimited lunch special - requested items did not come in a timely manner.

kGCQp46bI1W9mg5cNeKK5Q.text: In Midtown and looking for quick sushi and hibachi? This could be your place! Every day they offer an all you can eat menu and a standard menu as well! I was intrigued because I really wanted sushi!   Friendly service, speedy food service and relaxed vibe.   As a note -- on the all you can eat side of the menu, take it slow and add on as needed. You will be charged for waste on those items (specifically the sushi)!   Drinks here are a bit pricey, but they offer a decent selection on sake if that's your thing! I'd come again it's a larger group for sure!

yIS4QRbip_hXphUb2TJ3lg.text: Pisces has been one of my fave Japanese restaurants for some time, but for some reason, I haven't been back there in quite a long time...'til today!  Went in the middle of rush hour, around 6:30 pm, and surprisingly, slid right in. There was a good amount of people, but not fully packed.  Noticed that the place seemed darker (darkly lit?), but everything seemed about the same as before. Casual, yet City Chic.  Tried 2 of their Sushi/Maki Rolls, "Crunchy Spicy Tuna" and "Spider"...and well, they were good, but not exceptional. Unlike on my previous occasions there, the presentation was weak. They used to really fancy up the rolls...but not sure what happened tonight? I also think they might have given me the "Jumangi" instead of the "Spider" Roll...but I could be wrong. In all, a bit of a let-down on my Rolls.  Still, I absolutely love their menu (though their drinks are way too expensive)...and never had bad service there. I also love their Happy Hour and lunch specials.  Am definitely coming back to try more items on the menu. Just hope they amp up the presentation a bit more next time.

photos.caption: Photo of Pisces Sushi Bar & Lounge - Charlotte, NC, United States. Top: &#34;Spicy Crunchy Tuna&#34; Bottom: &#34;Spider&#34; (??)

cgUhx6YqNYfvqDfholh5NQ.text: Came back to give this place another try. The staff has definitely improved and I didn't feel like they were rude or rushing us this time. I'm just still not a fan but this place is good. We went for all you can eat and it came out pretty fast this time. The sushi is just so plain to me and is rice and fish. If you order any with avocado it overpowers it. The nigiri also didn't taste very fresh. The Wagyu nigiri is actually from japan and it comes with a little fried quail egg on top.  Overall this place was okay it just was still not for me buffet wise.

photos.caption: Photo of Pisces Sushi Bar & Lounge - Charlotte, NC, United States. Wagyu

KwH_mMmVEvXYR1JNcS1EyQ.text: My husband and I have really enjoyed Pisces in the past, and I most likely would've left a four-star review. Now I don't know if we'll return. Today at lunch, the hostess completely ignored the pair of us after we'd been standing there for five minutes, only to immediately greet another couple as soon as they walked in. I understand that it's a popular, busy place and time, which is why we didn't mind standing there for five minutes. We had just moved to the front of the line. If the hostess had bothered to look up after sending the people in front of us off with their server, she would've been looking right at me. It's almost as though my husband and I were both invisible. We walked out. The sushi is good and it's a great lunch special, but the service has never been particularly friendly and this is just not worth it.

1TVK83FzjClIOYlsCA06qQ.text: Our first visit to Pisces was on Friday night for a birthday celebration.  Pisces happened to be participating in Restaurant Week, which was a nice surprise.  We had 7 pm reservations and were promptly seated when we arrived.    Parking is available in the parking deck, just be sure to go up a couple of floors in the parking deck.  If you happen to score a parking space on the first floor of the deck, be sure to buy yourself a lottery ticket too because it truly is your lucky day!   The restaurant itself is very modern, fun and upbeat!  We found all of the staff to be very welcoming.   On to the food! We decided to take advantage of their restaurant week menu.  For $30 you got a choice of a glass of wine, draft beer or a coke product, an appetizer, for the entree: either 2 sushi rolls or 1 hibachi option. I had the Crab Dumplings as my appetizer, and chose two rolls of sushi for my entree: Eel the Love and the Filet M Roll.    The Crab Dumplings were plentiful for an appetizer and very tasty.  Freshly made, you could actually taste the crab! The Sushi was not only beautiful, it was delicious!  An order of Brussel Sprouts was ordered for the table (I normally dislike BS) but these were absolutely amazing and addicting!  Do yourself a favor and be sure to order this when you come!  We also ordered 2 orders of Tempura Oreos as our dessert, one with green tea ice cream and a other one with vanilla ice cream.  I preferred the vanilla ice cream option.   Overall a great visit Pisces and I plan to come back and check more of their menu out!

Photo of Pisces Sushi Bar & Lounge - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Pisces Sushi Bar & Lounge - Charlotte, NC, United States. Crab Dumplings

HlTXH_d02Kwv2DcYQpF7DQ.text: We usually come for the lunch AYCE deal. At $11 and fresh made-to-order soosh, it's quite the deal. But tonight we came for some apps and the LOVE BOAT! SOOOOO WINNING!

PSuKit6J_9uKBN-fLamuww.text: They have the best all you can eat sushi uptown in my opinion. Everyone is always friendly, great atmosphere, and of course... great .

photos.caption: Photo of Pisces Sushi Bar & Lounge - Charlotte, NC, United States

mni3fJDYXGujU7uWZxSPuQ.text: We went to Pisces on a Friday evening as a family, didn't have to wait to be seated and had great service.  The restaurant has a welcoming vibe and can accommodate parties have all sizes. They have a broad menu making it easy for  everyone to find something they like however they have only one roll on the entire menu that is gluten free so that was disappointing for someone with a severe gluten allergy. Decent quality fish for the nigiri and sashimi and the brussel sprouts were a huge hit. Overall a good experience but would love some more gluten free options!

hB5_yHxHrTRnmvQzllGdJg.text: Well, Pisces has an amazing all you can eat lunch specials. They have a good size menu for this lunch special. The staff is nice and the decor is elegant and cool. So why a 3. Well, the sushi on the lunch special are just ok. Also, though the menu is nice size, it all taste similar. I have had great sushi, their sushi is just ok. So, it pains me to give such a cool place with a great value a 3 star rating, but like I said the similar taste of all the choices and the lack of wow factor in the food, warrants this score. Check it out if you want a cool place to go around lunch time, but you won't be wowed.
