Photo of Pisces Sushi Bar & Lounge - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Pisces Sushi Bar & Lounge - Charlotte, NC, United States

l_noFfj_LagID7dRf_axyw.text: All you can eat sushi for lunch  is what brought me both times! You can begin with starters-I have gone with the garlic noodles and have enjoyed them both times. The sushi is basic, but there are about 20 options to choose from. Be very careful though, if you don't finish what you order, you have to pay for it! Each sushi option comes with 4 pieces, so choose wisely.   Bathrooms are gender neutral/shared in the back room side, not sure about the main dining area.   Parking is easy in the Trader Joes/Best Buy garage. If you have to park up a couple of floors, there is a staircase that leads down to the street across from the entrance to Pieces.  Pro tip: ask for spicy mayo and add it to everything!

vZE6BMrF4ImW60zwjyjKPg.text: Everything we tried was amazing and would totally go back. From the appetizer to the main course. Loved the crab dumplings and Susihi Rolls. Would recommend to friends and family.

BiODXDWraMOwFJ_rrmd9HQ.text: Going into Pisces I was super excited to try their lunch all you can eat sushi! We arrived around 12:30 and were promptly seated even though they were super busy. The waitress was friendly and answered all of our questions and even made suggestions about fan favorites. We ordered several things and everything was fresh and delicious. Just make sure you can eat it all because they do charge for wasted Sushi! This little gem is tucked away in Midtown and is a definite must try!

photos.caption: Photo of Pisces Sushi Bar & Lounge - Charlotte, NC, United States. Sweet potato roll

o1zKlQRTr7E79zdNSLfzAQ.text: I really love the all-you-can eat sushi and apps for lunch time. You can't beat that for $12! Good rolls and great apps. The only downfall is that the appetizers aren't hot when they make it to the table.

aCv77TjOZOCGjQZ4B0hdRw.text: I love Pisces, especially for lunch but plan to arrive when they open or at end of the lunch rush because they are crowded everyday... why??...The sushi is fresh  and quick!!! The pork dumplings, Brussels sprouts and spring rolls are delish and consistent.  The decor and staff is great as well. My only complaint is the smell at front door but it's not throughout the restaurant or related to food so that's comforting and I've visited many times too many to even remember

-eO0ZOC8KQBAMzFW2SvwFQ.text: AYCE sushi for lunch? Sign me up! I do suggest ordering as soon as you're seated because the place can get pretty busy and you don't want to be waiting too long in between orders. Also, don't expect specialty rolls if you get AYCE. Great lunch spot if you're not restricted to 30 minute lunches.

arouEh1ow3OyqRsTCVgyCw.text: All you can eat lunch is the way to go.  The sushi comes in 4 pieces and they ask that you eat all the sushi  on the plate before ordering  more. You can others food items besides the sushi though that's the main reason for the lunch special; I ordered fried rice and spring rolls (4) .  My favorite roll to try was the mango roll-ups mango. It was yummy.  They will charge $2 for a to go box if you want to take food home.   You aren't able to use  the Yelp 10% off checkin promo  because it's a lunch special but you can use it on everything else ( except alcohol).  Definitely recommend

x1ZkqugwsKo91KscOm2i7g.text: I came in here with my boyfriend last night for his birthday, I have to say it's the way it used to be. The food is okay, but not as good as it was before. Not sure if they got a new menu it been changed. I remember a few year back it really good. They had great selection for sushi, when came last night it very limited it was pretty the same sushi over again expert the fish was different. There fish was really fresh, sushi was alright, not coming back for a awhile. It was really nice of them to give us a free dessert for my boyfriend birthday, but they got our sushi order wrong and had to be remade.

NWUIRUHR11wkYp1ND648wA.text: I don't usually submit reviews, but Pisces kicked serious butt today. Last time we went, the food was good, but the service left a lot to be desired.   Today was completely different. Lena, our server was on her game and extremely attentive, and we noticed the other waitresses hustling, too. Overall, exceptional food and service. Well done!

RDYPIuaWEfucJj4lEqI-0g.text: This is a nice little location. The atmosphere is great and very laid back. Only thing to worry about is the parking - always a pain with Metropolitan - but don't let that stop you! We had a lunch meeting and enjoyed their All You Can Eat Sushi. The place wasn't loud so there were no issues with having a serious work conversation.   I encourage everyone to come!

photos.caption: Photo of Pisces Sushi Bar & Lounge - Charlotte, NC, United States. All you can eat sushi!!

O0YvSM_RVyN_qORD4jXHww.text: Fantastic. If you wanted a one word review.  The atmosphere is cool. Not a lounge or club, but definitely cooler than your typical restaurant. A bit of a Blade Runner vibe for you fellow nerds out there.  But let's talk food and service, both of which absolutely kick ass.  Heather is a stellar bartender and sushi expert. Given my sparse descriptions, she was able to come up with recommendations that knocked it out of the park. Try the Silk In Rye cocktail, it's weirdly delicious.  I had the Hamachi Carpaccio and the Wagyu Nigiri. Both of which were absolutely top notch. Take note that the wagyu nigiri is a total foodie dish, and you get a tiny portion for the price. If you're like me though, money is no substitute for happy taste buds. And yours will be super happy.  Come for the sushi and great cocktails, be late to your next engagement because the service is stellar and they take wonderful care of you.  Added Bonus: was surprisingly not busy for a Friday night. It's not the norm I'm told, but if you're sick of waiting for RuSans, this is the perfect alternative!  The Manager Crystal runs a tight ship with no leaks, your money is well spent here. Show up hungry.

gqmTwAsGcXGDBhMmKYTAFA.text: The $10 all you can eat lunch special was on point. There are probably 20 or more rolls to pick from, including tempura rolls, a philly roll, and a couple vegetarian rolls. It great that you can also get small orders of noodles and alike. The service was quick, and we didn't do much waiting for food despite putting in 4 rounds of orders. I'd highly recommend the lunch special! The space was cool and interesting as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Pisces Sushi Bar & Lounge - Charlotte, NC, United States. All you can eat lunch special sushi

P0AKrMNm9gz2CACbWztKwQ.text: We had a great experience! The staff was so awesome. After having to wait a little longer for our table the staff had champagne  waiting for us on our table. We honestly didn't mind the wait but that was sweet of them. Our dinner was amazing and then they brought us dessert on the house as well. Great food, drinks, staff and atmosphere!

Kb1DmBuljOoL6x2yVzyE2w.text: Can't beat the all you can eat sushi during lunch for $10! The spring rolls, spicy crab, shrimp tempura, spicy tuna, spicy hamachi, and eel roll are some of the options included.

76g7xE-1c06_CPwePhsf7A.text: Went here for a lunch date with a friend. Atmosphere is cool, and we got to sit in one of the private booths. We both did the all you can eat option for lunch. We wished we had known the rolls were simply going to be fish seaweed and rice. The quality of the fish was not bad, but I'm not sure I would dine here again.

Y1B1ypc50r05h8P9XrSLjw.text: Was looking forward to my girls weekly happy hour and decided to try this location for the first time. Food and drinks were good nice music service was fine until the waiter returned with my card and advised me that she accidentally swiped my card for the wrong bill which was $25 more. welp I wanted to ask for my 40% tip back immediately... that has never happened to me! She then explained that she credited the additional amount and that my account would show pending for the wrong amount and would post for the correct amount. Well that did not happen. When I called back a week later I was told by a non manager that an employee should never advise anything about how transactions post as it's up to the bank and also advised that the person who told me that is a manager. Well the manager had the vendor who processes their transactions return my call instead of her...unbelieveable ! expected better customer service after you accidentally made a mistake ...

kil92rTGvG7qs7byr5BxHA.text: Food was delicious. Service was impeccable. Alex was awesome.  Will definitely visit again and recommend to my friends.

lG5S3jOkDDF2GM1h1Y-4uA.text: Went here for all you can eat sushi when Dressler's was closed. You're supposed to eat all your rolls, which I understand. Beware, don't order rice because they make you eat a big bowl of fried rice that has maybe one pea in it, with no eggs or pay full price. I have a few problems with this: 1. The fried rice was horrible. 2. I would never pay for a bowl of fried rice that bad! 3. I would rather get a 13 dollar roll of the regular menu and eat it all than eat any of their rolls on the all you can eat menu. Unless their regular menu is just as bad. 4. Their all you can eat rolls are sorry. Really pathetic for a sushi role. I've been to many all you can eat sushi places that were way way better. If you can't afford to make a decent all you can eat, then don't have an all you can eat!!!!! It was honestly an all you can eat crappy fried rice bowl rather than an all you can eat sushi. Cocktails were good, hence the one star.

t2lpJHlgarezFriniy6XxA.text: This was our second time visiting Pisces and I have to say it was so much better this time! I'm not sure if my last visit was just a bad night for them or if what I ordered this time around was just a better choice,but it was pretty awesome.  Our server Alex was knowledgable and very attentive. I will say that they move really fast (which can be great if you have to be in and out quickly)but for people who, like myself, prefer to wait between appetizer and entree and really have a chance to talk with my guest and mull over the menu, it's kind of rushed. The menu is very detailed, so extra time is needed to see it all.  What we chose- The lil bastard roll, a shrimp tempura and avocado roll topped with a crab salad and crunchy bits of onion. It's a very generously sized roll and had great flavor.   We also got the crispy spicy tuna which may be one of my new favorite sushi rolls. Spicy tuna flash fried in tempura batter- mine was perfect and not cooked all the way through, so the tuna had great flavor and texture.  Our very favorite was our appetizer- cucumber salad. It had raw tuna, avocado and of course cucumber in a light Asian dressing. Could have eaten it all night! Everything was very fresh and delicious! Overall we really enjoyed our quick trip to Pisces!

photos.caption: Photo of Pisces Sushi Bar & Lounge - Charlotte, NC, United States. There was more in the dish but it was so good that we almost forgot to snap a pic of it!
Photo of Pisces Sushi Bar & Lounge - Charlotte, NC, United States. Lil bastard roll and crispy spicy tuna on the right.

kMKEdCtTXtqNtkROmF1uEA.text: All you can eat lunch special for $11 is a deal. Most rolls are pretty good. Don't over order or you will be charged extra. Friendly, clean and a nice place.

PwhJTyyElL8nK5vBiRH4Qg.text: Dana made our first experience here amazing. We asked her to surprise us with an appetizer and she brought the brussel sprouts. DELICIOUS! Can't wait to come back.

KU5wuorpBkqVg-zWqO935w.text: This is one of my favorite sushi places in Charlotte. The atmosphere is intimate and cozy, especially if you get one of the hidden away booths.   The sushi list is extensive and full of creative rolls and creative cocktails.   The Rainbow Roll is one of the best ones I've ever had. The Jumanji Roll and Screaming O are wonderful as well.   The service has always been excellent as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Pisces Sushi Bar & Lounge - Charlotte, NC, United States. The Spicy Tuna Crunchy, the Aries, the Rainbow &amp; the Screaming O. All were fabulous.
Photo of Pisces Sushi Bar & Lounge - Charlotte, NC, United States. Kawaii rolls.
Photo of Pisces Sushi Bar & Lounge - Charlotte, NC, United States. The Old Thymey. Bourbon, orange &amp; thyme.

YxH2SkXCh0GNSOf9sbgvSA.text: The word pisces comes from a Latin word meaning fishes. And it's also one of the zodiac signs - shaped like a fish.   Pisces Sushi Bar & Lounge has lots of jelly fishes in a tank. The interesting thing is that these jelly fishes shrink as they age and by the time they die, they're almost unrecognizable with naked eyes. Fortunately, these wonderful folks at Pisces will get new jellies once they all die out, which takes only a few months. I had no idea they only live for a few months.  Anyway, let's talk about their food and service. The people who work there are really nice and friendly. I asked a bunch of questions about their food, and stared at their jelly fish for some time, and they were totally fine with it. In fact, they came up to me and just sharing all these wonderful information about the amazing creatures that we call jelly fish!  Seriously though, there's a lot more going on there than just the jelly fish tank. Their miso soup is really good. I mean authentic northeast Asian, made-for-cold-winters, proper doenjang, miso. I went there not knowing they had extended their restaurant week menu so I got to try their gyoza and loco moco for $30. And they were both on point. Gyozas are supposed to be thin, a bit chewy, with marinaded meat inside. Those warm apps all passed the test. Loco moco was alright too. Their large, moist, and chewy rice hit home hard. Be careful though. It's really hot.  Oh, the place looks really small from outside but they have more tables hidden inside on both sides of the restaurant so be bold and open that door for your East Asian culinary experience.

QMSjXXYRmhHPITpTv4fu5w.text: It was my first visit, everything was fantastic! Our waitress Chelsea was amazing, she even told us about the discount we would get checking into yelp. We had edamame first, hard to mess up.  Then we shared tempura onion, sweet potato, broccoli and zucchini.  Amazing! I had sushi something called the "O", it was great.  My friend had garlic noodles and hibachi broccoli and zucchini, she was happy with it.  We would both go back.

fT2HDjoJ5GMd4fkqBvRlFA.text: Yum, yum, yum! I was skeptical cause I'm not big on Japanese cuisine but I'm so glad I gave it a try. I had a sampling of all the apps and they were all great. My favorite was the spring rolls. So crunchy! All the sauces were flavorful and perfect accompaniments as well. For the entree I got the hibachi Chicken and Shrimp. More food than I could eat in two days! I have to go back to try the Thai Salad.

photos.caption: Photo of Pisces Sushi Bar & Lounge - Charlotte, NC, United States. Hibachi Chicken and Shrimp with garlic noodles

pNZ3rKWW53MVRURlIT-EBQ.text: Amazing and fresh what's not to like. Service was on point never had a empty glass. I tried 11 different fish all of which where high quality will be back for sure

-lLdIRu1vBrQBmevCxhr1w.text: Took a while for a server to talk to us but they made up for it with edamame on the house. Calamari was not my favorite (I prefer it to be more tentacle like) but the dragon roll and shellfish bastard roll were AMAZING! The Eagle down south was also an excellent take on an old fashioned (a little sweeter which I enjoyed).

CtEWY_gkDqlksGMIHHCZUg.text: I was hesitant to try Pisces after reading the luke warm reviews on yelp, but I'm really glad I did.  First of all, the interior and ambiance is elegant, but comfortable.  We were seated in a booth in the back and tended to immediately by our server.  We ordered a handful of rolls to share for the table which were delicious and fresh tasting.  All of us kept saying how impressed we were with the quality and flavor profiles.  Top that off with an affordable bottle of white and we had ourselves a lovely evening.  Thanks Pisces!

l19ykG5yrFotDnYP88q0Og.text: WOW! I cannot write enough great things about this sushi place. The atmosphere was great but the service was the most unbelievable part. The owner was extremely sweet and attentive, always checking up on how the meal went....The sushi was so well priced and tasted amazing. Great specialty rolls. To top it off, I had the BEST drinks of my life that I am still drooling over by Charlottes #1 mixologist who calls himself "Bob the Bartender". At the end of the night, I was completely taken aback when a bill was never brought and our drinks were complimentary.   I have never experienced a better staff and such a generous, kind owner. I am new in Charlotte and the experience at Pisces has made me love it here even more! I will definitely be going to Pisces all of the time...

iKggcXvQUngGzc0MhPYlDg.text: This is a great date spot, but be ready to drop $100 for three rolls to split. The sushi is delicious... My best recommendation would be the Bobcats roll (and I don't usually like eel sauce). Other suggestions: Scorpio & Metro. Overall atmosphere is upscale trendy and they take reservations, even Saturday nights. Bonus: Wednesday wine bottles are half off.

WBuTnKGYHBnKANT9_Eoy7A.text: I was very pleasantly surprised by the quality and freshness of the sushi. The lunch special rolls are indeed small with only 4 pieces, as the previous review noted, so you may have to order more to fill you up. The eel hand roll was delicious and not overly drenched with unagi sauce like so many restaurants like to do. They do a great job with the sushi rice, which combined with fresh ingredients and clean preparations left me very pleased with the meal. It is a good place to dine alone for a business dinner either at a table or at the small bar. Very reasonable for a casual dinner in a nice environment. Parking is easy.

nvlJA1PwmXtXS2bn9sFylg.text: Are you looking for the best sushi in Charlotte with the best service, a fantastic drink list, extremely reasonable prices and also a fantastic ambiance?! Look no further than Pisces Sushi Bar and Lounge. This place is truly amazing after two delightful visits.  On our first visit, we had a reservation and were seating immediately near the sushi bar. Our server was prompt and could answer all of our questions. The appetizers were incredible. I highly recommend the crab dumplings, that are basically just crab rangoons, and the fried eggplant, which is soft, succulent and amazing. The sushi selection is great and VERY reasonably priced. They even have an amazing selection of veggie sushi for the less adventurous (me). The asparagus and avocado are particularly delish. The cocktails are also amazing. The Kiwi something-or-other was so good I had two (thank goodness for designated drivers)!  On our second visit, we took friends from out of town to show off how fancy Charlotte is. I hoped that our second visit would be as good as the first and boy oh boy! was it ever! When we arrived, without  a reservation (tsk tsk), a group of about 6 people were leaving because they were told the wait was an hour and a half. We didn't have a backup plan, so we decided to wait it out. After getting a drink and standing at the bar for about 25 minutes, we were seated! The hostesses kept us posted on what was going on all the while and were just delightful. We were seated along the wall VERY close to the tables next to us. This turned out to be fortuitous as they recommended a few things we loved and were fun and friendly! Again, the sushi was fresh and delicious and our server was wonderful and tolerated out excitement.   While this is already a lengthy post, I would like to note my favorite thing about Pisces: the size of the sushi. One of the things that really puts me off about sushi is how gosh-darn big it is! I can hardly chew it all in one bite! Pisces sushi is of manageable size, but it seems like you get more pieces than you normally would to make up for the skinnier rolls. I guess some people might find this to be a flaw, but it's the reason I will keep going back.  Now, stop reading this incredibly lengthy review and get to chowing on some delicious sushi!

rOT077h_5bjBbzQ-bsHzCA.text: My friend and I decided to check this place out on a Sunday dinner. The hostess told us that we can get buy one get one free sushi and half price appetizer.  Only for our waitress told us that it's a lie! We only can get half price appetizer.   We decided to get the calamari and tuna tataki. We both got a couple rolls. All of them are uneventful.   Buuut.... they really leave you alone. My friend and I had a great conversation for hours and the waitress keep refilling our water glasses.    Yea... most likely not coming back comparing the price and quality of food.

9yTqXExcxFHhdi5P9GjBtQ.text: Pisces is one of the newer sushi additions to the saturated sushi market. Since there are so many suzuki restaurants ithin 2 miles, it really needed to add something different and special. I would give Pisces 3.5 stars.  Pisces was the last restaurant I visited in Metropolitan so I expected a grand up fit like Vivace. Other than the cool "cubbyhole" booths for larger parties (6?) I was not a fan of the layout. We ate at a table for 2 along the back wall but really had dinner with the 2 couples on either side of us since we were all lined up and so close. One couple was having an awkward first or second date, and I thought I left those behind when I got married, but it all came back so vividly.  I did like the stones inset in the sushi bar. The good news is I would be comfortable going in dressed in jeans and a t-shirt, whereas I might not at Nikko's or Enso.  The food wasn't quite as expensive as we thought it might be. The menu isn't gigantic but had a couple interesting rolls. We especially liked the XOXO roll.  Their miso soup is really really good.  They have a fun drink list (I dig the cucumber martini) that's worth exploring.  Our other neighbors (not on a first date) ordered the Love Boat which was $50 but was HUGE and very fun and festive and they enjoyed it. That said, it was way too much sushi for 2 people, so get it for a group.  I am happy to report that the service was excellent.    Bottom line: good reliable place to get sushi in the neighborhood. Not a standout, but no major complaints. I will try the all you can eat buffet.

KZUHX6QvJ1wRTmMtAXgRjg.text: Food was good, but had a couple issues with service.  We used a Groupon, so they informed us we couldn't take advantage of the half price drink specials they were having.  Ok fine, next time I'll go to the bar and get a few drinks first, and close the check then get a table.    The real issue was the price for beer stated 275 for domestics, yet when they brought the check, she had charged me 4 each.  Her explanation was that it was a premium beer (Flat Tire) so had to charge the import price, and that it was listed on the menu wrong.  We were late for an event, so even though the menu had it plainly listed as 275, right next to the name of the beer.  She wouldn't go have it fixed, so I left it up to her to get the difference, and to consider it her tip.  Going there again soon, and not leaving until they fix the menu, or charge me the stated price this time.

o-OBJOvk8IWT6csYLMXV7Q.text: Another sushi bar in Charlotte, ok, sure, I'll bite!   Never one to turn down any sushi experience, hubs and I rolled into Pisces to grab a quick, light dinner. The interior is modern, but more casual (and a bit smaller) than I anticipated. Regardless, we were seated right away and greeted within minutes. Our server was quite friendly and offered a few roll suggestions when asked. The sushi menu is pretty extensive, but at least half of the rolls have either cream cheese or some fried element in them. Not my favorite types - I prefer fresh fish and spices to cream cheese and fried goodness. At least in my sushi.   Soy paper is available for $1, which is a nice addition for those who aren't seaweed fans. Hubs and I tried just two rolls, the First Love - crab, avocado, shrimp, mango, and the Rainbow Roll - California roll with assorted fresh fish on top. Both rolls were well-made and the fish was supremely fresh. Overall, the rolls are priced fairly all around.   I read about the $9 All You Can Eat sushi lunch buffet and I'd definitely like to check that out when my tummy's a-rumblin'.

tomCgpa_SKiehR3beqbmQQ.text: Went here a couple of weeks ago and it was pretty good. I tried the dynamite roll and a basic spicy shrimp roll. I am not a huge sushi eater but I can't complain! The only thing that really annoyed me was the container holding soy sauce was prettier than it was practical; you could not pour soy sauce out without spilling it all over the table! And it wasn't just me - every person at our table had the same problem! Then, on top of that, either my little "bowl" for soy sauce was dirty, or something weird came out of the soy sauce itself, but it was not fit for eating and I had to use the big saucer instead - haha, I am sure I looked ridiculous, but whatever! When the waitress noticed, she was very nice about it and told me I should have told her so she could get me another small "bowl." She's right, but I didn't make a big deal about it (because honestly it's not a big deal) and I was ok using my big saucer. Anyway, overall it was ok and I'm sure I'll go back.

Fef49GhdatzbHTfIIGXXwA.text: Fast food, great sushi, great atmosphere. Been looking for a good sushi spot since I moved here several months ago. This place is by far the best that I've come across since I've been here.

irmXRVoX6KwjnnQd9pGW4g.text: The crystal veg is a great roll! Can be pretty loud but very good sushi. love the little cave like booths in the back. Great for 4 people.

36QdhnZqyHagjqeVwfdTQQ.text: My now-husband and I had our rehearsal dinner here a few weeks ago. This is one of our favorite spots and we were excited to share it with our friends and family. Brian, one of the owners, was awesome and worked with us to create a menu that we loved. We rented out the private room and had our own private bar and bathroom. The staff was great - everyone was super helpful. And the best part? We got raving reviews from all of our friends and family! Would definitely recommend to anyone for a great date night spot or even a private event!

0vxg0_9Ox7rpHIkuof3kBQ.text: 3.5 Stars for Pisces.  We tried last night had the Shrimp tempura, spicy atlantic scallops, bobcat roll, dynamite roll, & a crab roll.  The food was fresh, the ambience was great & those back boothes would be fantastic for dates.  The Bobcat roll had some sweetness to it, the crab roll was pretty standard, & the dynamite roll could have used a bit more spice.    Overall, will be going back to try the all you can eat lunch options.

OesVNrls6EaflFTWGJS3tg.text: Love this place! Went for a date night and sat at the bar for dinner/drinks. Perfect. A really cool atmosphere and located close to Epicenter. Prices are comparable to other sushi restaurants.

4ytEOrkyBK1Qah6T1JTihg.text: We were hosting some out of town friends from college and wanted to take them somewhere hip but not highty-tighty-ish. The feel of Pisces was the perfect spot. We got there after 10 PM on a Saturday so there was a good size crowd, but we were acknowledged quickly and seated immediately. Our waiter was very nice and pointed out her favorites on the very extensive menu. I had the Bobcats roll which was very nice. The combination of the tempura crunchiness with the crab and shrimp was great with the eel mayo sauce.   The hubs had a caterpillar roll that I sampled and that also tasted good. B/c we were heading to a club later, we had some house sake that put me on my butt! That bad boy was strong, but drinkable and left me in a nice vibe for Whiskey River.   All in all, I enjoyed Pisces and will definitely go back and try some dessert. Only downer was compared to other sushi spots, our food took too long.

Q1AT0uAKNQqsH-5nYpgP0w.text: Dropped in with a friend and got the $11.95 lunch special of all you can eat sushi. The restaurant was very clean and modern. We were the fist customers since we got there around 11:30am right when they opened. They gave us a one sheet menu and the waitress said that the all you can eat sushi applied to the top portion of the menu. It included about two dozen different types of rolls, nigiri and some kitchen items like garlic noodles, fried rice and spring rolls.   We ordered about six different rolls.  The rolls are pretty small you get about four pieces per roll. They bring it to your table on a large platter so that you'll share amongst yourselves.  The sushi was very fresh and delicious.  We also ordered the spring rolls and garlic noodles which were both excellent.    Overall I really enjoyed lunch and our waitress was very helpful in offering suggestions. For under $15 for a nice lunch including tip it was a nice treat. We will be back for sure!    One thing to keep in mind... don't order too much because they will charge you additional if you leave a lot of leftover sushi on your plate. The waitress informed us of this before we even ordered.

iHR9_J8nBABw_AXZaXMl_A.text: Our friends threw a surprise engagement party for myself and my fiance at PIsces. This was my first time here, and i was very happy with how everything turned out. They were very accommodating for our large group, and the staff was great. I enjoyed the food very much as well. I couldn't tell you anything about the menu or prices because I did not pay for anything or order anything specific since it was a big party, but I can tell you the atmosphere was great. I plan on going back again next time we go out for sushi. Thanks Pisces for making a great party for us and our out of town guests!

BTSj5AsXdilByC7UHKcueA.text: Tried for Queen's Feast. Decent enough and waitstaff was good. Even got wine with our price-fixed menu which I thought was nice. In accessible location with plenty of parking.

2WemD_TERMjBmqkCgg5Gew.text: Love the location, love the atmosphere, loved eating at the bar where the guy to girl ratio was 4-1. Defiantly aimed toward the younger crowd.

ALGZqqzZjYF6iK_7AkAM4g.text: I brought all my friends with me to check out this sushi bar. It's very lounge-like. However, we went on the weekend-- so we didn't have time to enjoy the $14 dollar all you can eat sushi... which I would have appreciated to know very very much!   I'll definitely come back during the week with my boyfriend. Love this place!

DXAKYEIdgisvI-jrSw3u2Q.text: Very fresh and delish food.  Server was very helpful to the point of being chatty, LOL.  you could really tell your food was right off a boat. The booth area needs some serious decorating upgrades. They are like black caves where you may never be heard from again.  Maybe add a little color, cut out the openings so you don't risk getting a concussion? other than that, a nice night.

dnGo3SK2x_cmuMgkVTZQVw.text: food is solid and affordable.  The service is very slow, making this place almost impossible to go to.  We got seated quickly for lunch but ordering, waiting on food and paying took forever.

2Z6oyr8vNZs742jnfSJiVw.text: Went here for a birthday dinner with seven other diners. Overall, I was pleased.   The atmosphere is pretty nice. We were in the other room from where you walk in. It's very dark in the restaurant, but the decor is nice. It exudes a kind of clubby vibe.  Our server was on it. She totally knew what she was doing. We didn't have to wait for anything, which was great -- especially for our larger group.  I had a mixed drink and a prosecco. For food, I ordered vegetable, pan-fried gyoza, seaweed salad, an avocado roll, and a crab stick roll. I liked everything, but I didn't love it. The gyoza was the best thing. I was glad to have a vegetarian option, as I'm trying to limit my intake of mammals at this time. The seaweed salad was fine. I prefer Yama's. I did not care for the sushi rolls. These had way too much rice. I felt like I was just eating a wad of rice with a crumb of avocado and/or crab stick. It didn't have much flavor. I've never seen this type of roll with rice on the outside and the inside. It was supposed to be maki (seaweed | rice | filling).  Anyway, we had a nice time overall, and that was what really mattered that night. I wish we could give half points on Yelp! This was more of a 3.5.

G2IHD9XDWKm0F5Ombyhqqw.text: Great sushi!  Great service. Great atmosphere. They have real nice private seating that you should try out for date night.     Also - the 100%best shrimp sauce !

yYBMYxsoUMUjkxxxKYbHXw.text: Me and my family decided to try Pisces Sushi Restaurant based on the "excellent" reviews. The restaurant has a decent atmosphere, nothing extravagant. The service was very prompt. However, the sushi was horrible. Considering that my husband and I are sushi conissures, this place lacks quality. The salmon and various meats are NOT fresh, compared to other restaurants that we have visited in other cities. Needless to say, we will NEVER patron this restaurant again! Definitely not worth the price!!!!!

wL2a6vMYNbyMiCXgrVWoAQ.text: I Love Pisces! I go there for lunch all the time and the sushi always tastes amazing! The place looks very cool.

u2rKlUIe9jnXW7LO0RUYmw.text: After dealing with the parking purgatory that makes up parking at the Metropolitan, I was primed to have an unpleasant experience at Pisces. However, after the quick seating and explanation of the made-to-order lunch, I was happily satisfied!  First off, let it be known that to call this sushi lunch a "buffet" is a misnomer. While many buffets conjurer up visions of dueling tongs among heated troughs, every item on the lunch buffet is made to order. For $12. That is ridiculousness.    Not only does this result in freshly made sushi, noodles, and spring rolls, but it also saves you the precious calories of having to walk to a buffet line--they bring the food to you. Each person can order 10 items at any given time, but you may have to pay for any wasted food, so do try to contain yourself.  So, what are some of the top picks?  - The garlic noodles are simple in their amazing: imagine those thick chow mien noodles lightly fried with garlic. It sounds good, but tastes even better.   - The spring rolls: holy cow, these are fired to flaky perfection and served with a sweat and spicy dipping sauce. What is not to like?  - Fried rice: I am a sucker for cuttings of veggies, egg, and rice fried with soy sauce. Just be careful not to fill up on the carbs. Hold out for the main course!  - Frankly, all of the copious rolls that I had were delicious. The best part is that they do NOT pad the roll with lots of rice to trick your stomach into being full. A thin respectable layer of rice and seaweed is the only think between you and your filling of choice.   - While I love that they have multiple veggie options: asparagus, avocado, cucumber, and tamago (egg), they are in need of a One Veggie Roll. One Roll to bring them all together and in the seaweed bind them (LoTR? Anyone?).   - The non-veggie rolls are also solid, ranging from the spicy, the cream cheesed, and the fried. I don't tend to eat fish, but I did (secretly) enjoy my bagel roll!  Bottom line, if you are jonesing for a LOT of freshly-made sushi, come here for lunch!

ecMUqf6FgBncO6WgV7sxuA.text: We had dinner here on Saturday night and it was a great experience! They even made a roll that used to be on their menu but hadn't been for a long time! Both manager and server were excellent! Thanks so much for the great experience!

QD5MSshAPEeIJcyEhSYL-A.text: Hey Pisces,  Please get your shit together and update the menu on your website. If not, that's fine but please tell whoever is taking to go orders to have patience when a customer orders something that isn't on the current menu. She talked to me like I was an idiot because she didn't know what I was ordering....and I was ordering off your menu.   Your food needs great to put up with that, and it wasn't.

86_XmqEcWao91YmgmL14CA.text: Chelsea is an amazing server and so customer friendly.  She remembered us from the last time we were there-even remembering what we ordered!!

L8cSoQcGJJc92aHO70bj_Q.text: Food was good... waitress was good,  all you can eat Sushi for $10 for like 3 hrs I was all in.... only two things Id say needed to be corrected was they needed Tamari and I felt rushed....

UDV9xYMP-zjaHILG7WVnqA.text: I was here a couple of months ago from NYC and loved the sushi and the happy hour. I made it a point to come back on this trip, and it was even better than the first time, thanks to our wonderful server, Andrea. She was so sweet and so helpful and just and gave us SPECTACULAR service. I really hope next time she is our server, again! You should ask for her, if you come here!

E8m8lFJoM90xDicTgWIcAQ.text: Cool Modern feel. Awesome Sushi. Live music was fantastic. Being foodies, my fiance and I have made the rounds in Charlotte since moving here from Austin this year. This is not only our favorite sushi spot, but one of our favorite restaurants. Definitely worth checking out. We'll be back soon!

C3LJoFHkfIJj0OKqJLcY3A.text: I wanted sushi for my birthday and had been having difficulty finding a good place since returning to NC from California. This place was wonderful. Our server was fabulous and the meal was just wonderful. We would highly recommend it to others with the caveat that it is a little pricey.

3nH-TIJwe0ldHE6UyVfQTA.text: The A2 appetizer and the spicy garlic edamame are a MUST! The yellow submarine roll is always my favorite, and the little booths/cubbies are romantic for date night.

AQbKHC_DfnZK7VTkud9N1Q.text: I can understand why this place is popp'n: because of the area.  Food was mediocre... or maybe I'm being too nice, I thought the food was flavorless. I had way better at RuSans! High priced sushi because of the area... not because its a "Omg, the food here is AMAZING!"

xrRmKx2JS4PNeRdpOHm_rw.text: The ninety five is ridiculous!! Best sushi I'v had so far. Awesome lunch specials too.

1MQbAGonKT-QhoJu81TkLw.text: I am a chef, and working in the restraurant business and I have to say pisces has amazing sushi. So compliment to the chef, which I know one of the chefs Vang from living in Virginia Beach. The only thing that could be better is the service. When it's busy, the service is great, but when it's slow, the service isn't the best, which doesn't really make since. I would understand if it was busy and the service was bad, but while it's slow, I expect the best service.  But other than that, I still go at least once a week or once every two weeks. The food is amazing, and they have awesome specials.

d1pn5s8MHAY8k1kD7FEE8g.text: Great place for sushi in Charlotte-especially if you are looking for gluten free. The menu is clearly marked with GF items and they have a separate prep area. Just make sure you tell the server what your needs are

jjew_KlxU-tbQRx0D3hSCQ.text: Happy hour review only. Holy cow, I have been missing out. I came here for the 1st time last week since and I wish I had taken advantage of Pisces sooner. They have amazing specials and an all you can eat sushi deal from Mon- Sat!  I walked over after work last week and stumbled upon the half priced sushi and cocktails deal, score! I ordered a couple of grey goose cocktails and a ninety-five roll for $6 each! The ninety five roll was actually really good despite the weirdish chicken included in the roll, maybe its just me but I've never seen a sushi roll with chicken. The roll was also huge, I struggled to finish it. My boyfriend ordered a half order of garlic noodles for $3, also huge, we had to share.  I will definitely be coming back for HH and the all you can eat sushi lunch deal! Cheers.

3mr1jVlm9H_51q4ZIqoKfA.text: Came here for the $10 all you can eat sushi with a work friend. The ambiance is very classy and business casual.   The fried rice is amazing. It's very light and filling- not greasy or heavily slathered in soy sauce. The sushi on the other hand was downright terrible. It mainly consists of rice versus meat. It also wasn't fresh. It tasted like those grab and go sushi trays from bookstores and gas stations (trust me, been there tried that).   I'm always down for sushi at a reasonable price but if you are more adventurous than eating California rolls and shrimp tempura go elsewhere and spend the extra $.

MJPYWKwpkMfE30rdbfa4bA.text: When we want to blow a little extra $ on sushi, we come here. Their sushi is really fresh. Love the pork belly buns. Excellent place to order omakase if you ain't scurred to elevate your sushi palette above basic CALIFORNIA rolls (scoffs).  Another note: This place is fine for kids if you go early.  Another-nother note: If you've only had their sushi buffet, you haven't had the full and real sushi experience. Just like when you only go to a restaurant during restaurant week (scoffs), you get what you pay for. Byeeeee.

I missed the lunch buffet, but was still very satisfied with my Dynamite roll. My husband had the Jumanji roll, and we shared the pineapple rice with our kids! It was a nice little spot for our lunch & convient parking was right across the street! I enjoyed my meal & plan on coming back very soon!

MDMUielXNZZnmiXoXMKvig.text: Please read if you're planning on going. It ends with food poisoning.   Me and my boyfriend have been reading fantastic reviews about this place, so we finally decided to try it for lunch today. Upon first walking in, the two girls waiting to seat people, (yes, two people, ten minutes after they opened, on a Sunday, to SEAT people) had sour looks on their faces, and acted like it was an inconvenience to even seat us. With only three couples in the obnoxiously trying to be fancy 'dining' part of the weird bar/sushi theme they have going, obviously trying to make believe they were in Manhattan, they sat us at a table a foot away from another couple, instead of the other 10 empty seats not directly next to someone. It seemed weird, the girls were rude, but we let it slide. The waitress came over, had the same sour look on her face, and took our order. We ordered off the all you can eat sushi menu, since that was the only menu we were given. We ordered one of every appetizer (there were 5), and I got the sweet potato roll and two avocado rolls. My boyfriend got a california roll and a shrimp tempura roll. The 'appetizers' we got were probably the best part. One was noodles in soy sauce. One was a ball of rice. One was a spring roll that tasted like it came straight out of a cheap Chinese take out place, one was pork gyoza (i didn't eat this, but my boyfriend said it was so so), and last but not least, 'fried wontons' which was really just those little strip Chinese take outs gives you on the side of your soup, with a side of Chinese take out sauce to dip in. Whatever, we ignored it, it's only $11 for the all you can eat each and the garlic noodles weren't bad. Then the horrid thing they call sushi came out. They looked like they had been cut in half and smashed. The sweet potato roll was literally just baked sweet potato chunks wrapped in rice. I don't know if any of you have ever had sweet potato rolls, but the sweet potato part is always tempura, and it is always drizzled in a dark brown sauce. Whether you are in Pennsylvania, NYC, Charlotte, or California, that is how a roll is. That was terrible as is. Then the avocado rolls, which was 1/7th avocado, 6/7th rice.   Then to my boyfriends. The Shrimp was cold in the middle, fried on the outside, and the crap tasted like fake canned crab.   We finished what was in front of us and immediately asked for the check. Our stomachs were still growling because it all was such small portions, and we hadn't eaten yet for the day, but there was not a chance in hell we were eating another bite of this nonsense.   We didn't eat again, because even though we were hungry, we felt sick to our stomachs over just that small amount. The food was coming up for the rest of the day, and we both weren't able to eat again. My boyfriend, having eaten the shrimp and crab, got food poisoning.   I would sooner eat 7/11 sushi over this place ever again. This place is not even worth the $11. If you want ACTUALLY good sushi, go to harris teeter, get the sushi from there (which is whole heartedly 15x better) and sit in the dining area. You'll have a much more pleasant experience.

mgUqJQQRmCcqmIQYUAUTpg.text: First: I don't eat sushi.. so this review is strictly about the other food items.  Pro: spicy edemame is delicious.  Gyoza A+, Miao soup A+.  Hibachi is good, a little bland but, they give you a decent amount of chicken (maybe too much) but it's good for the $16 price tag.  Con: it always smells like a musty bathroom to me in there.. it always seems to be as I'm leaving too.  The "Lounge" area is nice to sit at, however, if you're there for a meal and they sit you at the couch, it's not very comfortable to eat.. so ask to be reseated.

chS-tlGOaRmRadmvMjTT4g.text: All these sushi buffets I've been to in the past few months have been solid, and this one is no exception.  Definitely the cheapest of the three I've been to -- $10 for all you can eat.  You can add $5 to your bill for nigiri, but otherwise you get a selection of 10 or so different kinds of rolls.  Rice, seaweed, and filling, very standard.  Nothing too special, but still good.  Buffet appetizers are garlic lo mein, spring rolls, and fried rice.  You can order other offerings, like special rolls, gyoza, and hibachi outside of the buffet deal.  The service was good, no complaints.  The ambiance is nice, what you'd expect out of uptown Charlotte.  All in all, the reason this gets 4 stars instead of 5 like the other reviews I've given is because the buffet has fewer offerings, and isn't quite as good.  It's still definitely worth a lunch out every now and then.  $10 is a great deal.

hd0NlLp0ENo5vZmERTTnHQ.text: My husband wanted something different so I brought him here. He couldn't decide because he loved the menu so much. Cute atmosphere.

uH5JGCD6ilWH_AAlzLoC4g.text: $10 All You Can Eat sushi?  Yep!  My husband and I came in for the lunch sushi special.  This is a-la-carte- so much better than a buffet!  You can choose whatever rolls you want off the menu that has about 15 choices.  You can also get garlic noodles, fried rice and spring rolls.  For $2 you can add soup and salad.  The garlic noodles were awesome and so were the spring rolls!  We didn't try the rice.  This is definitely worth the price, and tastes fresh.  Service is also fast!  We enjoyed it.

AYuL7mgA12kIGTDQ7UaVqw.text: My 4th time here for All You Can Eat Sushi lunch( Sorry for the delay Pisces!) We were 2 today. seated quickly..I knew the deal so put in an order ASAP..Went with the $5 Nigiri add on, WELL worth it !  Sushi delicious as always, and had some pretty good Gzoya & Spring rolls also..The waitresses are real good about taking your orders, so very little down time between..Place hopping on Saturday around 1:30 pm, AYCE runs till 2:30pm, our waitress stopped by around 2:40 pm to see if we wanted more!!!  Just a great place in a cool location to indulge on one of our favorite eats..I will return!! Highly recommended..

2eOrEQZWtnaZ8PaKUZwQ_g.text: On 12/13 I experienced one of the worst customer service of my life at Pisces sushi and bar.   Arrived at 1126 for a business meeting and was told they open at 1130. Its 40 degrees outside and the parking is difficult. Asked if I could wait Inside for 4 minutes - was rudely told NO please wait outside.  Asked to speak to the manager (a tatted up hipster arrived) and said, " I heard your conversation - wait outside!"   I said, "No Thanks" . Needless to say, I'll not be returning to Pisces again.   Especially with other great Sushi locations in CHARLOTTE such as Yama and Nikko.

BtqaK__6r5A4L6K3eYk76g.text: Enjoyed the atmosphere and sushi happy hour at the bar. Bartender was attentive and the sushi was good. Nice selection and choices on the happy hour menu.

2vPqhVadDK_Wl-4wG0mdJg.text: I just ate at Pisces for lunch and might I say, it was pretty good. I got the $11/person all-you-can-eat sushi buffet. I got the salmon, spicy salmon, avocado w/ eel, yellowtail & jalapeno, salmon w/ avocado, and tuna roll. Even though we ordered a bountiful amount of rolls, the quality of the fish was not tainted, but presentation did suffer a bit. The waitress was pretty friendly, but spoke way too quickly at times.   All in all, it was my 2nd time going and this time, it was a better experience.   I would say if you want to cheaply try them out, go during lunch for the $11.00 all-you-eat sushi!   --TrizzyO_o

PNGmMv2rw-8YVifXSGQj0Q.text: First of all, there is an alcohol bar but no sushi bar that you can sit at.  So calling this a sushi bar is not really accurate.  The service was so slow!  There were only 3 tables of people.  The very limited sushi menu was good but nothing out of the ordinary.  Maybe this place was good in the past or maybe we just caught them having a bad night.  Either way we won't be going back.

Dn5O2e06eESACaBzGST5OQ.text: Since I'm a Pisces, I feel a natural pre-disposition to like this place. I got to check the place out on my birthday (March 5th for any inquiring minds) and was so happy with my dinner experience.  Pisces is right across the shopping center containing Marshall's Best Buy and Trader Joe's so you'll have to deal with the gnarly parking garage. I suggest driving up to a higher level, less congestion and speed racers.  The night of my birthday was half-price cocktails (*praise hands emoji*) so I ordered a martini that had pomegranate in it. Forgive me, I completely forget the official name of the drink but it was delicious and smooth. My best friend ordered the cucumber sake martini that was also delicious with a nice cucumber finish.  I ordered the taurus veg and panthers rolls. Not only were they both colorful and pretty to look at, they were so fresh and delicious. No joke, I inhaled both rolls.  The waitstaff was incredibly patient and kind. The manager even came by to check in our meal and wished me a happy birthday! The interior is smaller than I was expecting but creates a nice intimate feel and there is a funky jellyfish tank that you can stare at for hours.  Looking for good sushi and cocktails? stop at Pisces!

photos.caption: Photo of Pisces Sushi Bar & Lounge - Charlotte, NC, United States. Panthers roll (on the left) and Taurus Veg roll

v94i3zzb0bjvqYqEl8vD4w.text: I can't speak to the dinner sushi, but the $10 AYCE lunch is average at best.  Service was good and it's large, modern space, but needs some maintenance.  Our booth's faux leather was torn and pulled away all over.    They do have a wing with about 6 super private booths, like little pods, very cool if you want privacy while dining.

uuSbV_3maPZQ3x6teWyDlQ.text: Parking wasn't that great, but at least there is a large garage across from the restaurant.  I felt our waitress for Charlotte Restaurant Week was friendly, patient, and attentive.  Sushi that I ordered: Crazy and Slamming(?) Salmon, both flavorful with tender crab meat and salmon.  Cookies, fried Oreos, for dessert were moist and only an additional charge of $5.  Even though the restaurant was crowded, it was not loud, and my friend and I were seated in a private booth.  Seems like I'll have to return based on the positive experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Pisces Sushi Bar & Lounge - Charlotte, NC, United States. Sesame Bites Appetizer
Photo of Pisces Sushi Bar & Lounge - Charlotte, NC, United States. Crazy and Slammin&#39; Salmon Rolls

mujnN0nvl56X_BP7uFNc2Q.text: Pisces is one of many Charlotte-area restaurants that suffers from the "Charlotte affect": the ability to serve average food with mediocre service and get away with it because of the barren wasteland that is the Charlotte food scene.  I really should have known judging that the place offers all you can eat sushi for $10, but this place was touted so heavily that I figured I would try it for lunch one day.  I placed my first all you can eat order and waited....and waited...and waited....after 20 minutes, I finally received my first roll. It was actually fairly tasty, but certainly not what I would call high quality sushi. I ordered my second roll and had to wait another 20 minutes. After three rolls (the third took 30 minutes to prepare), I was tired of waiting and just paid and left.  Claiming to offer all you can eat and then forcing customers to wait for unreasonably long times in between orders irks me. Either offer all you can eat or don't.

fPbVPuheGdtlmcfXEYPMOg.text: Came here for my bday during restaurant week. Quality of service sometimes goes down for restaurants at this time but Julian was great. We had the crab dumplings and steak Takati for appetizers. Sushi rolls: lil bastard and slamming salmon were good. Jumbo shrimp hibachi was a huge portion size.

QzoqlFcNuvPQsNYHb0NEkg.text: Service was good and food was delicious . Calamari was fried very light and I didn't like the sauce it came with. The sauce was too sweet. I got the hibachi shrimp and a glass of wine.

photos.caption: Photo of Pisces Sushi Bar & Lounge - Charlotte, NC, United States

TLHsTRiQ747XUHhcARGyyg.text: I'm going to give them 2stars to be fair but if indeed this IS WHERE I GOT FOOD POISONING FROM! It deserves negative stars.. I have been sick all week and I couldn't understand why when my husband (and baby unfortunately) also ate from this place. I, however ordered an extra sushi roll. I won't lie, the food was good at the time I had salmon rolls and a hibachi type of blend where they gave an excess of chicken. But for what I've been through in this last week and now to find out others have gotten food poisoning from this place.. I felt the need to warn others.. just Incase.

SLgwzBsIKCKgPDZfl74fDw.text: So glad we spontaneously decided to go here. Nothing bad to say! We will be back for the amazing brussel sprouts and spicy garlic edamame appetizers- I must recommend the sushi sandwich, it was all the comfort of sushi with a creative twist on ingredients but the sweetheart was definitely a favorite.

nmES52psLx-KjUHtlMSFUQ.text: Probably shouldn't have come here in yoga pants a sweaty mess from cycling. But when you need sushi you need it. We sat at the bar and the bartender was great! Upon the suggestion of other yelpers we started with the brussel sprouts. Do not not get these. They melt in your mouth. I am pretty sure all of the nutritional qualities of brussel spouts are voided but that's fine. Well worth it.   It was hard to narrow down a couple of rolls because everything looked amazing. I love mango in sushi so we got a slammin salmon and we also got a k-pop because fried jalapeno. Both were amazing! Some of the best tasting sushi I have had, you just dont get a lot for the money since they don't do bogo. I am definitely interested in hitting up the all you can eat sushi for lunch one Friday.

photos.caption: Photo of Pisces Sushi Bar & Lounge - Charlotte, NC, United States. Slammin salmon and k-pop

ORmzRYV6MfX_cwXQtKkSIw.text: Went for lunch with my girlfriend. We opt for the all you can eat sushi. Wasn't a bad deal.. we definitely ate our share of sushi. However my girlfriend is gluten intolerant as well as dairy intolerant. Ashley was our server she was more than helpful. Solid menu knowledge. The MOD with curly hair glasses and sleeve of awesome tattoos was also very knowledgeable as well. With their willingness to accommodate allergy needs we had a great experience!! I definitely recommend this place for a great friendly experience.  Thanks guys!

tmukFuQSgMA5c_o5FfI0UQ.text: Very japanese menu with the real stuff and fish flown from all ofer the world. It's all about the textures, the umami combinations and a knowledgeable staff.  The place has a lounge and a restaurant. It wasn't really vibrant when we went but it may be better on a friday night.

TSQ8OUZi8brlwr2WBG1mgw.text: 2.5 stars. Good service and is nice like looking, great for big parties. Decent gyoza. However they omit basic rolls like tuna roll California roll and YT scallion. Sometimes that is what you want not the fancy concoctions. The fish seemed good but the rolls were super bland tasting. Rice had no flavor, zero seasoning on anything. dPYPXhaONaJSnuNwwvskbg.text: Only came here for the cocktails! The decor is really nice and they have some cool booths that are cut into the wall. I love it because the setting was so intimate.  Anyways, I sat at the bar and tried these drinks:  Queen Amidala: This is the first drink I've ever had with olive oil but I didn't mind because it was such a pretty pink color. Wassup B: This drink is very yummy and the coolest part is that it is topped with wasabi foam. If you order it, prepare your upper lip to get a little tingly. 4/5  I would definitely come back here. t7pCz1t_QwRyO11CDBumeA.text: Starting off, the service is good, can't complain. Our server was attentive and nice so good enough for us.   The sushi was okay. A little too much rice in my honest opinion. Then again we are only paying 11 for AYCE sushi so I guess that's why there's more rice than stuffing. We are two rounds, the AYCE rolls are very basic rolls but again, not gonna complain for the price. It was okay over all.   Kitchen items, do not get garlic noodles... very disappointing. Don't get the dumplings, also disappointing.  Sure it was too dumplings and I could smell that pork odor, maybe because it was in the freezer too long or because they left it out to thaw a little bit too long before frying it.  Do get, the spring rolls, that's really good, probably the best thing on kitchen items.   Ambience feels nice, the location is also nice. Love it when I'm in the area. Just traffic is kind of scary. Lol.

6OD3tChXS9kMik0z4_DdKA.text: Pisces is quickly becoming a go-to for sushi in Charlotte. I went once for their all-you-can-eat lunch, and then again last night for dinner. Both times I thoroughly enjoyed the dining experience! Lunch was super busy, but thankfully we were seated in a cute little pod/booth off to the right of the main dining room that was much calmer. The waitress was quick, efficient, and accurate- which speaks volumes because the place was packed and orders were coming in left and right. The rolls for AYCE lunch come in half sizes and are simpler than the regular menu, but they have a nice variety to pick from- my fave was the spicy salmon roll. We also ordered spring rolls, which were tasty, and pork gyoza dumplings, which I loved. The fried rice was okay, but I preferred to save room for sushi :) A tip for lunch: order double rolls and pick maybe 3-4 at a time. They go pretty quickly and it'll prevent you from having to make a bunch of smaller orders. Dinner was really different- the restaurant was much quieter and we were seated in the main dining area. We ordered seven rolls- the XOXO, the Panther, the Spider, the Spicy Tuna, a bagel roll, a California roll, and Like A Vegan. Everything was so fresh and tasty. My favorite was probably the Spicy Tuna, but they were all delicious. I had a cosmo and my date ordered a LIT. They make all their drinks from scratch and my cocktail was head and shoulders above any other cosmo I've had. Usually the cranberry is too overpowering. He was satisfied with his LIT as well. I'd totally come back here for either a casual lunch or cute date night!

photos.caption: Photo of Pisces Sushi Bar & Lounge - Charlotte, NC, United States

cs8sL07dm6Pc4-_LW5eKRA.text: FIRST TIME EATING HERE... Staff was great.  Good was really good... I'm not a big fan of Sushi, but I would send my friends who are here.

JAjrbHgNLWQAJWJbF7xJKw.text: Traveled the whole way from Pittsburgh and this is some of the best sushi.  Do yourself a favor and don't second guess coming here to try it!
